content: 1 O the happiness of that one, who Hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked. And in the way of sinners hath not stood, And in the seat of scorners hath not sat;
content_old: 1 O the happiness of that one, who Hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked. And in the way of sinners hath not stood, And in the seat of scorners hath not sat;

content: 2 But—in the law of Jehovah is his delight, And in His law he doth meditate by day and by night:
content_old: 2 But—in the law of Jehovah is his delight, And in His law he doth meditate by day and by night:

content: 3 And he hath been as a tree, Planted by rivulets of water, That giveth its fruit in its season, And its leaf doth not wither, And all that he doth he causeth to prosper.
content_old: 3 And he hath been as a tree, Planted by rivulets of water, That giveth its fruit in its season, And its leaf doth not wither, And all that he doth he causeth to prosper.

content: 4 Not so the wicked: But—as chaff that wind driveth away!
content_old: 4 Not so the wicked: But—as chaff that wind driveth away!

content: 5 Therefore the wicked rise not in judgment, Nor sinners in the company of the righteous,
content_old: 5 Therefore the wicked rise not in judgment, Nor sinners in the company of the righteous,

content: 1 Why have nations tumultuously assembled? And do peoples meditate vanity?
content_old: 1 Why have nations tumultuously assembled? And do peoples meditate vanity?

content: 2 Station themselves do kings of the earth, And princes have been united together, Against Jehovah, and against His Messiah:
content_old: 2 Station themselves do kings of the earth, And princes have been united together, Against Jehovah, and against His Messiah:

content: 3 ‘Let us draw off Their cords, And cast from us Their thick bands.’
content_old: 3 ‘Let us draw off Their cords, And cast from us Their thick bands.’

content: 4 He who is sitting in the heavens doth laugh, The Lord doth mock at them.
content_old: 4 He who is sitting in the heavens doth laugh, The Lord doth mock at them.

content: 5 Then doth He speak unto them in His anger, And in His wrath He doth trouble them:
content_old: 5 Then doth He speak unto them in His anger, And in His wrath He doth trouble them:

content: 6 ‘And I—I have anointed My King, Upon Zion—My holy hill.’
content_old: 6 ‘And I—I have anointed My King, Upon Zion—My holy hill.’

content: 7 I declare concerning a statute: Jehovah said unto me, ‘My Son Thou art, I to-day have brought thee forth.
content_old: 7 I declare concerning a statute: Jehovah said unto me, ‘My Son Thou art, I to-day have brought thee forth.

content: 8 Ask of Me and I give nations—thy inheritance, And thy possession—the ends of earth.
content_old: 8 Ask of Me and I give nations—thy inheritance, And thy possession—the ends of earth.

content: 9 Thou dost rule them with a sceptre of iron, As a vessel of a potter Thou dost crush them.’
content_old: 9 Thou dost rule them with a sceptre of iron, As a vessel of a potter Thou dost crush them.’

content: 10 And now, O kings, act wisely, Be instructed, O judges of earth,
content_old: 10 And now, O kings, act wisely, Be instructed, O judges of earth,

content: 11 Serve ye Jehovah with fear, And rejoice with trembling.
content_old: 11 Serve ye Jehovah with fear, And rejoice with trembling.

content: 1 A Psalm of David, in his fleeing from the face of Absalom his son. Jehovah, how have my distresses multiplied! Many are rising up against me.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David, in his fleeing from the face of Absalom his son. Jehovah, how have my distresses multiplied! Many are rising up against me.

content: 2 Many are saying of my soul, ‘There is no salvation for him in God.’ Selah.
content_old: 2 Many are saying of my soul, ‘There is no salvation for him in God.’ Selah.

content: 3 And Thou, O Jehovah, art a shield for me, My honour, and lifter up of my head.
content_old: 3 And Thou, O Jehovah, art a shield for me, My honour, and lifter up of my head.

content: 4 My voice is unto Jehovah: I call: And He answereth me from his holy hill, Selah.
content_old: 4 My voice is unto Jehovah: I call: And He answereth me from his holy hill, Selah.

content: 5 I—I have lain down, and I sleep, I have waked, for Jehovah sustaineth me.
content_old: 5 I—I have lain down, and I sleep, I have waked, for Jehovah sustaineth me.

content: 6 I am not afraid of myriads of people, That round about they have set against me.
content_old: 6 I am not afraid of myriads of people, That round about they have set against me.

content: 7 Rise, O Jehovah! save me, my God. Because Thou hast smitten All mine enemies on the cheek. The teeth of the wicked Thou hast broken.
content_old: 7 Rise, O Jehovah! save me, my God. Because Thou hast smitten All mine enemies on the cheek. The teeth of the wicked Thou hast broken.

content: 1 To the Overseer with Stringed Instruments.—A Psalm of David. In my calling answer Thou me, O God of my righteousness. In adversity Thou gavest enlargement to me; Favour me, and hear my prayer.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer with Stringed Instruments.—A Psalm of David. In my calling answer Thou me, O God of my righteousness. In adversity Thou gavest enlargement to me; Favour me, and hear my prayer.

content: 2 Sons of men! till when is my glory for shame? Ye love a vain thing, ye seek a lie. Selah.
content_old: 2 Sons of men! till when is my glory for shame? Ye love a vain thing, ye seek a lie. Selah.

content: 3 And know ye that Jehovah Hath separated a saintly one to Himself. Jehovah heareth in my calling to Him.
content_old: 3 And know ye that Jehovah Hath separated a saintly one to Himself. Jehovah heareth in my calling to Him.

content: 4 ‘Tremble ye, and do not sin;’ Say ye thus in your heart on your bed, And be ye silent. Selah.
content_old: 4 ‘Tremble ye, and do not sin;’ Say ye thus in your heart on your bed, And be ye silent. Selah.

content: 5 Sacrifice ye sacrifices of righteousness, And trust ye unto Jehovah.
content_old: 5 Sacrifice ye sacrifices of righteousness, And trust ye unto Jehovah.

content: 6 Many are saying, ‘Who doth show us good?’ Lift on us the light of Thy face, O Jehovah,
content_old: 6 Many are saying, ‘Who doth show us good?’ Lift on us the light of Thy face, O Jehovah,

content: 7 Thou hast given joy in my heart, From the time their corn and their wine Have been multiplied.
content_old: 7 Thou hast given joy in my heart, From the time their corn and their wine Have been multiplied.

content: 1 To the Overseer, ‘Concerning the Inheritances.’—A Psalm of David. My sayings hear, O Jehovah, Consider my meditation.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, ‘Concerning the Inheritances.’—A Psalm of David. My sayings hear, O Jehovah, Consider my meditation.

content: 2 Be attentive to the voice of my cry, My king and my God, For unto Thee I pray habitually.
content_old: 2 Be attentive to the voice of my cry, My king and my God, For unto Thee I pray habitually.

content: 3 Jehovah, at morning Thou hearest my voice, At morning I set in array for Thee, And I look out.
content_old: 3 Jehovah, at morning Thou hearest my voice, At morning I set in array for Thee, And I look out.

content: 4 For not a God desiring wickedness art Thou, Evil inhabiteth Thee not.
content_old: 4 For not a God desiring wickedness art Thou, Evil inhabiteth Thee not.

content: 5 The boastful station not themselves before Thine eyes: Thou hast hated all working iniquity.
content_old: 5 The boastful station not themselves before Thine eyes: Thou hast hated all working iniquity.

content: 6 Thou destroyest those speaking lies, A man of blood and deceit Jehovah doth abominate.
content_old: 6 Thou destroyest those speaking lies, A man of blood and deceit Jehovah doth abominate.

content: 7 And I, in the abundance of Thy kindness, I enter Thy house, I bow myself toward Thy holy temple in Thy fear.
content_old: 7 And I, in the abundance of Thy kindness, I enter Thy house, I bow myself toward Thy holy temple in Thy fear.

content: 8 O Jehovah, lead me in Thy righteousness, Because of those observing me, Make straight before me Thy way,
content_old: 8 O Jehovah, lead me in Thy righteousness, Because of those observing me, Make straight before me Thy way,

content: 9 For there is no stability in their mouth. Their heart is mischiefs, An open grave is their throat, Their tongue they make smooth.
content_old: 9 For there is no stability in their mouth. Their heart is mischiefs, An open grave is their throat, Their tongue they make smooth.

content: 10 Declare them guilty, O God, Let them fall from their own counsels, In the abundance of their transgressions Drive them away, Because they have rebelled against Thee.
content_old: 10 Declare them guilty, O God, Let them fall from their own counsels, In the abundance of their transgressions Drive them away, Because they have rebelled against Thee.

content: 11 And rejoice do all trusting in Thee, To the age they sing, and Thou coverest them over, And those loving Thy name exult in Thee.
content_old: 11 And rejoice do all trusting in Thee, To the age they sing, and Thou coverest them over, And those loving Thy name exult in Thee.

content: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments, on the octave.—A Psalm of David. O Jehovah, in Thine anger reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments, on the octave.—A Psalm of David. O Jehovah, in Thine anger reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.

content: 2 Favour me, O Jehovah, for I am weak, Heal me, O Jehovah, For troubled have been my bones,
content_old: 2 Favour me, O Jehovah, for I am weak, Heal me, O Jehovah, For troubled have been my bones,

content: 3 And my soul hath been troubled greatly, And Thou, O Jehovah, till when?
content_old: 3 And my soul hath been troubled greatly, And Thou, O Jehovah, till when?

content: 4 Turn back, O Jehovah, draw out my soul, Save me for Thy kindness’ sake.
content_old: 4 Turn back, O Jehovah, draw out my soul, Save me for Thy kindness’ sake.

content: 5 For there is not in death Thy memorial, In Sheol, who doth give thanks to Thee?
content_old: 5 For there is not in death Thy memorial, In Sheol, who doth give thanks to Thee?

content: 6 I have been weary with my sighing, I meditate through all the night on my bed, With my tear my couch I waste.
content_old: 6 I have been weary with my sighing, I meditate through all the night on my bed, With my tear my couch I waste.

content: 7 Old from provocation is mine eye, It is old because of all mine adversaries,
content_old: 7 Old from provocation is mine eye, It is old because of all mine adversaries,

content: 8 Turn from me all ye workers of iniquity, For Jehovah heard the voice of my weeping,
content_old: 8 Turn from me all ye workers of iniquity, For Jehovah heard the voice of my weeping,

content: 9 Jehovah hath heard my supplication, Jehovah my prayer receiveth.
content_old: 9 Jehovah hath heard my supplication, Jehovah my prayer receiveth.

content: 1 ‘The Erring One,’ by David, that he sung to Jehovah concerning the words of Cush a Benjamite. O Jehovah, my God, in Thee I have trusted, Save me from all my pursuers, and deliver me.
content_old: 1 ‘The Erring One,’ by David, that he sung to Jehovah concerning the words of Cush a Benjamite. O Jehovah, my God, in Thee I have trusted, Save me from all my pursuers, and deliver me.

content: 2 Lest he tear as a lion my soul, Rending, and there is no deliverer.
content_old: 2 Lest he tear as a lion my soul, Rending, and there is no deliverer.

content: 3 O Jehovah, my God, if I have done this, If there is iniquity in my hands,
content_old: 3 O Jehovah, my God, if I have done this, If there is iniquity in my hands,

content: 4 If I have done my well-wisher evil, And draw mine adversary without cause,
content_old: 4 If I have done my well-wisher evil, And draw mine adversary without cause,

content: 5 An enemy pursueth my soul, and overtaketh, And treadeth down to the earth my life, And my honour placeth in the dust. Selah.
content_old: 5 An enemy pursueth my soul, and overtaketh, And treadeth down to the earth my life, And my honour placeth in the dust. Selah.

content: 6 Rise, O Jehovah, in Thine anger, Be lifted up at the wrath of mine adversaries, And awake Thou for me: Judgment Thou hast commanded:
content_old: 6 Rise, O Jehovah, in Thine anger, Be lifted up at the wrath of mine adversaries, And awake Thou for me: Judgment Thou hast commanded:

content: 7 And a company of peoples compass Thee, And over it on high turn Thou back,
content_old: 7 And a company of peoples compass Thee, And over it on high turn Thou back,

content: 8 Jehovah doth judge the peoples; Judge me, O Jehovah, According to my righteousness, And according to mine integrity on me,
content_old: 8 Jehovah doth judge the peoples; Judge me, O Jehovah, According to my righteousness, And according to mine integrity on me,

content: 9 Let, I pray Thee be ended the evil of the wicked, And establish Thou the righteous, And a trier of hearts and reins is the righteous God.
content_old: 9 Let, I pray Thee be ended the evil of the wicked, And establish Thou the righteous, And a trier of hearts and reins is the righteous God.

content: 10 My shield is on God, Saviour of the upright in heart!
content_old: 10 My shield is on God, Saviour of the upright in heart!

content: 11 God is a righteous judge, And He is not angry at all times.
content_old: 11 God is a righteous judge, And He is not angry at all times.

content: 12 If one turn not, His sword he sharpeneth, His bow he hath trodden—He prepareth it,
content_old: 12 If one turn not, His sword he sharpeneth, His bow he hath trodden—He prepareth it,

content: 13 Yea, for him He hath prepared Instruments of death, His arrows for burning pursuers He maketh.
content_old: 13 Yea, for him He hath prepared Instruments of death, His arrows for burning pursuers He maketh.

content: 14 Lo, he travaileth with iniquity, And he hath conceived perverseness, And hath brought forth falsehood.
content_old: 14 Lo, he travaileth with iniquity, And he hath conceived perverseness, And hath brought forth falsehood.

content: 15 A pit he hath prepared, and he diggeth it, And he falleth into a ditch he maketh.
content_old: 15 A pit he hath prepared, and he diggeth it, And he falleth into a ditch he maketh.

content: 16 Return doth his perverseness on his head, And on his crown his violence cometh down.
content_old: 16 Return doth his perverseness on his head, And on his crown his violence cometh down.

content: 1 To the Overseer, ‘On the Gittith.’ A Psalm of David. Jehovah, our Lord, How honourable Thy name in all the earth! Who settest thine honour on the heavens.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, ‘On the Gittith.’ A Psalm of David. Jehovah, our Lord, How honourable Thy name in all the earth! Who settest thine honour on the heavens.

content: 2 From the mouths of infants and sucklings Thou hast founded strength, Because of Thine adversaries, To still an enemy and a self-avenger.
content_old: 2 From the mouths of infants and sucklings Thou hast founded strength, Because of Thine adversaries, To still an enemy and a self-avenger.

content: 3 For I see Thy heavens, a work of Thy fingers, Moon and stars that Thou didst establish.
content_old: 3 For I see Thy heavens, a work of Thy fingers, Moon and stars that Thou didst establish.

content: 4 What is man that Thou rememberest him? The son of man that Thou inspectest him?
content_old: 4 What is man that Thou rememberest him? The son of man that Thou inspectest him?

content: 5 And causest him to lack a little of Godhead, And with honour and majesty compassest him.
content_old: 5 And causest him to lack a little of Godhead, And with honour and majesty compassest him.

content: 6 Thou dost cause him to rule Over the works of Thy hands, All Thou hast placed under his feet.
content_old: 6 Thou dost cause him to rule Over the works of Thy hands, All Thou hast placed under his feet.

content: 7 Sheep and oxen, all of them, And also beasts of the field,
content_old: 7 Sheep and oxen, all of them, And also beasts of the field,

content: 8 Bird of the heavens, and fish of the sea, Passing through the paths of the seas!
content_old: 8 Bird of the heavens, and fish of the sea, Passing through the paths of the seas!

content: 1 To the Overseer, ‘On the Death of Labben.’—A Psalm of David. I confess, O Jehovah, with all my heart, I recount all Thy wonders,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, ‘On the Death of Labben.’—A Psalm of David. I confess, O Jehovah, with all my heart, I recount all Thy wonders,

content: 2 I rejoice and exult in Thee, I praise Thy Name, O Most High.
content_old: 2 I rejoice and exult in Thee, I praise Thy Name, O Most High.

content: 3 In mine enemies turning backward, they stumble and perish from Thy face.
content_old: 3 In mine enemies turning backward, they stumble and perish from Thy face.

content: 4 For Thou hast done my judgment and my right. Thou hast sat on a throne, A judge of righteousness.
content_old: 4 For Thou hast done my judgment and my right. Thou hast sat on a throne, A judge of righteousness.

content: 5 Thou hast rebuked nations, Thou hast destroyed the wicked, Their name Thou hast blotted out to the age and for ever.
content_old: 5 Thou hast rebuked nations, Thou hast destroyed the wicked, Their name Thou hast blotted out to the age and for ever.

content: 6 O thou Enemy, Finished have been destructions for ever, As to cities thou hast plucked up, Perished hath their memorial with them.
content_old: 6 O thou Enemy, Finished have been destructions for ever, As to cities thou hast plucked up, Perished hath their memorial with them.

content: 7 And Jehovah to the age abideth, He is preparing for judgment His throne.
content_old: 7 And Jehovah to the age abideth, He is preparing for judgment His throne.

content: 8 And He judgeth the world in righteousness, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.
content_old: 8 And He judgeth the world in righteousness, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.

content: 9 And Jehovah is a tower for the bruised, A tower for times of adversity.
content_old: 9 And Jehovah is a tower for the bruised, A tower for times of adversity.

content: 10 They trust in Thee who do know Thy name, For Thou hast not forsaken Those seeking Thee, O Jehovah.
content_old: 10 They trust in Thee who do know Thy name, For Thou hast not forsaken Those seeking Thee, O Jehovah.

content: 11 Sing ye praise to Jehovah, inhabiting Zion, Declare ye among the peoples His acts,
content_old: 11 Sing ye praise to Jehovah, inhabiting Zion, Declare ye among the peoples His acts,

content: 12 For He who is seeking for blood Them hath remembered, He hath not forgotten the cry of the afflicted.
content_old: 12 For He who is seeking for blood Them hath remembered, He hath not forgotten the cry of the afflicted.

content: 13 Favour me, O Jehovah, See mine affliction by those hating me, Thou who liftest me up from the gates of death,
content_old: 13 Favour me, O Jehovah, See mine affliction by those hating me, Thou who liftest me up from the gates of death,

content: 14 So that I recount all Thy praise, In the gates of the daughter of Zion. I rejoice on Thy salvation.
content_old: 14 So that I recount all Thy praise, In the gates of the daughter of Zion. I rejoice on Thy salvation.

content: 15 Sunk have nations in a pit they made, In a net that they hid hath their foot been captured.
content_old: 15 Sunk have nations in a pit they made, In a net that they hid hath their foot been captured.

content: 16 Jehovah hath been known, Judgment He hath done, By a work of his hands Hath the wicked been snared. Meditation. Selah.
content_old: 16 Jehovah hath been known, Judgment He hath done, By a work of his hands Hath the wicked been snared. Meditation. Selah.

content: 17 The wicked do turn back to Sheol, All nations forgetting God.
content_old: 17 The wicked do turn back to Sheol, All nations forgetting God.

content: 18 For not for ever is the needy forgotten, The hope of the humble lost to the age.
content_old: 18 For not for ever is the needy forgotten, The hope of the humble lost to the age.

content: 19 Rise, O Jehovah, let not man be strong, Let nations be judged before Thy face.
content_old: 19 Rise, O Jehovah, let not man be strong, Let nations be judged before Thy face.

content: 1 Why, Jehovah, dost Thou stand at a distance? Thou dost hide in times of adversity,
content_old: 1 Why, Jehovah, dost Thou stand at a distance? Thou dost hide in times of adversity,

content: 2 Through the pride of the wicked, Is the poor inflamed, They are caught in devices that they devised.
content_old: 2 Through the pride of the wicked, Is the poor inflamed, They are caught in devices that they devised.

content: 3 Because the wicked hath boasted Of the desire of his soul, And a dishonest gainer he hath blessed, He hath despised Jehovah.
content_old: 3 Because the wicked hath boasted Of the desire of his soul, And a dishonest gainer he hath blessed, He hath despised Jehovah.

content: 4 The wicked according to the height of his face, inquireth not. ‘God is not!’ are all his devices.
content_old: 4 The wicked according to the height of his face, inquireth not. ‘God is not!’ are all his devices.

content: 5 Pain do his ways at all times, On high are Thy judgments before him, All his adversaries—he puffeth at them.
content_old: 5 Pain do his ways at all times, On high are Thy judgments before him, All his adversaries—he puffeth at them.

content: 6 He hath said in his heart, ‘I am not moved,’ To generation and generation not in evil.
content_old: 6 He hath said in his heart, ‘I am not moved,’ To generation and generation not in evil.

content: 7 Of oaths his mouth is full, And deceits, and fraud: Under his tongue is perverseness and iniquity,
content_old: 7 Of oaths his mouth is full, And deceits, and fraud: Under his tongue is perverseness and iniquity,

content: 8 He doth sit in an ambush of the villages, In secret places he doth slay the innocent. His eyes for the afflicted watch secretly,
content_old: 8 He doth sit in an ambush of the villages, In secret places he doth slay the innocent. His eyes for the afflicted watch secretly,

content: 9 He lieth in wait in a secret place, as a lion in a covert. He lieth in wait to catch the poor, He catcheth the poor, drawing him into his net.
content_old: 9 He lieth in wait in a secret place, as a lion in a covert. He lieth in wait to catch the poor, He catcheth the poor, drawing him into his net.

content: 10 He is bruised—he boweth down, Fallen by his mighty ones hath the afflicted.
content_old: 10 He is bruised—he boweth down, Fallen by his mighty ones hath the afflicted.

content: 11 He said in his heart, ‘God hath forgotten, He hath hid His face, He hath never seen.’
content_old: 11 He said in his heart, ‘God hath forgotten, He hath hid His face, He hath never seen.’

content: 12 Arise, O Jehovah! O God, lift up Thy hand! Forget not the humble.
content_old: 12 Arise, O Jehovah! O God, lift up Thy hand! Forget not the humble.

content: 13 Wherefore hath the wicked despised God? He hath said in his heart, ‘It is not required.’
content_old: 13 Wherefore hath the wicked despised God? He hath said in his heart, ‘It is not required.’

content: 14 Thou hast seen, For Thou perverseness and anger beholdest; By giving into Thy hand, On Thee doth the afflicted leave it, Of the fatherless Thou hast been an helper.
content_old: 14 Thou hast seen, For Thou perverseness and anger beholdest; By giving into Thy hand, On Thee doth the afflicted leave it, Of the fatherless Thou hast been an helper.

content: 15 Break the arm of the wicked and the evil, Seek out his wickedness, find none;
content_old: 15 Break the arm of the wicked and the evil, Seek out his wickedness, find none;

content: 16 Jehovah is king to the age, and for ever, The nations have perished out of His land!
content_old: 16 Jehovah is king to the age, and for ever, The nations have perished out of His land!

content: 17 The desire of the humble Thou hast heard, O Jehovah. Thou preparest their heart; Thou causest Thine ear to attend,
content_old: 17 The desire of the humble Thou hast heard, O Jehovah. Thou preparest their heart; Thou causest Thine ear to attend,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By David. In Jehovah I trusted, how say ye to my soul, ‘They moved to Thy mountain for the bird?
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By David. In Jehovah I trusted, how say ye to my soul, ‘They moved to Thy mountain for the bird?

content: 2 For lo, the wicked tread a bow, They have prepared their arrow on the string, To shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
content_old: 2 For lo, the wicked tread a bow, They have prepared their arrow on the string, To shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.

content: 3 When the foundations are destroyed, The righteous—what hath he done?
content_old: 3 When the foundations are destroyed, The righteous—what hath he done?

content: 4 ‘Jehovah is in his holy temple: Jehovah—in the heavens is His throne. His eyes see—His eyelids try the sons of men.
content_old: 4 ‘Jehovah is in his holy temple: Jehovah—in the heavens is His throne. His eyes see—His eyelids try the sons of men.

content: 5 Jehovah the righteous doth try. And the wicked and the lover of violence, Hath His soul hated,
content_old: 5 Jehovah the righteous doth try. And the wicked and the lover of violence, Hath His soul hated,

content: 6 He poureth on the wicked snares, fire, and brimstone, And a horrible wind is the portion of their cup.
content_old: 6 He poureth on the wicked snares, fire, and brimstone, And a horrible wind is the portion of their cup.

content: 1 To the Overseer, on the octave.—A Psalm of David. Save, Jehovah, for the saintly hath failed, For the stedfast have ceased From the sons of men:
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, on the octave.—A Psalm of David. Save, Jehovah, for the saintly hath failed, For the stedfast have ceased From the sons of men:

content: 2 Vanity they speak each with his neighbour, Lip of flattery! With heart and heart they speak.
content_old: 2 Vanity they speak each with his neighbour, Lip of flattery! With heart and heart they speak.

content: 3 Jehovah doth cut off all lips of flattery, A tongue speaking great things,
content_old: 3 Jehovah doth cut off all lips of flattery, A tongue speaking great things,

content: 4 Who said, ‘By our tongue we do mightily: Our lips are our own; who is lord over us?’
content_old: 4 Who said, ‘By our tongue we do mightily: Our lips are our own; who is lord over us?’

content: 5 Because of the spoiling of the poor, Because of the groaning of the needy, Now do I arise, saith Jehovah, I set in safety him who doth breathe for it.
content_old: 5 Because of the spoiling of the poor, Because of the groaning of the needy, Now do I arise, saith Jehovah, I set in safety him who doth breathe for it.

content: 6 Sayings of Jehovah are pure sayings; Silver tried in a furnace of earth refined sevenfold.
content_old: 6 Sayings of Jehovah are pure sayings; Silver tried in a furnace of earth refined sevenfold.

content: 7 Thou, O Jehovah, dost preserve them, Thou keepest us from this generation to the age.
content_old: 7 Thou, O Jehovah, dost preserve them, Thou keepest us from this generation to the age.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Till when, O Jehovah, Dost Thou forget me?—for ever? Till when dost Thou hide Thy face from me?
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Till when, O Jehovah, Dost Thou forget me?—for ever? Till when dost Thou hide Thy face from me?

content: 2 Till when do I set counsels in my soul? Sorrow inn my heart daily? Till when is mine enemy exalted over me?
content_old: 2 Till when do I set counsels in my soul? Sorrow inn my heart daily? Till when is mine enemy exalted over me?

content: 3 Look attentively; Answer me, O Jehovah, my God, Enlighten mine eyes, lest I sleep in death,
content_old: 3 Look attentively; Answer me, O Jehovah, my God, Enlighten mine eyes, lest I sleep in death,

content: 4 Lest mine enemy say, ‘I overcame him,’ Mine adversaries joy when I am moved.
content_old: 4 Lest mine enemy say, ‘I overcame him,’ Mine adversaries joy when I am moved.

content: 5 And I, in Thy kindness I have trusted, Rejoice doth my heart in Thy salvation.
content_old: 5 And I, in Thy kindness I have trusted, Rejoice doth my heart in Thy salvation.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By David. A fool hath said in his heart, ‘God is not;’ They have done corruptly, They have done abominable actions, There is not a doer of good.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By David. A fool hath said in his heart, ‘God is not;’ They have done corruptly, They have done abominable actions, There is not a doer of good.

content: 2 Jehovah from the heavens Hath looked on the sons of men, To see if there is a wise one—seeking God.
content_old: 2 Jehovah from the heavens Hath looked on the sons of men, To see if there is a wise one—seeking God.

content: 3 The whole have turned aside, Together they have been filthy: There is not a doer of good, not even one.
content_old: 3 The whole have turned aside, Together they have been filthy: There is not a doer of good, not even one.

content: 4 Have all working iniquity not known? Those consuming my people have eaten bread, Jehovah they have not called.
content_old: 4 Have all working iniquity not known? Those consuming my people have eaten bread, Jehovah they have not called.

content: 5 There they have feared a fear, For God is in the generation of the righteous.
content_old: 5 There they have feared a fear, For God is in the generation of the righteous.

content: 6 The counsel of the poor ye cause to stink, Because Jehovah is his refuge.
content_old: 6 The counsel of the poor ye cause to stink, Because Jehovah is his refuge.

content: 1 A Psalm of David. Jehovah, who doth sojourn in Thy tent? Who doth dwell in Thy holy hill?
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David. Jehovah, who doth sojourn in Thy tent? Who doth dwell in Thy holy hill?

content: 2 He who is walking uprightly, And working righteousness, And speaking truth in his heart.
content_old: 2 He who is walking uprightly, And working righteousness, And speaking truth in his heart.

content: 3 He hath not slandered by his tongue, He hath not done to his friend evil; And reproach he hath not lifted up Against his neighbour.
content_old: 3 He hath not slandered by his tongue, He hath not done to his friend evil; And reproach he hath not lifted up Against his neighbour.

content: 4 Despised in his eyes is a rejected one, And those fearing Jehovah he doth honour. He hath sworn to suffer evil, and changeth not;
content_old: 4 Despised in his eyes is a rejected one, And those fearing Jehovah he doth honour. He hath sworn to suffer evil, and changeth not;

content: 1 A Secret Treasure of David. Preserve me, O God, for I did trust in Thee.
content_old: 1 A Secret Treasure of David. Preserve me, O God, for I did trust in Thee.

content: 2 Thou hast said to Jehovah, ‘My Lord Thou art;’ My good is not for thine own sake;
content_old: 2 Thou hast said to Jehovah, ‘My Lord Thou art;’ My good is not for thine own sake;

content: 3 For the holy ones who are in the land, And the honourable, all my delight is in them.
content_old: 3 For the holy ones who are in the land, And the honourable, all my delight is in them.

content: 4 Multiplied are their griefs, Who have hastened backward; I pour not out their libations of blood, Nor do I take up their names on my lips.
content_old: 4 Multiplied are their griefs, Who have hastened backward; I pour not out their libations of blood, Nor do I take up their names on my lips.

content: 5 Jehovah is the portion of my share, and of my cup, Thou—Thou dost uphold my lot.
content_old: 5 Jehovah is the portion of my share, and of my cup, Thou—Thou dost uphold my lot.

content: 6 Lines have fallen to me in pleasant places, Yea, a beauteous inheritance is for me.
content_old: 6 Lines have fallen to me in pleasant places, Yea, a beauteous inheritance is for me.

content: 7 I bless Jehovah who hath counselled me; Also in the nights my reins instruct me.
content_old: 7 I bless Jehovah who hath counselled me; Also in the nights my reins instruct me.

content: 8 I did place Jehovah before me continually, Because—at my right hand I am not moved.
content_old: 8 I did place Jehovah before me continually, Because—at my right hand I am not moved.

content: 9 Therefore hath my heart been glad, And my honour doth rejoice, Also my flesh dwelleth confidently:
content_old: 9 Therefore hath my heart been glad, And my honour doth rejoice, Also my flesh dwelleth confidently:

content: 10 For Thou dost not leave my soul to Sheol, Nor givest thy saintly one to see corruption.
content_old: 10 For Thou dost not leave my soul to Sheol, Nor givest thy saintly one to see corruption.

content: 1 A Prayer of David. Hear, O Jehovah, righteousness, attend my cry, Give ear to my prayer, without lips of deceit.
content_old: 1 A Prayer of David. Hear, O Jehovah, righteousness, attend my cry, Give ear to my prayer, without lips of deceit.

content: 2 From before thee my judgment doth go out; Thine eyes do see uprightly.
content_old: 2 From before thee my judgment doth go out; Thine eyes do see uprightly.

content: 3 Thou hast proved my heart, Thou hast inspected by night, Thou hast tried me, Thou findest nothing; My thoughts pass not over my mouth.
content_old: 3 Thou hast proved my heart, Thou hast inspected by night, Thou hast tried me, Thou findest nothing; My thoughts pass not over my mouth.

content: 4 As to doings of man, Through a word of Thy lips I have observed The paths of a destroyer;
content_old: 4 As to doings of man, Through a word of Thy lips I have observed The paths of a destroyer;

content: 5 To uphold my goings in Thy paths, My steps have not slidden.
content_old: 5 To uphold my goings in Thy paths, My steps have not slidden.

content: 6 I—I called Thee, for Thou dost answer me, O God, incline Thine ear to me, hear my speech.
content_old: 6 I—I called Thee, for Thou dost answer me, O God, incline Thine ear to me, hear my speech.

content: 7 Separate wonderfully Thy kindness, O Saviour of the confiding, By Thy right hand, from withstanders.
content_old: 7 Separate wonderfully Thy kindness, O Saviour of the confiding, By Thy right hand, from withstanders.

content: 8 Keep me as the apple, the daughter of the eye; In shadow of Thy wings thou dost hide me.
content_old: 8 Keep me as the apple, the daughter of the eye; In shadow of Thy wings thou dost hide me.

content: 9 From the face of the wicked who spoiled me. Mine enemies in soul go round against me.
content_old: 9 From the face of the wicked who spoiled me. Mine enemies in soul go round against me.

content: 10 Their fat they have closed up, Their mouths have spoken with pride:
content_old: 10 Their fat they have closed up, Their mouths have spoken with pride:

content: 11 ‘Our steps now have compassed him;’ Their eyes they set to turn aside in the land.
content_old: 11 ‘Our steps now have compassed him;’ Their eyes they set to turn aside in the land.

content: 12 His likeness as a lion desirous to tear, As a young lion dwelling in secret places.
content_old: 12 His likeness as a lion desirous to tear, As a young lion dwelling in secret places.

content: 13 Arise, O Jehovah, go before his face, Cause him to bend. Deliver my soul from the wicked, Thy sword,
content_old: 13 Arise, O Jehovah, go before his face, Cause him to bend. Deliver my soul from the wicked, Thy sword,

content: 14 From men, Thy hand, O Jehovah, From men of the world, their portion is in life, And with Thy hidden things Thou fillest their belly, They are satisfied with sons; And have left their abundance to their sucklings.
content_old: 14 From men, Thy hand, O Jehovah, From men of the world, their portion is in life, And with Thy hidden things Thou fillest their belly, They are satisfied with sons; And have left their abundance to their sucklings.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By a servant of Jehovah, by David, who hath spoken to Jehovah the words of this song in the day Jehovah delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul, and he saith:—I love Thee, O Jehovah, my strength.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By a servant of Jehovah, by David, who hath spoken to Jehovah the words of this song in the day Jehovah delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul, and he saith:—I love Thee, O Jehovah, my strength.

content: 2 Jehovah is my rock, and my bulwark, And my deliverer, My God is my rock, I trust in Him: My shield, and a horn of my salvation, My high tower.
content_old: 2 Jehovah is my rock, and my bulwark, And my deliverer, My God is my rock, I trust in Him: My shield, and a horn of my salvation, My high tower.

content: 3 The ‘Praised One’ I call Jehovah, And from my enemies I am saved.
content_old: 3 The ‘Praised One’ I call Jehovah, And from my enemies I am saved.

content: 4 Compassed me have cords of death, And streams of the worthless make me afraid.
content_old: 4 Compassed me have cords of death, And streams of the worthless make me afraid.

content: 5 Cords of Sheol have surrounded me, Before me have been snares of death.
content_old: 5 Cords of Sheol have surrounded me, Before me have been snares of death.

content: 6 In mine adversity I call Jehovah, And unto my God I cry. He heareth from His temple my voice, And My cry before Him cometh into His ears.
content_old: 6 In mine adversity I call Jehovah, And unto my God I cry. He heareth from His temple my voice, And My cry before Him cometh into His ears.

content: 7 And shake and tremble doth the earth, And foundations of hills are troubled, And they shake—because He hath wrath.
content_old: 7 And shake and tremble doth the earth, And foundations of hills are troubled, And they shake—because He hath wrath.

content: 8 Gone up hath smoke by His nostrils, And fire from His mouth consumeth, Coals have been kindled by it.
content_old: 8 Gone up hath smoke by His nostrils, And fire from His mouth consumeth, Coals have been kindled by it.

content: 9 And He inclineth the heavens, and cometh down, And thick darkness is under His feet.
content_old: 9 And He inclineth the heavens, and cometh down, And thick darkness is under His feet.

content: 10 And He rideth on a cherub, and doth fly, And He flieth on wings of wind.
content_old: 10 And He rideth on a cherub, and doth fly, And He flieth on wings of wind.

content: 11 He maketh darkness His secret place, Round about Him His tabernacle, Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
content_old: 11 He maketh darkness His secret place, Round about Him His tabernacle, Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.

content: 12 From the brightness over-against Him His thick clouds have passed on, Hail and coals of fire.
content_old: 12 From the brightness over-against Him His thick clouds have passed on, Hail and coals of fire.

content: 13 And thunder in the heavens doth Jehovah, And the Most High giveth forth His voice, Hail and coals of fire.
content_old: 13 And thunder in the heavens doth Jehovah, And the Most High giveth forth His voice, Hail and coals of fire.

content: 14 And He sendeth His arrows and scattereth them, And much lightning, and crusheth them.
content_old: 14 And He sendeth His arrows and scattereth them, And much lightning, and crusheth them.

content: 15 And seen are the streams of waters, And revealed are foundations of the earth. From Thy rebuke, O Jehovah, From the breath of the spirit of Thine anger.
content_old: 15 And seen are the streams of waters, And revealed are foundations of the earth. From Thy rebuke, O Jehovah, From the breath of the spirit of Thine anger.

content: 16 He sendeth from above—He taketh me, He draweth me out of many waters.
content_old: 16 He sendeth from above—He taketh me, He draweth me out of many waters.

content: 17 He delivereth me from my strong enemy, And from those hating me, For they have been stronger than I.
content_old: 17 He delivereth me from my strong enemy, And from those hating me, For they have been stronger than I.

content: 18 They go before me in a day of my calamity And Jehovah is for a support to me.
content_old: 18 They go before me in a day of my calamity And Jehovah is for a support to me.

content: 19 And He bringeth me forth to a large place, He draweth me out, because He delighted in me.
content_old: 19 And He bringeth me forth to a large place, He draweth me out, because He delighted in me.

content: 20 Jehovah doth recompense me According to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands, He doth return to me.
content_old: 20 Jehovah doth recompense me According to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands, He doth return to me.

content: 21 For I have kept the ways of Jehovah, And have not done wickedly against my God.
content_old: 21 For I have kept the ways of Jehovah, And have not done wickedly against my God.

content: 22 For all His judgments are before me, And His statutes I turn not from me.
content_old: 22 For all His judgments are before me, And His statutes I turn not from me.

content: 23 And I am perfect with him, And I keep myself from mine iniquity.
content_old: 23 And I am perfect with him, And I keep myself from mine iniquity.

content: 24 And Jehovah doth return to me, According to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands, Over-against his eyes.
content_old: 24 And Jehovah doth return to me, According to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands, Over-against his eyes.

content: 25 With the kind Thou showest Thyself kind, With a perfect man showest Thyself perfect.
content_old: 25 With the kind Thou showest Thyself kind, With a perfect man showest Thyself perfect.

content: 26 With the pure Thou showest Thyself pure, And with the perverse showest Thyself a wrestler,
content_old: 26 With the pure Thou showest Thyself pure, And with the perverse showest Thyself a wrestler,

content: 27 For Thou a poor people savest, And the eyes of the high causest to fall.
content_old: 27 For Thou a poor people savest, And the eyes of the high causest to fall.

content: 28 For Thou—Thou lightest my lamp, Jehovah my God enlighteneth my darkness.
content_old: 28 For Thou—Thou lightest my lamp, Jehovah my God enlighteneth my darkness.

content: 29 For by Thee I run—a troop! And by my God I leap a wall.
content_old: 29 For by Thee I run—a troop! And by my God I leap a wall.

content: 30 God! perfect is His way, The saying of Jehovah is tried, A shield is He to all those trusting in Him.
content_old: 30 God! perfect is His way, The saying of Jehovah is tried, A shield is He to all those trusting in Him.

content: 31 For who is God besides Jehovah? And who is a rock save our God?
content_old: 31 For who is God besides Jehovah? And who is a rock save our God?

content: 32 God! who is girding me with strength, And He maketh perfect my way.
content_old: 32 God! who is girding me with strength, And He maketh perfect my way.

content: 33 Making my feet like hinds, And on my high places causeth me to stand.
content_old: 33 Making my feet like hinds, And on my high places causeth me to stand.

content: 34 Teaching my hands for battle, And a bow of brass was brought down by my arms.
content_old: 34 Teaching my hands for battle, And a bow of brass was brought down by my arms.

content: 35 And Thou givest to me the shield of Thy salvation, And Thy right hand doth support me, And Thy lowliness maketh me great.
content_old: 35 And Thou givest to me the shield of Thy salvation, And Thy right hand doth support me, And Thy lowliness maketh me great.

content: 36 Thou enlargest my step under me, And mine ankles have not slidden.
content_old: 36 Thou enlargest my step under me, And mine ankles have not slidden.

content: 37 I pursue mine enemies, and overtake them, And turn back not till they are consumed.
content_old: 37 I pursue mine enemies, and overtake them, And turn back not till they are consumed.

content: 38 I smite them, and they are not able to rise, They fall under my feet,
content_old: 38 I smite them, and they are not able to rise, They fall under my feet,

content: 39 And Thou girdest me with strength for battle, Causest my withstanders to bow under me.
content_old: 39 And Thou girdest me with strength for battle, Causest my withstanders to bow under me.

content: 40 As to mine enemies—Thou hast given to me the neck, As to those hating me���I cut them off.
content_old: 40 As to mine enemies—Thou hast given to me the neck, As to those hating me���I cut them off.

content: 41 They cry, and there is no saviour, On Jehovah, and He doth not answer them.
content_old: 41 They cry, and there is no saviour, On Jehovah, and He doth not answer them.

content: 42 And I beat them as dust before wind, As mire of the streets I empty them out.
content_old: 42 And I beat them as dust before wind, As mire of the streets I empty them out.

content: 43 Thou dost deliver me From the strivings of the people, Thou placest me for a head of nations, A people I have not known do serve me.
content_old: 43 Thou dost deliver me From the strivings of the people, Thou placest me for a head of nations, A people I have not known do serve me.

content: 44 At the hearing of the ear they hearken to me, Sons of a stranger feign obedience to me,
content_old: 44 At the hearing of the ear they hearken to me, Sons of a stranger feign obedience to me,

content: 45 Sons of a stranger fade away, And are slain out of their close places.
content_old: 45 Sons of a stranger fade away, And are slain out of their close places.

content: 46 Jehovah liveth—and blessed is my rock, And exalted is the God of my salvation.
content_old: 46 Jehovah liveth—and blessed is my rock, And exalted is the God of my salvation.

content: 47 God—who is giving vengeance to me, And He subdueth peoples under me,
content_old: 47 God—who is giving vengeance to me, And He subdueth peoples under me,

content: 48 My deliverer from mine enemies, Above my withstanders Thou raisest me, From a man of violence dost deliver me.
content_old: 48 My deliverer from mine enemies, Above my withstanders Thou raisest me, From a man of violence dost deliver me.

content: 49 Therefore I confess Thee among nations, O Jehovah, And to Thy name I sing praise,
content_old: 49 Therefore I confess Thee among nations, O Jehovah, And to Thy name I sing praise,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. The heavens are recounting the honour of God, And the work of His hands The expanse is declaring.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. The heavens are recounting the honour of God, And the work of His hands The expanse is declaring.

content: 2 Day to day uttereth speech, And night to night sheweth knowledge.
content_old: 2 Day to day uttereth speech, And night to night sheweth knowledge.

content: 3 There is no speech, and there are no words. Their voice hath not been heard.
content_old: 3 There is no speech, and there are no words. Their voice hath not been heard.

content: 4 Into all the earth hath their line gone forth, And to the end of the world their sayings, For the sun He placed a tent in them,
content_old: 4 Into all the earth hath their line gone forth, And to the end of the world their sayings, For the sun He placed a tent in them,

content: 5 And he, as a bridegroom, goeth out from his covering, He rejoiceth as a mighty one To run the path.
content_old: 5 And he, as a bridegroom, goeth out from his covering, He rejoiceth as a mighty one To run the path.

content: 6 From the end of the heavens is his going out, And his revolution is unto their ends, And nothing is hid from his heat.
content_old: 6 From the end of the heavens is his going out, And his revolution is unto their ends, And nothing is hid from his heat.

content: 7 The law of Jehovah is perfect, refreshing the soul, The testimonies of Jehovah are stedfast, Making wise the simple,
content_old: 7 The law of Jehovah is perfect, refreshing the soul, The testimonies of Jehovah are stedfast, Making wise the simple,

content: 8 The precepts of Jehovah are upright, Rejoicing the heart, The command of Jehovah is pure, enlightening the eyes,
content_old: 8 The precepts of Jehovah are upright, Rejoicing the heart, The command of Jehovah is pure, enlightening the eyes,

content: 9 The fear of Jehovah is clean, standing to the age, The judgments of Jehovah are true, They have been righteous—together.
content_old: 9 The fear of Jehovah is clean, standing to the age, The judgments of Jehovah are true, They have been righteous—together.

content: 10 They are more desirable than gold, Yea, than much fine gold; and sweeter than honey, Even liquid honey of the comb.
content_old: 10 They are more desirable than gold, Yea, than much fine gold; and sweeter than honey, Even liquid honey of the comb.

content: 11 Also—Thy servant is warned by them, ‘In keeping them is a great reward.’
content_old: 11 Also—Thy servant is warned by them, ‘In keeping them is a great reward.’

content: 12 Errors! who doth understand? From hidden ones declare me innocent,
content_old: 12 Errors! who doth understand? From hidden ones declare me innocent,

content: 13 Also—from presumptuous ones keep back Thy servant, Let them not rule over me, Then am I perfect, And declared innocent of much transgression,
content_old: 13 Also—from presumptuous ones keep back Thy servant, Let them not rule over me, Then am I perfect, And declared innocent of much transgression,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Jehovah doth answer thee, In a day of adversity, The name of the God of Jacob doth set thee on high,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Jehovah doth answer thee, In a day of adversity, The name of the God of Jacob doth set thee on high,

content: 2 He doth send thy help from the sanctuary, And from Zion doth support thee,
content_old: 2 He doth send thy help from the sanctuary, And from Zion doth support thee,

content: 3 He doth remember all thy presents, And thy burnt-offering doth reduce to ashes. Selah.
content_old: 3 He doth remember all thy presents, And thy burnt-offering doth reduce to ashes. Selah.

content: 4 He doth give to thee according to thy heart, And all thy counsel doth fulfil.
content_old: 4 He doth give to thee according to thy heart, And all thy counsel doth fulfil.

content: 5 We sing of thy salvation, And in the name of our God set up a banner. Jehovah doth fulfil all thy requests.
content_old: 5 We sing of thy salvation, And in the name of our God set up a banner. Jehovah doth fulfil all thy requests.

content: 6 Now I have known That Jehovah hath saved His anointed, He answereth him from His holy heavens, With the saving might of His right hand.
content_old: 6 Now I have known That Jehovah hath saved His anointed, He answereth him from His holy heavens, With the saving might of His right hand.

content: 7 Some of chariots, and some of horses, And we of the name of Jehovah our God Make mention.
content_old: 7 Some of chariots, and some of horses, And we of the name of Jehovah our God Make mention.

content: 8 They—they have bowed and have fallen, And we have risen and station ourselves upright.
content_old: 8 They—they have bowed and have fallen, And we have risen and station ourselves upright.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Jehovah, in Thy strength is the king joyful, In Thy salvation how greatly he rejoiceth.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Jehovah, in Thy strength is the king joyful, In Thy salvation how greatly he rejoiceth.

content: 2 The desire of his heart Thou gavest to him, And the request of his lips Thou hast not withheld. Selah.
content_old: 2 The desire of his heart Thou gavest to him, And the request of his lips Thou hast not withheld. Selah.

content: 3 For Thou puttest before him blessings of goodness, Thou settest on his head a crown of fine gold.
content_old: 3 For Thou puttest before him blessings of goodness, Thou settest on his head a crown of fine gold.

content: 4 Life he hath asked from Thee, Thou hast given to him—length of days, Age-during—and for ever.
content_old: 4 Life he hath asked from Thee, Thou hast given to him—length of days, Age-during—and for ever.

content: 5 Great is his honour in Thy salvation, Honour and majesty Thou placest on him.
content_old: 5 Great is his honour in Thy salvation, Honour and majesty Thou placest on him.

content: 6 For Thou makest him blessings for ever, Thou dost cause him to rejoice with joy, By Thy countenance.
content_old: 6 For Thou makest him blessings for ever, Thou dost cause him to rejoice with joy, By Thy countenance.

content: 7 For the king is trusting in Jehovah, And in the kindness of the Most High He is not moved.
content_old: 7 For the king is trusting in Jehovah, And in the kindness of the Most High He is not moved.

content: 8 Thy hand cometh to all Thine enemies, Thy right hand doth find Thy haters.
content_old: 8 Thy hand cometh to all Thine enemies, Thy right hand doth find Thy haters.

content: 9 Thou makest them as a furnace of fire, At the time of Thy presence. Jehovah in His anger doth swallow them, And fire doth devour them.
content_old: 9 Thou makest them as a furnace of fire, At the time of Thy presence. Jehovah in His anger doth swallow them, And fire doth devour them.

content: 10 Their fruit from earth Thou destroyest, And their seed from the sons of men.
content_old: 10 Their fruit from earth Thou destroyest, And their seed from the sons of men.

content: 11 For they stretched out against Thee evil, They devised a wicked device, they prevail not,
content_old: 11 For they stretched out against Thee evil, They devised a wicked device, they prevail not,

content: 12 For Thou makest them a butt, When Thy strings Thou preparest against their faces.
content_old: 12 For Thou makest them a butt, When Thy strings Thou preparest against their faces.

content: 1 To the Overseer, on ‘The Hind of the Morning.’—A Psalm of David. My God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation, The words of my roaring?
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, on ‘The Hind of the Morning.’—A Psalm of David. My God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation, The words of my roaring?

content: 2 My God, I call by day, and Thou answerest not, And by night, and there is no silence to me.
content_old: 2 My God, I call by day, and Thou answerest not, And by night, and there is no silence to me.

content: 3 And Thou art holy, Sitting—the Praise of Israel.
content_old: 3 And Thou art holy, Sitting—the Praise of Israel.

content: 4 In Thee did our fathers trust—they trusted, And Thou dost deliver them.
content_old: 4 In Thee did our fathers trust—they trusted, And Thou dost deliver them.

content: 5 Unto Thee they cried, and were delivered, In Thee they trusted, and were not ashamed.
content_old: 5 Unto Thee they cried, and were delivered, In Thee they trusted, and were not ashamed.

content: 6 And I am a worm, and no man, A reproach of man, and despised of the people.
content_old: 6 And I am a worm, and no man, A reproach of man, and despised of the people.

content: 7 All beholding me do mock at me, They make free with the lip—shake the head,
content_old: 7 All beholding me do mock at me, They make free with the lip—shake the head,

content: 8 ‘Roll unto Jehovah, He doth deliver him, He doth deliver him, for he delighted in him.’
content_old: 8 ‘Roll unto Jehovah, He doth deliver him, He doth deliver him, for he delighted in him.’

content: 9 For thou art He bringing me forth from the womb, Causing me to trust, On the breasts of my mother.
content_old: 9 For thou art He bringing me forth from the womb, Causing me to trust, On the breasts of my mother.

content: 10 On Thee I have been cast from the womb, From the belly of my mother Thou art my God.
content_old: 10 On Thee I have been cast from the womb, From the belly of my mother Thou art my God.

content: 11 Be not far from me, For adversity is near, for there is no helper.
content_old: 11 Be not far from me, For adversity is near, for there is no helper.

content: 12 Many bulls have surrounded me, Mighty ones of Bashan have compassed me,
content_old: 12 Many bulls have surrounded me, Mighty ones of Bashan have compassed me,

content: 13 They have opened against me their mouth, A lion tearing and roaring.
content_old: 13 They have opened against me their mouth, A lion tearing and roaring.

content: 14 As waters I have been poured out, And separated themselves have all my bones, My heart hath been like wax, It is melted in the midst of my bowels.
content_old: 14 As waters I have been poured out, And separated themselves have all my bones, My heart hath been like wax, It is melted in the midst of my bowels.

content: 15 Dried up as an earthen vessel is my power, And my tongue is cleaving to my jaws.
content_old: 15 Dried up as an earthen vessel is my power, And my tongue is cleaving to my jaws.

content: 16 And to the dust of death thou appointest me, For surrounded me have dogs, A company of evil doers have compassed me, Piercing my hands and my feet.
content_old: 16 And to the dust of death thou appointest me, For surrounded me have dogs, A company of evil doers have compassed me, Piercing my hands and my feet.

content: 17 I count all my bones—they look expectingly, They look upon me,
content_old: 17 I count all my bones—they look expectingly, They look upon me,

content: 18 They apportion my garments to themselves, And for my clothing they cause a lot to fall.
content_old: 18 They apportion my garments to themselves, And for my clothing they cause a lot to fall.

content: 19 And Thou, O Jehovah, be not far off, O my strength, to help me haste.
content_old: 19 And Thou, O Jehovah, be not far off, O my strength, to help me haste.

content: 20 Deliver from the sword my soul, From the paw of a dog mine only one.
content_old: 20 Deliver from the sword my soul, From the paw of a dog mine only one.

content: 21 Save me from the mouth of a lion:—And—from the horns of the high places Thou hast answered me!
content_old: 21 Save me from the mouth of a lion:—And—from the horns of the high places Thou hast answered me!

content: 22 I declare Thy name to my brethren, In the midst of the assembly I praise Thee.
content_old: 22 I declare Thy name to my brethren, In the midst of the assembly I praise Thee.

content: 23 Ye who fear Jehovah, praise ye Him, All the seed of Jacob, honour ye Him, And be afraid of Him, all ye seed of Israel.
content_old: 23 Ye who fear Jehovah, praise ye Him, All the seed of Jacob, honour ye Him, And be afraid of Him, all ye seed of Israel.

content: 24 For He hath not despised, nor abominated, The affliction of the afflicted, Nor hath He hidden His face from him, And in his crying unto Him He heareth.
content_old: 24 For He hath not despised, nor abominated, The affliction of the afflicted, Nor hath He hidden His face from him, And in his crying unto Him He heareth.

content: 25 Of Thee my praise is in the great assembly. My vows I complete before His fearers.
content_old: 25 Of Thee my praise is in the great assembly. My vows I complete before His fearers.

content: 26 The humble do eat and are satisfied, Praise Jehovah do those seeking Him, Your heart doth live for ever.
content_old: 26 The humble do eat and are satisfied, Praise Jehovah do those seeking Him, Your heart doth live for ever.

content: 27 Remember and return unto Jehovah, Do all ends of the earth, And before Thee bow themselves, Do all families of the nations,
content_old: 27 Remember and return unto Jehovah, Do all ends of the earth, And before Thee bow themselves, Do all families of the nations,

content: 28 For to Jehovah is the kingdom, And He is ruling among nations.
content_old: 28 For to Jehovah is the kingdom, And He is ruling among nations.

content: 29 And the fat ones of earth have eaten, And they bow themselves, Before Him bow do all going down to dust, And he who hath not revived his soul.
content_old: 29 And the fat ones of earth have eaten, And they bow themselves, Before Him bow do all going down to dust, And he who hath not revived his soul.

content: 30 A seed doth serve Him, It is declared of the Lord to the generation.
content_old: 30 A seed doth serve Him, It is declared of the Lord to the generation.

content: 1 A Psalm of David. Jehovah is my shepherd, I do not lack,
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David. Jehovah is my shepherd, I do not lack,

content: 2 In pastures of tender grass He causeth me to lie down, By quiet waters He doth lead me.
content_old: 2 In pastures of tender grass He causeth me to lie down, By quiet waters He doth lead me.

content: 3 My soul He refresheth, He leadeth me in paths of righteousness, For His name’s sake,
content_old: 3 My soul He refresheth, He leadeth me in paths of righteousness, For His name’s sake,

content: 4 Also—when I walk in a valley of death-shade, I fear no evil, for Thou art with me, Thy rod and Thy staff—they comfort me.
content_old: 4 Also—when I walk in a valley of death-shade, I fear no evil, for Thou art with me, Thy rod and Thy staff—they comfort me.

content: 5 Thou arrangest before me a table, Over-against my adversaries, Thou hast anointed with oil my head, My cup is full!
content_old: 5 Thou arrangest before me a table, Over-against my adversaries, Thou hast anointed with oil my head, My cup is full!

content: 1 A Psalm of David. To Jehovah is the earth and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David. To Jehovah is the earth and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.

content: 2 For He on the seas hath founded it, And on the floods He doth establish it.
content_old: 2 For He on the seas hath founded it, And on the floods He doth establish it.

content: 3 Who goeth up into the hill of Jehovah? And who riseth up in His holy place?
content_old: 3 Who goeth up into the hill of Jehovah? And who riseth up in His holy place?

content: 4 The clean of hands, and pure of heart, Who hath not lifted up to vanity his soul, Nor hath sworn to deceit.
content_old: 4 The clean of hands, and pure of heart, Who hath not lifted up to vanity his soul, Nor hath sworn to deceit.

content: 5 He beareth away a blessing from Jehovah, Righteousness from the God of his salvation.
content_old: 5 He beareth away a blessing from Jehovah, Righteousness from the God of his salvation.

content: 6 This is a generation of those seeking Him. Seeking Thy face, O Jacob! Selah.
content_old: 6 This is a generation of those seeking Him. Seeking Thy face, O Jacob! Selah.

content: 7 Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!
content_old: 7 Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!

content: 8 Who is this—‘the king of glory?’ Jehovah—strong and mighty, Jehovah, the mighty in battle.
content_old: 8 Who is this—‘the king of glory?’ Jehovah—strong and mighty, Jehovah, the mighty in battle.

content: 9 Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!
content_old: 9 Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!

content: 1 By David. Unto Thee, O Jehovah, my soul I lift up.
content_old: 1 By David. Unto Thee, O Jehovah, my soul I lift up.

content: 2 My God, in Thee I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed, Let not mine enemies exult over me.
content_old: 2 My God, in Thee I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed, Let not mine enemies exult over me.

content: 3 Also let none waiting on Thee be ashamed, Let the treacherous dealers without cause be ashamed.
content_old: 3 Also let none waiting on Thee be ashamed, Let the treacherous dealers without cause be ashamed.

content: 4 Thy ways, O Jehovah, cause me to know, Thy paths teach Thou me.
content_old: 4 Thy ways, O Jehovah, cause me to know, Thy paths teach Thou me.

content: 5 Cause me to tread in Thy truth, and teach me, For Thou art the God of my salvation, Near Thee I have waited all the day.
content_old: 5 Cause me to tread in Thy truth, and teach me, For Thou art the God of my salvation, Near Thee I have waited all the day.

content: 6 Remember Thy mercies, O Jehovah, And Thy kindnesses, for from the age are they.
content_old: 6 Remember Thy mercies, O Jehovah, And Thy kindnesses, for from the age are they.

content: 7 Sins of my youth, and my transgressions, Do not Thou remember. According to Thy kindness be mindful of me, For Thy goodness’ sake, O Jehovah.
content_old: 7 Sins of my youth, and my transgressions, Do not Thou remember. According to Thy kindness be mindful of me, For Thy goodness’ sake, O Jehovah.

content: 8 Good and upright is Jehovah, Therefore He directeth sinners in the way.
content_old: 8 Good and upright is Jehovah, Therefore He directeth sinners in the way.

content: 9 He causeth the humble to tread in judgment, And teacheth the humble His way.
content_old: 9 He causeth the humble to tread in judgment, And teacheth the humble His way.

content: 10 All the paths of Jehovah are kindness and truth, To those keeping His covenant, And His testimonies.
content_old: 10 All the paths of Jehovah are kindness and truth, To those keeping His covenant, And His testimonies.

content: 11 For Thy name’s sake, O Jehovah, Thou hast pardoned mine iniquity, for it is great.
content_old: 11 For Thy name’s sake, O Jehovah, Thou hast pardoned mine iniquity, for it is great.

content: 12 Who is this—the man fearing Jehovah? He directeth him in the way He doth choose.
content_old: 12 Who is this—the man fearing Jehovah? He directeth him in the way He doth choose.

content: 13 His soul in good doth remain, And his seed doth possess the land.
content_old: 13 His soul in good doth remain, And his seed doth possess the land.

content: 14 The secret of Jehovah is for those fearing Him, And His covenant—to cause them to know.
content_old: 14 The secret of Jehovah is for those fearing Him, And His covenant—to cause them to know.

content: 15 Mine eyes are continually unto Jehovah, For He bringeth out from a net my feet.
content_old: 15 Mine eyes are continually unto Jehovah, For He bringeth out from a net my feet.

content: 16 Turn Thou unto me, and favour me, For lonely and afflicted am I.
content_old: 16 Turn Thou unto me, and favour me, For lonely and afflicted am I.

content: 17 The distresses of my heart have enlarged themselves, From my distresses bring me out.
content_old: 17 The distresses of my heart have enlarged themselves, From my distresses bring me out.

content: 18 See mine affliction and my misery, And bear with all my sins.
content_old: 18 See mine affliction and my misery, And bear with all my sins.

content: 19 See my enemies, for they have been many, And with violent hatred they have hated me.
content_old: 19 See my enemies, for they have been many, And with violent hatred they have hated me.

content: 20 Keep my soul, and deliver me, Let me not be ashamed, for I trusted in Thee.
content_old: 20 Keep my soul, and deliver me, Let me not be ashamed, for I trusted in Thee.

content: 21 Integrity and uprightness do keep me, For I have waited on Thee.
content_old: 21 Integrity and uprightness do keep me, For I have waited on Thee.

content: 1 By David. Judge me, O Jehovah, for I in mine integrity have walked, And in Jehovah I have trusted, I slide not.
content_old: 1 By David. Judge me, O Jehovah, for I in mine integrity have walked, And in Jehovah I have trusted, I slide not.

content: 2 Try me, O Jehovah, and prove me, Purified are my reins and my heart.
content_old: 2 Try me, O Jehovah, and prove me, Purified are my reins and my heart.

content: 3 For Thy kindness is before mine eyes, And I have walked habitually in Thy truth.
content_old: 3 For Thy kindness is before mine eyes, And I have walked habitually in Thy truth.

content: 4 I have not sat with vain men, And with dissemblers I enter not.
content_old: 4 I have not sat with vain men, And with dissemblers I enter not.

content: 5 I have hated the assembly of evil doers, And with the wicked I sit not.
content_old: 5 I have hated the assembly of evil doers, And with the wicked I sit not.

content: 6 I wash in innocency my hands, And I compass Thine altar, O Jehovah.
content_old: 6 I wash in innocency my hands, And I compass Thine altar, O Jehovah.

content: 7 To sound with a voice of confession, And to recount all Thy wonders.
content_old: 7 To sound with a voice of confession, And to recount all Thy wonders.

content: 8 Jehovah, I have loved the habitation of Thy house, And the place of the tabernacle of Thine honour.
content_old: 8 Jehovah, I have loved the habitation of Thy house, And the place of the tabernacle of Thine honour.

content: 9 Do not gather with sinners my soul, And with men of blood my life,
content_old: 9 Do not gather with sinners my soul, And with men of blood my life,

content: 10 In whose hand is a wicked device, And their right hand is full of bribes.
content_old: 10 In whose hand is a wicked device, And their right hand is full of bribes.

content: 11 And I, in mine integrity I walk, Redeem me, and favour me.
content_old: 11 And I, in mine integrity I walk, Redeem me, and favour me.

content: 1 By David. Jehovah is my light and my salvation, Whom do I fear? Jehovah is the strength of my life, Of whom am I afraid?
content_old: 1 By David. Jehovah is my light and my salvation, Whom do I fear? Jehovah is the strength of my life, Of whom am I afraid?

content: 2 When evil doers come near to me to eat my flesh, My adversaries and mine enemies to me, They have stumbled and fallen.
content_old: 2 When evil doers come near to me to eat my flesh, My adversaries and mine enemies to me, They have stumbled and fallen.

content: 3 Though a host doth encamp against me, My heart doth not fear, Though war riseth up against me, In this I am confident.
content_old: 3 Though a host doth encamp against me, My heart doth not fear, Though war riseth up against me, In this I am confident.

content: 4 One thing I asked of Jehovah—it I seek. My dwelling in the house of Jehovah, All the days of my life, To look on the pleasantness of Jehovah, And to inquire in His temple.
content_old: 4 One thing I asked of Jehovah—it I seek. My dwelling in the house of Jehovah, All the days of my life, To look on the pleasantness of Jehovah, And to inquire in His temple.

content: 5 For He hideth me in a tabernacle in the day of evil, He hideth me in a secret place of His tent, On a rock he raiseth me up.
content_old: 5 For He hideth me in a tabernacle in the day of evil, He hideth me in a secret place of His tent, On a rock he raiseth me up.

content: 6 And now, lifted up is my head, Above my enemies—my surrounders, And I sacrifice in His tent sacrifices of shouting, I sing, yea, I sing praise to Jehovah.
content_old: 6 And now, lifted up is my head, Above my enemies—my surrounders, And I sacrifice in His tent sacrifices of shouting, I sing, yea, I sing praise to Jehovah.

content: 7 Hear, O Jehovah, my voice—I call, And favour me, and answer me.
content_old: 7 Hear, O Jehovah, my voice—I call, And favour me, and answer me.

content: 8 To Thee said my heart ‘They sought my face, Thy face, O Jehovah, I seek.’
content_old: 8 To Thee said my heart ‘They sought my face, Thy face, O Jehovah, I seek.’

content: 9 Hide not Thy face from me, Turn not aside in anger Thy servant, My help Thou hast been. Leave me not, nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
content_old: 9 Hide not Thy face from me, Turn not aside in anger Thy servant, My help Thou hast been. Leave me not, nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.

content: 10 When my father and my mother Have forsaken me, then doth Jehovah gather me.
content_old: 10 When my father and my mother Have forsaken me, then doth Jehovah gather me.

content: 11 Shew me, O Jehovah, Thy way, And lead me in a path of uprightness, For the sake of my beholders.
content_old: 11 Shew me, O Jehovah, Thy way, And lead me in a path of uprightness, For the sake of my beholders.

content: 12 Give me not to the will of my adversaries, For risen against me have false witnesses, And they breathe out violence to me.
content_old: 12 Give me not to the will of my adversaries, For risen against me have false witnesses, And they breathe out violence to me.

content: 13 I had not believed to look on the goodness of Jehovah In the land of the living!
content_old: 13 I had not believed to look on the goodness of Jehovah In the land of the living!

content: 1 By David. Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, My rock, be not silent to me! Lest Thou be silent to me, And I have been compared With those going down to the pit.
content_old: 1 By David. Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, My rock, be not silent to me! Lest Thou be silent to me, And I have been compared With those going down to the pit.

content: 2 Hear the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee, In my lifting up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
content_old: 2 Hear the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee, In my lifting up my hands toward thy holy oracle.

content: 3 Draw me not with the wicked, And with workers of iniquity, Speaking peace with their neighbours, And evil in their heart.
content_old: 3 Draw me not with the wicked, And with workers of iniquity, Speaking peace with their neighbours, And evil in their heart.

content: 4 Give to them according to their acting, And according to the evil of their doings. According to the work of their hands give to them. Return their deed to them.
content_old: 4 Give to them according to their acting, And according to the evil of their doings. According to the work of their hands give to them. Return their deed to them.

content: 5 For they attend not to the doing of Jehovah, And unto the work of His hands. He throweth them down, And doth not build them up.
content_old: 5 For they attend not to the doing of Jehovah, And unto the work of His hands. He throweth them down, And doth not build them up.

content: 6 Blessed is Jehovah, For He hath heard the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 Blessed is Jehovah, For He hath heard the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 Jehovah is my strength, and my shield, In Him my heart trusted, and I have been helped. And my heart exulteth, And with my song I thank Him.
content_old: 7 Jehovah is my strength, and my shield, In Him my heart trusted, and I have been helped. And my heart exulteth, And with my song I thank Him.

content: 8 Jehovah is strength to him, Yea, the strength of the salvation of His anointed is He.
content_old: 8 Jehovah is strength to him, Yea, the strength of the salvation of His anointed is He.

content: 1 A Psalm of David. Ascribe to Jehovah, ye sons of the mighty, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David. Ascribe to Jehovah, ye sons of the mighty, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.

content: 2 Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the beauty of holiness.
content_old: 2 Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the beauty of holiness.

content: 3 The voice of Jehovah is on the waters, The God of glory hath thundered, Jehovah is on many waters.
content_old: 3 The voice of Jehovah is on the waters, The God of glory hath thundered, Jehovah is on many waters.

content: 4 The voice of Jehovah is with power, The voice of Jehovah is with majesty,
content_old: 4 The voice of Jehovah is with power, The voice of Jehovah is with majesty,

content: 5 The voice of Jehovah is shivering cedars, Yea, Jehovah shivers the cedars of Lebanon.
content_old: 5 The voice of Jehovah is shivering cedars, Yea, Jehovah shivers the cedars of Lebanon.

content: 6 And He causeth them to skip as a calf, Lebanon and Sirion as a son of Reems,
content_old: 6 And He causeth them to skip as a calf, Lebanon and Sirion as a son of Reems,

content: 7 The voice of Jehovah is hewing fiery flames,
content_old: 7 The voice of Jehovah is hewing fiery flames,

content: 8 The voice of Jehovah paineth a wilderness, Jehovah paineth the wilderness of Kadesh.
content_old: 8 The voice of Jehovah paineth a wilderness, Jehovah paineth the wilderness of Kadesh.

content: 9 The voice of Jehovah paineth the oaks, And maketh bare the forests, And in His temple every one saith, ‘Glory.’
content_old: 9 The voice of Jehovah paineth the oaks, And maketh bare the forests, And in His temple every one saith, ‘Glory.’

content: 10 Jehovah on the deluge hath sat, And Jehovah sitteth king—to the age,
content_old: 10 Jehovah on the deluge hath sat, And Jehovah sitteth king—to the age,

content: 1 A Psalm.—A song of the dedication of the house of David. I exalt Thee, O Jehovah, For Thou hast drawn me up, and hast not let mine enemies rejoice over me.
content_old: 1 A Psalm.—A song of the dedication of the house of David. I exalt Thee, O Jehovah, For Thou hast drawn me up, and hast not let mine enemies rejoice over me.

content: 2 Jehovah my God, I have cried to Thee, And Thou dost heal me.
content_old: 2 Jehovah my God, I have cried to Thee, And Thou dost heal me.

content: 3 Jehovah, Thou hast brought up from Sheol my soul, Thou hast kept me alive, From going down to the pit.
content_old: 3 Jehovah, Thou hast brought up from Sheol my soul, Thou hast kept me alive, From going down to the pit.

content: 4 Sing praise to Jehovah, ye His saints, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness,
content_old: 4 Sing praise to Jehovah, ye His saints, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness,

content: 5 For—a moment is in His anger, Life is in His good-will, At even remaineth weeping, and at morn singing.
content_old: 5 For—a moment is in His anger, Life is in His good-will, At even remaineth weeping, and at morn singing.

content: 6 And I—I have said in mine ease, ‘I am not moved—to the age.
content_old: 6 And I—I have said in mine ease, ‘I am not moved—to the age.

content: 7 O Jehovah, in Thy good pleasure, Thou hast caused strength to remain for my mountain,’ Thou hast hidden Thy face—I have been troubled.
content_old: 7 O Jehovah, in Thy good pleasure, Thou hast caused strength to remain for my mountain,’ Thou hast hidden Thy face—I have been troubled.

content: 8 Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, And unto Jehovah I make supplication.
content_old: 8 Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, And unto Jehovah I make supplication.

content: 9 ‘What gain is in my blood? In my going down unto corruption? Doth dust thank Thee? doth it declare Thy truth?
content_old: 9 ‘What gain is in my blood? In my going down unto corruption? Doth dust thank Thee? doth it declare Thy truth?

content: 10 Hear, O Jehovah, and favour me, O Jehovah, be a helper to me.’
content_old: 10 Hear, O Jehovah, and favour me, O Jehovah, be a helper to me.’

content: 11 Thou hast turned my mourning to dancing for me, Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, And girdest me with joy.
content_old: 11 Thou hast turned my mourning to dancing for me, Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, And girdest me with joy.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age, In Thy righteousness deliver me.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age, In Thy righteousness deliver me.

content: 2 Incline unto me Thine ear hastily, deliver me, Be to me for a strong rock, For a house of bulwarks to save me.
content_old: 2 Incline unto me Thine ear hastily, deliver me, Be to me for a strong rock, For a house of bulwarks to save me.
