content: 3 For my rock and my bulwark art Thou, For Thy name’s sake lead me and tend me.
content_old: 3 For my rock and my bulwark art Thou, For Thy name’s sake lead me and tend me.

content: 4 Bring me out from the net that they hid for me, For Thou art my strength.
content_old: 4 Bring me out from the net that they hid for me, For Thou art my strength.

content: 5 Into Thy hand I commit my spirit, Thou hast redeemed me, Jehovah God of truth.
content_old: 5 Into Thy hand I commit my spirit, Thou hast redeemed me, Jehovah God of truth.

content: 6 I have hated the observers of lying vanities, And I toward Jehovah have been confident.
content_old: 6 I have hated the observers of lying vanities, And I toward Jehovah have been confident.

content: 7 I rejoice, and am glad in Thy kindness, In that Thou hast seen mine affliction, Thou hast known in adversities my soul.
content_old: 7 I rejoice, and am glad in Thy kindness, In that Thou hast seen mine affliction, Thou hast known in adversities my soul.

content: 8 And Thou hast not shut me up, Into the hand of an enemy, Thou hast caused my feet to stand in a broad place.
content_old: 8 And Thou hast not shut me up, Into the hand of an enemy, Thou hast caused my feet to stand in a broad place.

content: 9 Favour me, O Jehovah, for distress is to me, Mine eye, my soul, and my body Have become old by provocation.
content_old: 9 Favour me, O Jehovah, for distress is to me, Mine eye, my soul, and my body Have become old by provocation.

content: 10 For my life hath been consumed in sorrow And my years in sighing. Feeble because of mine iniquity hath been my strength, And my bones have become old.
content_old: 10 For my life hath been consumed in sorrow And my years in sighing. Feeble because of mine iniquity hath been my strength, And my bones have become old.

content: 11 Among all mine adversaries I have been a reproach, And to my neighbours exceedingly, And a fear to mine acquaintances, Those seeing me without—fled from me.
content_old: 11 Among all mine adversaries I have been a reproach, And to my neighbours exceedingly, And a fear to mine acquaintances, Those seeing me without—fled from me.

content: 12 I have been forgotten as dead out of mind, I have been as a perishing vessel.
content_old: 12 I have been forgotten as dead out of mind, I have been as a perishing vessel.

content: 13 For I have heard an evil account of many, Fear is round about. In their being united against me, To take my life they have devised,
content_old: 13 For I have heard an evil account of many, Fear is round about. In their being united against me, To take my life they have devised,

content: 14 And I on Thee—I have trusted, O Jehovah, I have said, ‘Thou art my God.’
content_old: 14 And I on Thee—I have trusted, O Jehovah, I have said, ‘Thou art my God.’

content: 15 In Thy hand are my times, Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from my pursuers.
content_old: 15 In Thy hand are my times, Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from my pursuers.

content: 16 Cause Thy face to shine on Thy servant, Save me in Thy kindness.
content_old: 16 Cause Thy face to shine on Thy servant, Save me in Thy kindness.

content: 17 O Jehovah, let me not be ashamed, For I have called Thee, let the wicked be ashamed, Let them become silent to Sheol.
content_old: 17 O Jehovah, let me not be ashamed, For I have called Thee, let the wicked be ashamed, Let them become silent to Sheol.

content: 18 Let lips of falsehood become dumb, That are speaking against the righteous, Ancient sayings, in pride and contempt.
content_old: 18 Let lips of falsehood become dumb, That are speaking against the righteous, Ancient sayings, in pride and contempt.

content: 19 How abundant is Thy goodness, That Thou hast laid up for those fearing Thee,
content_old: 19 How abundant is Thy goodness, That Thou hast laid up for those fearing Thee,

content: 20 Thou hast wrought for those trusting in Thee, Before sons of men. Thou hidest them in the secret place of Thy presence, From artifices of man, Thou concealest them in a tabernacle, From the strife of tongues.
content_old: 20 Thou hast wrought for those trusting in Thee, Before sons of men. Thou hidest them in the secret place of Thy presence, From artifices of man, Thou concealest them in a tabernacle, From the strife of tongues.

content: 21 Blessed is Jehovah, For He hath made marvellous His kindness To me in a city of bulwarks.
content_old: 21 Blessed is Jehovah, For He hath made marvellous His kindness To me in a city of bulwarks.

content: 22 And I—I have said in my haste, ‘I have been cut off from before Thine eyes,’ But Thou hast heard the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee.
content_old: 22 And I—I have said in my haste, ‘I have been cut off from before Thine eyes,’ But Thou hast heard the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee.

content: 23 Love Jehovah, all ye His saints, Jehovah is keeping the faithful, And recompensing abundantly a proud doer.
content_old: 23 Love Jehovah, all ye His saints, Jehovah is keeping the faithful, And recompensing abundantly a proud doer.

content: 1 By David.—An Instruction. O the happiness of him whose transgression is forgiven, Whose sin is covered.
content_old: 1 By David.—An Instruction. O the happiness of him whose transgression is forgiven, Whose sin is covered.

content: 2 O the happiness of a man, To whom Jehovah imputeth not iniquity, And in whose spirit there is no deceit.
content_old: 2 O the happiness of a man, To whom Jehovah imputeth not iniquity, And in whose spirit there is no deceit.

content: 3 When I have kept silence, become old have my bones, Through my roaring all the day.
content_old: 3 When I have kept silence, become old have my bones, Through my roaring all the day.

content: 4 When by day and by night Thy hand is heavy upon me, My moisture hath been changed Into the droughts of summer. Selah.
content_old: 4 When by day and by night Thy hand is heavy upon me, My moisture hath been changed Into the droughts of summer. Selah.

content: 5 My sin I cause Thee to know, And mine iniquity I have not covered. I have said, ‘I confess concerning My transgressions to Jehovah,’ And Thou—Thou hast taken away, The iniquity of my sin. Selah.
content_old: 5 My sin I cause Thee to know, And mine iniquity I have not covered. I have said, ‘I confess concerning My transgressions to Jehovah,’ And Thou—Thou hast taken away, The iniquity of my sin. Selah.

content: 6 For this doth every saintly one pray to Thee, As the time to find. Surely at an overflowing of many waters, Unto him they come not.
content_old: 6 For this doth every saintly one pray to Thee, As the time to find. Surely at an overflowing of many waters, Unto him they come not.

content: 7 Thou art a hiding-place for me, From distress Thou dost keep me, With songs of deliverance dost compass me. Selah.
content_old: 7 Thou art a hiding-place for me, From distress Thou dost keep me, With songs of deliverance dost compass me. Selah.

content: 8 I cause thee to act wisely, And direct thee in the way that thou goest, I cause mine eye to take counsel concerning thee.
content_old: 8 I cause thee to act wisely, And direct thee in the way that thou goest, I cause mine eye to take counsel concerning thee.

content: 9 Be ye not as a horse—as a mule, Without understanding, With bridle and bit, its ornaments, to curb, Not to come near unto thee.
content_old: 9 Be ye not as a horse—as a mule, Without understanding, With bridle and bit, its ornaments, to curb, Not to come near unto thee.

content: 10 Many are the pains of the wicked; As to him who is trusting in Jehovah, Kindness doth compass him.
content_old: 10 Many are the pains of the wicked; As to him who is trusting in Jehovah, Kindness doth compass him.

content: 1 Sing, ye righteous, in Jehovah, For upright ones praise is comely.
content_old: 1 Sing, ye righteous, in Jehovah, For upright ones praise is comely.

content: 2 Give ye thanks to Jehovah with a harp, With psaltery of ten strings sing praise to Him,
content_old: 2 Give ye thanks to Jehovah with a harp, With psaltery of ten strings sing praise to Him,

content: 3 Sing ye to Him a new song, Play skilfully with shouting.
content_old: 3 Sing ye to Him a new song, Play skilfully with shouting.

content: 4 For upright is the word of Jehovah, And all His work is in faithfulness.
content_old: 4 For upright is the word of Jehovah, And all His work is in faithfulness.

content: 5 Loving righteousness and judgment, Of the kindness of Jehovah is the earth full.
content_old: 5 Loving righteousness and judgment, Of the kindness of Jehovah is the earth full.

content: 6 By the word of Jehovah The heavens have been made, And by the breath of His mouth all their host.
content_old: 6 By the word of Jehovah The heavens have been made, And by the breath of His mouth all their host.

content: 7 Gathering as a heap the waters of the sea, Putting in treasuries the depths.
content_old: 7 Gathering as a heap the waters of the sea, Putting in treasuries the depths.

content: 8 Afraid of Jehovah are all the earth, Of Him are all the inhabitants of the world afraid.
content_old: 8 Afraid of Jehovah are all the earth, Of Him are all the inhabitants of the world afraid.

content: 9 For He hath said, and it is, He hath commanded, and it standeth.
content_old: 9 For He hath said, and it is, He hath commanded, and it standeth.

content: 10 Jehovah made void the counsel of nations, He disallowed the thoughts of the peoples.
content_old: 10 Jehovah made void the counsel of nations, He disallowed the thoughts of the peoples.

content: 11 The counsel of Jehovah to the age standeth, The thoughts of His heart to all generations.
content_old: 11 The counsel of Jehovah to the age standeth, The thoughts of His heart to all generations.

content: 12 O the happiness of the nation whose God is Jehovah, Of the people He did choose, For an inheritance to Him.
content_old: 12 O the happiness of the nation whose God is Jehovah, Of the people He did choose, For an inheritance to Him.

content: 13 From the heavens hath Jehovah looked, He hath seen all the sons of men.
content_old: 13 From the heavens hath Jehovah looked, He hath seen all the sons of men.

content: 14 From the fixed place of His dwelling, He looked unto all inhabitants of the earth;
content_old: 14 From the fixed place of His dwelling, He looked unto all inhabitants of the earth;

content: 15 Who is forming their hearts together, Who is attending unto all their works.
content_old: 15 Who is forming their hearts together, Who is attending unto all their works.

content: 16 The king is not saved by the multitude of a force. A mighty man is not delivered, By abundance of power.
content_old: 16 The king is not saved by the multitude of a force. A mighty man is not delivered, By abundance of power.

content: 17 A false thing is the horse for safety, And by the abundance of his strength He doth not deliver.
content_old: 17 A false thing is the horse for safety, And by the abundance of his strength He doth not deliver.

content: 18 Lo, the eye of Jehovah is to those fearing Him, To those waiting for His kindness,
content_old: 18 Lo, the eye of Jehovah is to those fearing Him, To those waiting for His kindness,

content: 19 To deliver from death their soul, And to keep them alive in famine.
content_old: 19 To deliver from death their soul, And to keep them alive in famine.

content: 20 Our soul hath waited for Jehovah, Our help and our shield is He,
content_old: 20 Our soul hath waited for Jehovah, Our help and our shield is He,

content: 21 For in Him doth our heart rejoice, For in His holy name we have trusted.
content_old: 21 For in Him doth our heart rejoice, For in His holy name we have trusted.

content: 1 By David, in his changing his behaviour before Abimelech, and he driveth him away, and he goeth. I do bless Jehovah at all times, Continually His praise is in my mouth.
content_old: 1 By David, in his changing his behaviour before Abimelech, and he driveth him away, and he goeth. I do bless Jehovah at all times, Continually His praise is in my mouth.

content: 2 In Jehovah doth my soul boast herself, Hear do the humble and rejoice.
content_old: 2 In Jehovah doth my soul boast herself, Hear do the humble and rejoice.

content: 3 Ascribe ye greatness to Jehovah with me, And we exalt His name together.
content_old: 3 Ascribe ye greatness to Jehovah with me, And we exalt His name together.

content: 4 I sought Jehovah, and He answered me, And from all my fears did deliver me.
content_old: 4 I sought Jehovah, and He answered me, And from all my fears did deliver me.

content: 5 They looked expectingly unto Him, And they became bright, And their faces are not ashamed.
content_old: 5 They looked expectingly unto Him, And they became bright, And their faces are not ashamed.

content: 6 This poor one called, and Jehovah heard, And from all his distresses saved him.
content_old: 6 This poor one called, and Jehovah heard, And from all his distresses saved him.

content: 7 A messenger of Jehovah is encamping, Round about those who fear Him, And He armeth them.
content_old: 7 A messenger of Jehovah is encamping, Round about those who fear Him, And He armeth them.

content: 8 Taste ye and see that Jehovah is good, O the happiness of the man who trusteth in Him.
content_old: 8 Taste ye and see that Jehovah is good, O the happiness of the man who trusteth in Him.

content: 9 Fear Jehovah, ye His holy ones, For there is no lack to those fearing Him.
content_old: 9 Fear Jehovah, ye His holy ones, For there is no lack to those fearing Him.

content: 10 Young lions have lacked and been hungry, And those seeking Jehovah lack not any good,
content_old: 10 Young lions have lacked and been hungry, And those seeking Jehovah lack not any good,

content: 11 Come ye, children, hearken to me, The fear of Jehovah I do teach you.
content_old: 11 Come ye, children, hearken to me, The fear of Jehovah I do teach you.

content: 12 Who is the man that is desiring life? Loving days to see good?
content_old: 12 Who is the man that is desiring life? Loving days to see good?

content: 13 Keep thy tongue from evil, And thy lips from speaking deceit.
content_old: 13 Keep thy tongue from evil, And thy lips from speaking deceit.

content: 14 Turn aside from evil and do good, Seek peace and pursue it.
content_old: 14 Turn aside from evil and do good, Seek peace and pursue it.

content: 15 The eyes of Jehovah are unto the righteous, And His ears unto their cry.
content_old: 15 The eyes of Jehovah are unto the righteous, And His ears unto their cry.

content: 16 (The face of Jehovah is on doers of evil, To cut off from earth their memorial.)
content_old: 16 (The face of Jehovah is on doers of evil, To cut off from earth their memorial.)

content: 17 They cried, and Jehovah heard, And from all their distresses delivered them.
content_old: 17 They cried, and Jehovah heard, And from all their distresses delivered them.

content: 18 Near is Jehovah to the broken of heart, And the bruised of spirit He saveth.
content_old: 18 Near is Jehovah to the broken of heart, And the bruised of spirit He saveth.

content: 19 Many are the evils of the righteous, Out of them all doth Jehovah deliver him.
content_old: 19 Many are the evils of the righteous, Out of them all doth Jehovah deliver him.

content: 20 He is keeping all his bones, One of them hath not been broken.
content_old: 20 He is keeping all his bones, One of them hath not been broken.

content: 21 Evil doth put to death the wicked, And those hating the righteous are desolate.
content_old: 21 Evil doth put to death the wicked, And those hating the righteous are desolate.

content: 1 By David. Strive, Jehovah, with my strivers, fight with my fighters,
content_old: 1 By David. Strive, Jehovah, with my strivers, fight with my fighters,

content: 2 Take hold of shield and buckler, and rise for my help,
content_old: 2 Take hold of shield and buckler, and rise for my help,

content: 3 And draw out spear and lance, To meet my pursuers. Say to my soul, ‘Thy salvation I am.’
content_old: 3 And draw out spear and lance, To meet my pursuers. Say to my soul, ‘Thy salvation I am.’

content: 4 They are ashamed and blush, those seeking my soul, Turned backward and confounded, Those devising my evil.
content_old: 4 They are ashamed and blush, those seeking my soul, Turned backward and confounded, Those devising my evil.

content: 5 They are as chaff before wind, And a messenger of Jehovah driving away.
content_old: 5 They are as chaff before wind, And a messenger of Jehovah driving away.

content: 6 Their way is darkness and slipperiness, And a messenger of Jehovah their pursuer.
content_old: 6 Their way is darkness and slipperiness, And a messenger of Jehovah their pursuer.

content: 7 For without cause they hid for me their netpit, Without cause they digged for my soul.
content_old: 7 For without cause they hid for me their netpit, Without cause they digged for my soul.

content: 8 Meet him doth desolation—he knoweth not, And his net that he hid catcheth him, For desolation he falleth into it.
content_old: 8 Meet him doth desolation—he knoweth not, And his net that he hid catcheth him, For desolation he falleth into it.

content: 9 And my soul is joyful in Jehovah, It rejoiceth in His salvation.
content_old: 9 And my soul is joyful in Jehovah, It rejoiceth in His salvation.

content: 10 All my bones say, ‘Jehovah, who is like Thee, Delivering the poor from the stronger than he, And the poor and needy from his plunderer.’
content_old: 10 All my bones say, ‘Jehovah, who is like Thee, Delivering the poor from the stronger than he, And the poor and needy from his plunderer.’

content: 11 Violent witnesses rise up, That which I have not known they ask me.
content_old: 11 Violent witnesses rise up, That which I have not known they ask me.

content: 12 They pay me evil for good, bereaving my soul,
content_old: 12 They pay me evil for good, bereaving my soul,

content: 13 And I—in their sickness my clothing is sackcloth, I have humbled with fastings my soul, And my prayer unto my bosom returneth.
content_old: 13 And I—in their sickness my clothing is sackcloth, I have humbled with fastings my soul, And my prayer unto my bosom returneth.

content: 14 As if a friend, as if my brother, I walked habitually, As a mourner for a mother, Mourning I have bowed down.
content_old: 14 As if a friend, as if my brother, I walked habitually, As a mourner for a mother, Mourning I have bowed down.

content: 15 And—in my halting they have rejoiced, And have been gathered together, Gathered against me were the smiters, And I have not known, They have rent, and they have not ceased;
content_old: 15 And—in my halting they have rejoiced, And have been gathered together, Gathered against me were the smiters, And I have not known, They have rent, and they have not ceased;

content: 16 With profane ones, mockers in feasts, Gnashing against me their teeth.
content_old: 16 With profane ones, mockers in feasts, Gnashing against me their teeth.

content: 17 Lord, how long dost thou behold? Keep back my soul from their desolations, From young lions my only one.
content_old: 17 Lord, how long dost thou behold? Keep back my soul from their desolations, From young lions my only one.

content: 18 I thank Thee in a great assembly, Among a mighty people I praise Thee.
content_old: 18 I thank Thee in a great assembly, Among a mighty people I praise Thee.

content: 19 Mine enemies rejoice not over me with falsehood, Those hating me without cause wink the eye.
content_old: 19 Mine enemies rejoice not over me with falsehood, Those hating me without cause wink the eye.

content: 20 For they speak not peace, And against the quiet of the land, Deceitful words they devise,
content_old: 20 For they speak not peace, And against the quiet of the land, Deceitful words they devise,

content: 21 And they enlarge against me their mouth, They said, ‘Aha, aha, our eye hath seen.’
content_old: 21 And they enlarge against me their mouth, They said, ‘Aha, aha, our eye hath seen.’

content: 22 Thou hast seen, O Jehovah, Be not silent, O Lord—be not far from me,
content_old: 22 Thou hast seen, O Jehovah, Be not silent, O Lord—be not far from me,

content: 23 Stir up, and wake to my judgment, My God, and my Lord, to my plea.
content_old: 23 Stir up, and wake to my judgment, My God, and my Lord, to my plea.

content: 24 Judge me according to Thy righteousness, O Jehovah my God, And they do not rejoice over me.
content_old: 24 Judge me according to Thy righteousness, O Jehovah my God, And they do not rejoice over me.

content: 25 They do not say in their heart, ‘Aha, our desire.’ They do not say, ‘We swallowed him up.’
content_old: 25 They do not say in their heart, ‘Aha, our desire.’ They do not say, ‘We swallowed him up.’

content: 26 They are ashamed and confounded together, Who are rejoicing at my evil. They put on shame and confusion, Who are magnifying themselves against me.
content_old: 26 They are ashamed and confounded together, Who are rejoicing at my evil. They put on shame and confusion, Who are magnifying themselves against me.

content: 27 They sing and rejoice, who are desiring my righteousness, And they say continually, ‘Jehovah is magnified, Who is desiring the peace of His servant.’
content_old: 27 They sing and rejoice, who are desiring my righteousness, And they say continually, ‘Jehovah is magnified, Who is desiring the peace of His servant.’

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By a servant of Jehovah, by David. The transgression of the wicked Is affirming within my heart, ‘Fear of God is not before his eyes,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By a servant of Jehovah, by David. The transgression of the wicked Is affirming within my heart, ‘Fear of God is not before his eyes,

content: 2 For he made it smooth to himself in his eyes, To find his iniquity to be hated.
content_old: 2 For he made it smooth to himself in his eyes, To find his iniquity to be hated.

content: 3 The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit, He ceased to act prudently—to do good.
content_old: 3 The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit, He ceased to act prudently—to do good.

content: 4 Iniquity he deviseth on his bed, He stationeth himself on a way not good, Evil he doth not refuse.’
content_old: 4 Iniquity he deviseth on his bed, He stationeth himself on a way not good, Evil he doth not refuse.’

content: 5 O Jehovah, in the heavens is Thy kindness, Thy faithfulness is unto the clouds.
content_old: 5 O Jehovah, in the heavens is Thy kindness, Thy faithfulness is unto the clouds.

content: 6 Thy righteousness is as mountains of God, Thy judgments are a great deep. Man and beast Thou savest, O Jehovah.
content_old: 6 Thy righteousness is as mountains of God, Thy judgments are a great deep. Man and beast Thou savest, O Jehovah.

content: 7 How precious is Thy kindness, O God, And the sons of men In the shadow of Thy wings do trust.
content_old: 7 How precious is Thy kindness, O God, And the sons of men In the shadow of Thy wings do trust.

content: 8 They are filled from the fatness of Thy house, And the stream of Thy delights Thou dost cause them to drink.
content_old: 8 They are filled from the fatness of Thy house, And the stream of Thy delights Thou dost cause them to drink.

content: 9 For with Thee is a fountain of life, In Thy light we see light.
content_old: 9 For with Thee is a fountain of life, In Thy light we see light.

content: 10 Draw out Thy kindness to those knowing Thee, And Thy righteousness to the upright of heart.
content_old: 10 Draw out Thy kindness to those knowing Thee, And Thy righteousness to the upright of heart.

content: 11 Let not a foot of pride meet me, And a hand of the wicked let not move me.
content_old: 11 Let not a foot of pride meet me, And a hand of the wicked let not move me.

content: 1 By David. Do not fret because of evil doers, Be not envious against doers of iniquity,
content_old: 1 By David. Do not fret because of evil doers, Be not envious against doers of iniquity,

content: 2 For as grass speedily they are cut off, And as the greenness of the tender grass do fade.
content_old: 2 For as grass speedily they are cut off, And as the greenness of the tender grass do fade.

content: 3 Trust in Jehovah, and do good, Dwell in the land, and enjoy faithfulness,
content_old: 3 Trust in Jehovah, and do good, Dwell in the land, and enjoy faithfulness,

content: 4 And delight thyself on Jehovah, And He giveth to thee the petitions of thy heart.
content_old: 4 And delight thyself on Jehovah, And He giveth to thee the petitions of thy heart.

content: 5 Roll on Jehovah thy way, And trust upon Him, and He worketh,
content_old: 5 Roll on Jehovah thy way, And trust upon Him, and He worketh,

content: 6 And hath brought out as light thy righteousness, And thy judgment as noon-day.
content_old: 6 And hath brought out as light thy righteousness, And thy judgment as noon-day.

content: 7 Be silent for Jehovah, and stay thyself for Him, Do not fret because of him Who is making prosperous his way, Because of a man doing wicked devices.
content_old: 7 Be silent for Jehovah, and stay thyself for Him, Do not fret because of him Who is making prosperous his way, Because of a man doing wicked devices.

content: 8 Desist from anger, and forsake fury, Fret not thyself only to do evil.
content_old: 8 Desist from anger, and forsake fury, Fret not thyself only to do evil.

content: 9 For evil doers are cut off, As to those waiting on Jehovah, they possess the land.
content_old: 9 For evil doers are cut off, As to those waiting on Jehovah, they possess the land.

content: 10 And yet a little, and the wicked is not, And thou hast considered his place, and it is not.
content_old: 10 And yet a little, and the wicked is not, And thou hast considered his place, and it is not.

content: 11 And the humble do possess the land, And they have delighted themselves In the abundance of peace.
content_old: 11 And the humble do possess the land, And they have delighted themselves In the abundance of peace.

content: 12 The wicked is devising against the righteous, And gnashing against him his teeth.
content_old: 12 The wicked is devising against the righteous, And gnashing against him his teeth.

content: 13 The Lord doth laugh at him, For He hath seen that his day cometh.
content_old: 13 The Lord doth laugh at him, For He hath seen that his day cometh.

content: 14 A sword have the wicked opened, And they have trodden their bow, To cause to fall the poor and needy, To slaughter the upright of the way.
content_old: 14 A sword have the wicked opened, And they have trodden their bow, To cause to fall the poor and needy, To slaughter the upright of the way.

content: 15 Their sword doth enter into their own heart, And their bows are shivered.
content_old: 15 Their sword doth enter into their own heart, And their bows are shivered.

content: 16 Better is the little of the righteous, Than the store of many wicked.
content_old: 16 Better is the little of the righteous, Than the store of many wicked.

content: 17 For the arms of the wicked are shivered, And Jehovah is sustaining the righteous.
content_old: 17 For the arms of the wicked are shivered, And Jehovah is sustaining the righteous.

content: 18 Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect, And their inheritance is—to the age.
content_old: 18 Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect, And their inheritance is—to the age.

content: 19 They are not ashamed in a time of evil, And in days of famine they are satisfied.
content_old: 19 They are not ashamed in a time of evil, And in days of famine they are satisfied.

content: 20 But the wicked perish, and the enemies of Jehovah, As the preciousness of lambs, Have been consumed, In smoke they have been consumed.
content_old: 20 But the wicked perish, and the enemies of Jehovah, As the preciousness of lambs, Have been consumed, In smoke they have been consumed.

content: 21 The wicked is borrowing and repayeth not, And the righteous is gracious and giving.
content_old: 21 The wicked is borrowing and repayeth not, And the righteous is gracious and giving.

content: 22 For His blessed ones do possess the land, And His reviled ones are cut off.
content_old: 22 For His blessed ones do possess the land, And His reviled ones are cut off.

content: 23 From Jehovah are the steps of a man, They have been prepared, And his way he desireth.
content_old: 23 From Jehovah are the steps of a man, They have been prepared, And his way he desireth.

content: 24 When he falleth, he is not cast down, For Jehovah is sustaining his hand.
content_old: 24 When he falleth, he is not cast down, For Jehovah is sustaining his hand.

content: 25 Young I have been, I have also become old, And I have not seen the righteous forsaken, And his seed seeking bread.
content_old: 25 Young I have been, I have also become old, And I have not seen the righteous forsaken, And his seed seeking bread.

content: 26 All the day he is gracious and lending, And his seed is for a blessing.
content_old: 26 All the day he is gracious and lending, And his seed is for a blessing.

content: 27 Turn aside from evil, and do good, and dwell to the age.
content_old: 27 Turn aside from evil, and do good, and dwell to the age.

content: 28 For Jehovah is loving judgment, And He doth not forsake His saintly ones, To the age they have been kept, And the seed of the wicked is cut off.
content_old: 28 For Jehovah is loving judgment, And He doth not forsake His saintly ones, To the age they have been kept, And the seed of the wicked is cut off.

content: 29 The righteous possess the land, And they dwell for ever on it.
content_old: 29 The righteous possess the land, And they dwell for ever on it.

content: 30 The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, And his tongue speaketh judgment.
content_old: 30 The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, And his tongue speaketh judgment.

content: 31 The law of his God is his heart, His steps do not slide.
content_old: 31 The law of his God is his heart, His steps do not slide.

content: 32 The wicked is watching for the righteous, And is seeking to put him to death.
content_old: 32 The wicked is watching for the righteous, And is seeking to put him to death.

content: 33 Jehovah doth not leave him in his hand, Nor condemn him in his being judged.
content_old: 33 Jehovah doth not leave him in his hand, Nor condemn him in his being judged.

content: 34 Look unto Jehovah, and keep His way, And He doth exalt thee to possess the land, In the wicked being cut off—thou seest!
content_old: 34 Look unto Jehovah, and keep His way, And He doth exalt thee to possess the land, In the wicked being cut off—thou seest!

content: 35 I have seen the wicked terrible, And spreading as a green native plant,
content_old: 35 I have seen the wicked terrible, And spreading as a green native plant,

content: 36 And he passeth away, and lo, he is not, And I seek him, and he is not found!
content_old: 36 And he passeth away, and lo, he is not, And I seek him, and he is not found!

content: 37 Observe the perfect, and see the upright, For the latter end of each is peace.
content_old: 37 Observe the perfect, and see the upright, For the latter end of each is peace.

content: 38 And transgressors were destroyed together, The latter end of the wicked was cut off.
content_old: 38 And transgressors were destroyed together, The latter end of the wicked was cut off.

content: 39 And the salvation of the righteous is from Jehovah, Their strong place in a time of adversity.
content_old: 39 And the salvation of the righteous is from Jehovah, Their strong place in a time of adversity.

content: 1 A Psalm of David, ‘To cause to remember.’ Jehovah, in Thy wrath reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David, ‘To cause to remember.’ Jehovah, in Thy wrath reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.

content: 2 For Thine arrows have come down on me, And Thou lettest down upon me Thy hand.
content_old: 2 For Thine arrows have come down on me, And Thou lettest down upon me Thy hand.

content: 3 Soundness is not in my flesh, Because of Thine indignation, Peace is not in my bones because of my sin.
content_old: 3 Soundness is not in my flesh, Because of Thine indignation, Peace is not in my bones because of my sin.

content: 4 For mine iniquities have passed over my head, As a heavy burden—too heavy for me.
content_old: 4 For mine iniquities have passed over my head, As a heavy burden—too heavy for me.

content: 5 Stunk—become corrupt have my wounds, Because of my folly.
content_old: 5 Stunk—become corrupt have my wounds, Because of my folly.

content: 6 I have been bent down, I have been bowed down—unto excess, All the day I have gone mourning.
content_old: 6 I have been bent down, I have been bowed down—unto excess, All the day I have gone mourning.

content: 7 For my flanks have been full of drought, And soundness is not in my flesh.
content_old: 7 For my flanks have been full of drought, And soundness is not in my flesh.

content: 8 I have been feeble and smitten—unto excess, I have roared from disquietude of heart.
content_old: 8 I have been feeble and smitten—unto excess, I have roared from disquietude of heart.

content: 9 Lord, before Thee is all my desire, And my sighing from Thee hath not been hid.
content_old: 9 Lord, before Thee is all my desire, And my sighing from Thee hath not been hid.

content: 10 My heart is panting, my power hath forsaken me, And the light of mine eyes, Even they are not with me.
content_old: 10 My heart is panting, my power hath forsaken me, And the light of mine eyes, Even they are not with me.

content: 11 My lovers and my friends over-against my plague stand. And my neighbours afar off have stood.
content_old: 11 My lovers and my friends over-against my plague stand. And my neighbours afar off have stood.

content: 12 And those seeking my soul lay a snare, And those seeking my evil Have spoken mischievous things, And they do deceits meditate all the day.
content_old: 12 And those seeking my soul lay a snare, And those seeking my evil Have spoken mischievous things, And they do deceits meditate all the day.

content: 13 And I, as deaf, hear not. And as a dumb one who openeth not his mouth.
content_old: 13 And I, as deaf, hear not. And as a dumb one who openeth not his mouth.

content: 14 Yea, I am as a man who heareth not, And in his mouth are no reproofs.
content_old: 14 Yea, I am as a man who heareth not, And in his mouth are no reproofs.

content: 15 Because for Thee, O Jehovah, I have waited, Thou dost answer, O Lord my God.
content_old: 15 Because for Thee, O Jehovah, I have waited, Thou dost answer, O Lord my God.

content: 16 When I said, ‘Lest they rejoice over me, In the slipping of my foot against me they magnified themselves.
content_old: 16 When I said, ‘Lest they rejoice over me, In the slipping of my foot against me they magnified themselves.

content: 17 For I am ready to halt, And my pain is before me continually.
content_old: 17 For I am ready to halt, And my pain is before me continually.

content: 18 For mine iniquity I declare, I am sorry for my sin.
content_old: 18 For mine iniquity I declare, I am sorry for my sin.

content: 19 And mine enemies are lively, They have been strong, and those hating me without cause, Have been multiplied.
content_old: 19 And mine enemies are lively, They have been strong, and those hating me without cause, Have been multiplied.

content: 20 And those paying evil for good accuse me, Because of my pursuing good.
content_old: 20 And those paying evil for good accuse me, Because of my pursuing good.

content: 21 Do not forsake me, O Jehovah, My God, be not far from me,
content_old: 21 Do not forsake me, O Jehovah, My God, be not far from me,

content: 1 To the Overseer, to Jeduthun.—A Psalm of David. I have said, ‘I observe my ways, Against sinning with my tongue, I keep for my mouth a curb, while the wicked is before me.’
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, to Jeduthun.—A Psalm of David. I have said, ‘I observe my ways, Against sinning with my tongue, I keep for my mouth a curb, while the wicked is before me.’

content: 2 I was dumb with silence, I kept silent from good, and my pain is excited.
content_old: 2 I was dumb with silence, I kept silent from good, and my pain is excited.

content: 3 Hot is my heart within me, In my meditating doth the fire burn, I have spoken with my tongue.
content_old: 3 Hot is my heart within me, In my meditating doth the fire burn, I have spoken with my tongue.

content: 4 ‘Cause me to know, O Jehovah, mine end, And the measure of my days—what it is,’ I know how frail I am.
content_old: 4 ‘Cause me to know, O Jehovah, mine end, And the measure of my days—what it is,’ I know how frail I am.

content: 5 Lo, handbreadths Thou hast made my days, And mine age is as nothing before Thee, Only, all vanity is every man set up. Selah.
content_old: 5 Lo, handbreadths Thou hast made my days, And mine age is as nothing before Thee, Only, all vanity is every man set up. Selah.

content: 6 Only, in an image doth each walk habitually, Only, in vain, they are disquieted, He heapeth up and knoweth not who gathereth them.
content_old: 6 Only, in an image doth each walk habitually, Only, in vain, they are disquieted, He heapeth up and knoweth not who gathereth them.

content: 7 And, now, what have I expected? O Lord, my hope—it is of Thee.
content_old: 7 And, now, what have I expected? O Lord, my hope—it is of Thee.

content: 8 From all my transgressions deliver me, A reproach of the fool make me not.
content_old: 8 From all my transgressions deliver me, A reproach of the fool make me not.

content: 9 I have been dumb, I open not my mouth, Because Thou���Thou hast done it.
content_old: 9 I have been dumb, I open not my mouth, Because Thou���Thou hast done it.

content: 10 Turn aside from off me Thy stroke, From the striving of Thy hand I have been consumed.
content_old: 10 Turn aside from off me Thy stroke, From the striving of Thy hand I have been consumed.

content: 11 With reproofs against iniquity, Thou hast corrected man, And dost waste as a moth his desirableness, Only, vanity is every man. Selah.
content_old: 11 With reproofs against iniquity, Thou hast corrected man, And dost waste as a moth his desirableness, Only, vanity is every man. Selah.

content: 12 Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, And to my cry give ear, Unto my tear be not silent, For a sojourner I am with Thee, A settler like all my fathers.
content_old: 12 Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, And to my cry give ear, Unto my tear be not silent, For a sojourner I am with Thee, A settler like all my fathers.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. I have diligently expected Jehovah, And He inclineth to me, and heareth my cry,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. I have diligently expected Jehovah, And He inclineth to me, and heareth my cry,

content: 2 And He doth cause me to come up From a pit of desolation—from mire of mud, And He raiseth up on a rock my feet, He is establishing my steps.
content_old: 2 And He doth cause me to come up From a pit of desolation—from mire of mud, And He raiseth up on a rock my feet, He is establishing my steps.

content: 3 And He putteth in my mouth a new song, ‘Praise to our God.’ Many do see and fear, and trust in Jehovah.
content_old: 3 And He putteth in my mouth a new song, ‘Praise to our God.’ Many do see and fear, and trust in Jehovah.

content: 4 O the happiness of the man Who hath made Jehovah his trust, And hath not turned unto the proud, And those turning aside to lies.
content_old: 4 O the happiness of the man Who hath made Jehovah his trust, And hath not turned unto the proud, And those turning aside to lies.

content: 5 Much hast Thou done, Jehovah my God; Thy wonders and Thy thoughts toward us, There is none to arrange unto Thee, I declare and speak: They have been more than to be numbered.
content_old: 5 Much hast Thou done, Jehovah my God; Thy wonders and Thy thoughts toward us, There is none to arrange unto Thee, I declare and speak: They have been more than to be numbered.

content: 6 Sacrifice and present Thou hast not desired, Ears Thou hast prepared for me, Burnt and sin-offering Thou hast not asked.
content_old: 6 Sacrifice and present Thou hast not desired, Ears Thou hast prepared for me, Burnt and sin-offering Thou hast not asked.

content: 7 Then said I, ‘Lo, I have come,’ In the roll of the book it is written of me,
content_old: 7 Then said I, ‘Lo, I have come,’ In the roll of the book it is written of me,

content: 8 To do Thy pleasure, my God, I have delighted, And Thy law is within my heart.
content_old: 8 To do Thy pleasure, my God, I have delighted, And Thy law is within my heart.

content: 9 I have proclaimed tidings of righteousness In the great assembly, lo, my lips I restrain not, O Jehovah, Thou hast known.
content_old: 9 I have proclaimed tidings of righteousness In the great assembly, lo, my lips I restrain not, O Jehovah, Thou hast known.

content: 10 Thy righteousness I have not concealed In the midst of my heart, Thy faithfulness and Thy salvation I have told, I have not hidden Thy kindness and Thy truth, To the great assembly.
content_old: 10 Thy righteousness I have not concealed In the midst of my heart, Thy faithfulness and Thy salvation I have told, I have not hidden Thy kindness and Thy truth, To the great assembly.

content: 11 Thou, O Jehovah, restrainest not Thy mercies from me, Thy kindness and Thy truth do continually keep me.
content_old: 11 Thou, O Jehovah, restrainest not Thy mercies from me, Thy kindness and Thy truth do continually keep me.

content: 12 For compassed me have evils innumerable, Overtaken me have mine iniquities, And I have not been able to see; They have been more than the hairs of my head, And my heart hath forsaken me.
content_old: 12 For compassed me have evils innumerable, Overtaken me have mine iniquities, And I have not been able to see; They have been more than the hairs of my head, And my heart hath forsaken me.

content: 13 Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me, O Jehovah, for my help make haste.
content_old: 13 Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me, O Jehovah, for my help make haste.

content: 14 They are ashamed and confounded together, Who are seeking my soul to destroy it, They are turned backward, And are ashamed, who are desiring my evil.
content_old: 14 They are ashamed and confounded together, Who are seeking my soul to destroy it, They are turned backward, And are ashamed, who are desiring my evil.

content: 15 They are desolate because of their shame, Who are saying to me, ‘Aha, aha.’
content_old: 15 They are desolate because of their shame, Who are saying to me, ‘Aha, aha.’

content: 16 All seeking Thee rejoice and are glad in Thee, Those loving Thy salvation say continually, ‘Jehovah is magnified.’
content_old: 16 All seeking Thee rejoice and are glad in Thee, Those loving Thy salvation say continually, ‘Jehovah is magnified.’

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. O the happiness of him Who is acting wisely unto the poor, In a day of evil doth Jehovah deliver him.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. O the happiness of him Who is acting wisely unto the poor, In a day of evil doth Jehovah deliver him.

content: 2 Jehovah doth preserve him and revive him, He is happy in the land, And Thou givest him not into the will of his enemies.
content_old: 2 Jehovah doth preserve him and revive him, He is happy in the land, And Thou givest him not into the will of his enemies.

content: 3 Jehovah supporteth on a couch of sickness, All his bed Thou hast turned in his weakness.
content_old: 3 Jehovah supporteth on a couch of sickness, All his bed Thou hast turned in his weakness.

content: 4 I—I said, ‘O Jehovah, favour me, Heal my soul, for I did sin against Thee,’
content_old: 4 I—I said, ‘O Jehovah, favour me, Heal my soul, for I did sin against Thee,’

content: 5 Mine enemies say evil of me: When he dieth—his name hath perished!
content_old: 5 Mine enemies say evil of me: When he dieth—his name hath perished!

content: 6 And if he came to see—vanity he speaketh, His heart gathereth iniquity to itself, He goeth out—at the street he speaketh.
content_old: 6 And if he came to see—vanity he speaketh, His heart gathereth iniquity to itself, He goeth out—at the street he speaketh.

content: 7 All hating me whisper together against me, Against me they devise evil to me:
content_old: 7 All hating me whisper together against me, Against me they devise evil to me:

content: 8 A thing of Belial is poured out on him, And because he lay down he riseth not again.
content_old: 8 A thing of Belial is poured out on him, And because he lay down he riseth not again.

content: 9 Even mine ally, in whom I trusted, One eating my bread, made great the heel against me,
content_old: 9 Even mine ally, in whom I trusted, One eating my bread, made great the heel against me,

content: 10 And Thou, Jehovah, favour me, And cause me to rise, And I give recompence to them.
content_old: 10 And Thou, Jehovah, favour me, And cause me to rise, And I give recompence to them.

content: 11 By this I have known, That Thou hast delighted in me, Because my enemy shouteth not over me.
content_old: 11 By this I have known, That Thou hast delighted in me, Because my enemy shouteth not over me.

content: 12 As to me, in mine integrity, Thou hast taken hold upon me, And causest me to stand before Thee to the age.
content_old: 12 As to me, in mine integrity, Thou hast taken hold upon me, And causest me to stand before Thee to the age.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—An Instruction. By sons of Korah. As a hart doth pant for streams of water, So my soul panteth toward Thee, O God.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—An Instruction. By sons of Korah. As a hart doth pant for streams of water, So my soul panteth toward Thee, O God.

content: 2 My soul thirsted for God, for the living God, When do I enter and see the face of God?
content_old: 2 My soul thirsted for God, for the living God, When do I enter and see the face of God?

content: 3 My tear hath been to me bread day and night, In their saying unto me all the day, ‘Where is thy God?’
content_old: 3 My tear hath been to me bread day and night, In their saying unto me all the day, ‘Where is thy God?’

content: 4 These I remember, and pour out my soul in me, For I pass over into the booth, I go softly with them unto the house of God, With the voice of singing and confession, The multitude keeping feast!
content_old: 4 These I remember, and pour out my soul in me, For I pass over into the booth, I go softly with them unto the house of God, With the voice of singing and confession, The multitude keeping feast!

content: 5 What! bowest thou thyself, O my soul? Yea, art thou troubled within me? Wait for God, for still I confess Him: The salvation of my countenance—My God!
content_old: 5 What! bowest thou thyself, O my soul? Yea, art thou troubled within me? Wait for God, for still I confess Him: The salvation of my countenance—My God!

content: 6 In me doth my soul bow itself, Therefore I remember Thee from the land of Jordan, And of the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.
content_old: 6 In me doth my soul bow itself, Therefore I remember Thee from the land of Jordan, And of the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.

content: 7 Deep unto deep is calling At the noise of Thy water-spouts, All Thy breakers and Thy billows passed over me.
content_old: 7 Deep unto deep is calling At the noise of Thy water-spouts, All Thy breakers and Thy billows passed over me.

content: 8 By day Jehovah commandeth His kindness, And by night a song is with me, A prayer to the God of my life.
content_old: 8 By day Jehovah commandeth His kindness, And by night a song is with me, A prayer to the God of my life.

content: 9 I say to God my rock, ‘Why hast Thou forgotten me? Why go I mourning in the oppression of an enemy?
content_old: 9 I say to God my rock, ‘Why hast Thou forgotten me? Why go I mourning in the oppression of an enemy?

content: 10 With a sword in my bones Have mine adversaries reproached me, In their saying unto me all the day, ‘Where is thy God?’
content_old: 10 With a sword in my bones Have mine adversaries reproached me, In their saying unto me all the day, ‘Where is thy God?’

content: 1 Judge me, O God, And plead my cause against a nation not pious, From a man of deceit and perverseness Thou dost deliver me,
content_old: 1 Judge me, O God, And plead my cause against a nation not pious, From a man of deceit and perverseness Thou dost deliver me,

content: 2 For thou art the God of my strength. Why hast Thou cast me off? Why mourning do I go up and down, In the oppression of an enemy?
content_old: 2 For thou art the God of my strength. Why hast Thou cast me off? Why mourning do I go up and down, In the oppression of an enemy?

content: 3 Send forth Thy light and Thy truth, They—they lead me, they bring me in, Unto Thy holy hill, and unto Thy tabernacles.
content_old: 3 Send forth Thy light and Thy truth, They—they lead me, they bring me in, Unto Thy holy hill, and unto Thy tabernacles.

content: 4 And I go in unto the altar of God, Unto God, the joy of my rejoicing. And I thank Thee with a harp, O God, my God.
content_old: 4 And I go in unto the altar of God, Unto God, the joy of my rejoicing. And I thank Thee with a harp, O God, my God.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. An Instruction. O God, with our ears we have heard, Our fathers have recounted to us, The work Thou didst work in their days, In the days of old.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. An Instruction. O God, with our ears we have heard, Our fathers have recounted to us, The work Thou didst work in their days, In the days of old.

content: 2 Thou, with Thy hand, nations hast dispossessed. And Thou dost plant them. Thou afflictest peoples, and sendest them away.
content_old: 2 Thou, with Thy hand, nations hast dispossessed. And Thou dost plant them. Thou afflictest peoples, and sendest them away.

content: 3 For, not by their sword Possessed they the land, And their arm gave not salvation to them, But Thy right hand, and Thine arm, And the light of Thy countenance, Because Thou hadst accepted them.
content_old: 3 For, not by their sword Possessed they the land, And their arm gave not salvation to them, But Thy right hand, and Thine arm, And the light of Thy countenance, Because Thou hadst accepted them.

content: 4 Thou art He, my king, O God, Command the deliverances of Jacob.
content_old: 4 Thou art He, my king, O God, Command the deliverances of Jacob.

content: 5 By Thee our adversaries we do push, By Thy name tread down our withstanders,
content_old: 5 By Thee our adversaries we do push, By Thy name tread down our withstanders,

content: 6 For, not in my bow do I trust, And my sword doth not save me.
content_old: 6 For, not in my bow do I trust, And my sword doth not save me.

content: 7 For Thou hast saved us from our adversaries, And those hating us Thou hast put to shame.
content_old: 7 For Thou hast saved us from our adversaries, And those hating us Thou hast put to shame.

content: 8 In God we have boasted all the day, And Thy name to the age we thank. Selah.
content_old: 8 In God we have boasted all the day, And Thy name to the age we thank. Selah.

content: 9 In anger Thou hast cast off and causest us to blush, And goest not forth with our hosts.
content_old: 9 In anger Thou hast cast off and causest us to blush, And goest not forth with our hosts.

content: 10 Thou causest us to turn backward from an adversary, And those hating us, Have spoiled for themselves.
content_old: 10 Thou causest us to turn backward from an adversary, And those hating us, Have spoiled for themselves.

content: 11 Thou makest us food like sheep, And among nations Thou hast scattered us.
content_old: 11 Thou makest us food like sheep, And among nations Thou hast scattered us.

content: 12 Thou sellest Thy people—without wealth, And hast not become great by their price.
content_old: 12 Thou sellest Thy people—without wealth, And hast not become great by their price.

content: 13 Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a reproach to our surrounders.
content_old: 13 Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a reproach to our surrounders.

content: 14 Thou makest us a simile among nations, A shaking of the head among peoples.
content_old: 14 Thou makest us a simile among nations, A shaking of the head among peoples.

content: 15 All the day my confusion is before me, And the shame of my face hath covered me.
content_old: 15 All the day my confusion is before me, And the shame of my face hath covered me.

content: 16 Because of the voice of a reproacher and reviler, Because of an enemy and a self-avenger.
content_old: 16 Because of the voice of a reproacher and reviler, Because of an enemy and a self-avenger.

content: 17 All this met us, and we did not forget Thee, Nor have we dealt falsely in Thy covenant.
content_old: 17 All this met us, and we did not forget Thee, Nor have we dealt falsely in Thy covenant.

content: 18 We turn not backward our heart, Nor turn aside doth our step from Thy path.
content_old: 18 We turn not backward our heart, Nor turn aside doth our step from Thy path.

content: 19 But Thou hast smitten us in a place of dragons, And dost cover us over with death-shade.
content_old: 19 But Thou hast smitten us in a place of dragons, And dost cover us over with death-shade.

content: 20 If we have forgotten the name of our God, And spread our hands to a strange God,
content_old: 20 If we have forgotten the name of our God, And spread our hands to a strange God,

content: 21 Doth not God search out this? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.
content_old: 21 Doth not God search out this? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.

content: 22 Surely, for Thy sake we have been slain all the day, Reckoned as sheep of the slaughter.
content_old: 22 Surely, for Thy sake we have been slain all the day, Reckoned as sheep of the slaughter.

content: 23 Stir up—why dost Thou sleep, O Lord? Awake, cast us not off for ever.
content_old: 23 Stir up—why dost Thou sleep, O Lord? Awake, cast us not off for ever.

content: 24 Why Thy face hidest Thou? Thou forgettest our afflictions and our oppression,
content_old: 24 Why Thy face hidest Thou? Thou forgettest our afflictions and our oppression,

content: 25 For bowed to the dust hath our soul, Cleaved to the earth hath our belly.
content_old: 25 For bowed to the dust hath our soul, Cleaved to the earth hath our belly.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Lilies.’—By sons of Korah.—An Instruction.—A song of loves. My heart hath indited a good thing, I am telling my works to a king, My tongue is the pen of a speedy writer.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Lilies.’—By sons of Korah.—An Instruction.—A song of loves. My heart hath indited a good thing, I am telling my works to a king, My tongue is the pen of a speedy writer.

content: 2 Thou hast been beautified above the sons of men, Grace hath been poured into thy lips, Therefore hath God blessed thee to the age.
content_old: 2 Thou hast been beautified above the sons of men, Grace hath been poured into thy lips, Therefore hath God blessed thee to the age.

content: 3 Gird Thy sword upon the thigh, O mighty, Thy glory and Thy majesty!
content_old: 3 Gird Thy sword upon the thigh, O mighty, Thy glory and Thy majesty!

content: 4 As to Thy majesty—prosper!—ride! Because of truth, and meekness—righteousness, And Thy right hand showeth Thee fearful things.
content_old: 4 As to Thy majesty—prosper!—ride! Because of truth, and meekness—righteousness, And Thy right hand showeth Thee fearful things.

content: 5 Thine arrows are sharp,—Peoples fall under Thee—In the heart of the enemies of the king.
content_old: 5 Thine arrows are sharp,—Peoples fall under Thee—In the heart of the enemies of the king.

content: 6 Thy throne, O God, is age-during, and for ever, A sceptre of uprightness Is the sceptre of Thy kingdom.
content_old: 6 Thy throne, O God, is age-during, and for ever, A sceptre of uprightness Is the sceptre of Thy kingdom.

content: 7 Thou hast loved righteousness and hatest wickedness, Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee, Oil of joy above thy companions.
content_old: 7 Thou hast loved righteousness and hatest wickedness, Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee, Oil of joy above thy companions.

content: 8 Myrrh and aloes, cassia! all thy garments, Out of palaces of ivory Stringed instruments have made thee glad.
content_old: 8 Myrrh and aloes, cassia! all thy garments, Out of palaces of ivory Stringed instruments have made thee glad.

content: 9 Daughters of kings are among thy precious ones, A queen hath stood at thy right hand, In pure gold of Ophir.
content_old: 9 Daughters of kings are among thy precious ones, A queen hath stood at thy right hand, In pure gold of Ophir.

content: 10 Hearken, O daughter, and see, incline thine ear, And forget thy people, and thy father’s house,
content_old: 10 Hearken, O daughter, and see, incline thine ear, And forget thy people, and thy father’s house,

content: 11 And the king doth desire thy beauty, Because he is thy lord—bow thyself to him,
content_old: 11 And the king doth desire thy beauty, Because he is thy lord—bow thyself to him,

content: 12 And the daughter of Tyre with a present, The rich of the people do appease thy face.
content_old: 12 And the daughter of Tyre with a present, The rich of the people do appease thy face.

content: 13 All glory is the daughter of the king within, Of gold-embroidered work is her clothing.
content_old: 13 All glory is the daughter of the king within, Of gold-embroidered work is her clothing.

content: 14 In divers colours she is brought to the king, Virgins—after her—her companions, Are brought to thee.
content_old: 14 In divers colours she is brought to the king, Virgins—after her—her companions, Are brought to thee.

content: 15 They are brought with joy and gladness, They come into the palace of the king.
content_old: 15 They are brought with joy and gladness, They come into the palace of the king.

content: 16 Instead of thy fathers are thy sons, Thou dost appoint them for princes in all the earth.
content_old: 16 Instead of thy fathers are thy sons, Thou dost appoint them for princes in all the earth.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. ‘For the Virgins.’—A song. God is to us a refuge and strength, A help in adversities found most surely.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. ‘For the Virgins.’—A song. God is to us a refuge and strength, A help in adversities found most surely.

content: 2 Therefore we fear not in the changing of earth, And in the slipping of mountains Into the heart of the seas.
content_old: 2 Therefore we fear not in the changing of earth, And in the slipping of mountains Into the heart of the seas.

content: 3 Roar—troubled are its waters, Mountains they shake in its pride. Selah.
content_old: 3 Roar—troubled are its waters, Mountains they shake in its pride. Selah.

content: 4 A river—its rivulets rejoice the city of God, Thy holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.
content_old: 4 A river—its rivulets rejoice the city of God, Thy holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.

content: 5 God is in her midst—she is not moved, God doth help her at the turn of the morn!
content_old: 5 God is in her midst—she is not moved, God doth help her at the turn of the morn!

content: 6 Troubled have been nations, Moved have been kingdoms, He hath given forth with His voice, earth melteth.
content_old: 6 Troubled have been nations, Moved have been kingdoms, He hath given forth with His voice, earth melteth.

content: 7 Jehovah of Hosts is with us, A tower for us is the God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 7 Jehovah of Hosts is with us, A tower for us is the God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 8 Come ye, see the works of Jehovah, Who hath done astonishing things in the earth,
content_old: 8 Come ye, see the works of Jehovah, Who hath done astonishing things in the earth,

content: 9 Causing wars to cease, Unto the end of the earth, the bow he shivereth, And the spear He hath cut asunder, Chariots he doth burn with fire.
content_old: 9 Causing wars to cease, Unto the end of the earth, the bow he shivereth, And the spear He hath cut asunder, Chariots he doth burn with fire.

content: 10 Desist, and know that I am God, I am exalted among nations, I am exalted in the earth.
content_old: 10 Desist, and know that I am God, I am exalted among nations, I am exalted in the earth.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. A Psalm. All ye peoples, clap the hand, Shout to God with a voice of singing,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. A Psalm. All ye peoples, clap the hand, Shout to God with a voice of singing,

content: 2 For Jehovah Most High is fearful, A great king over all the earth.
content_old: 2 For Jehovah Most High is fearful, A great king over all the earth.

content: 3 He leadeth peoples under us, and nations under our feet.
content_old: 3 He leadeth peoples under us, and nations under our feet.

content: 4 He doth choose for us our inheritance, The excellency of Jacob that He loves. Selah.
content_old: 4 He doth choose for us our inheritance, The excellency of Jacob that He loves. Selah.

content: 5 God hath gone up with a shout, Jehovah with the sound of a trumpet.
content_old: 5 God hath gone up with a shout, Jehovah with the sound of a trumpet.

content: 6 Praise God—praise—give praise to our king, praise.
content_old: 6 Praise God—praise—give praise to our king, praise.

content: 7 For king of all the earth is God, Give praise, O understanding one.
content_old: 7 For king of all the earth is God, Give praise, O understanding one.

content: 8 God hath reigned over nations, God hath sat on His holy throne,
content_old: 8 God hath reigned over nations, God hath sat on His holy throne,

content: 1 A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah. Great is Jehovah, and praised greatly, In the city of our God—His holy hill.
content_old: 1 A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah. Great is Jehovah, and praised greatly, In the city of our God—His holy hill.

content: 2 Beautiful for elevation, A joy of all the land, is Mount Zion, The sides of the north, the city of a great king.
content_old: 2 Beautiful for elevation, A joy of all the land, is Mount Zion, The sides of the north, the city of a great king.

content: 3 God in her high places is known for a tower.
content_old: 3 God in her high places is known for a tower.

content: 4 For, lo, the kings met, they passed by together,
content_old: 4 For, lo, the kings met, they passed by together,

content: 5 They have seen—so they have marvelled, They have been troubled, they were hastened away.
content_old: 5 They have seen—so they have marvelled, They have been troubled, they were hastened away.

content: 6 Trembling hath seized them there, Pain, as of a travailing woman.
content_old: 6 Trembling hath seized them there, Pain, as of a travailing woman.

content: 7 By an east wind Thou shiverest ships of Tarshish.
content_old: 7 By an east wind Thou shiverest ships of Tarshish.

content: 8 As we have heard, so we have seen, In the city of Jehovah of hosts, In the city of our God, God doth establish her—to the age. Selah.
content_old: 8 As we have heard, so we have seen, In the city of Jehovah of hosts, In the city of our God, God doth establish her—to the age. Selah.

content: 9 We have thought, O God, of Thy kindness, In the midst of Thy temple,
content_old: 9 We have thought, O God, of Thy kindness, In the midst of Thy temple,

content: 10 As is Thy name, O God, so is Thy praise, Over the ends of the earth, Righteousness hath filled Thy right hand.
content_old: 10 As is Thy name, O God, so is Thy praise, Over the ends of the earth, Righteousness hath filled Thy right hand.

content: 11 Rejoice doth Mount Zion, The daughters of Judah are joyful, For the sake of Thy judgments.
content_old: 11 Rejoice doth Mount Zion, The daughters of Judah are joyful, For the sake of Thy judgments.

content: 12 Compass Zion, and go round her, count her towers,
content_old: 12 Compass Zion, and go round her, count her towers,

content: 13 Set your heart to her bulwark, Consider her high places, So that ye recount to a later generation,
content_old: 13 Set your heart to her bulwark, Consider her high places, So that ye recount to a later generation,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Hear this, all ye peoples, Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Hear this, all ye peoples, Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world.

content: 2 Both low and high, together rich and needy.
content_old: 2 Both low and high, together rich and needy.

content: 3 My mouth speaketh wise things, And the meditations of my heart are things of understanding.
content_old: 3 My mouth speaketh wise things, And the meditations of my heart are things of understanding.

content: 4 I incline to a simile mine ear, I open with a harp my riddle:
content_old: 4 I incline to a simile mine ear, I open with a harp my riddle:

content: 5 Why do I fear in days of evil? The iniquity of my supplanters doth compass me.
content_old: 5 Why do I fear in days of evil? The iniquity of my supplanters doth compass me.

content: 6 Those trusting on their wealth, And in the multitude of their riches, Do shew themselves foolish.
content_old: 6 Those trusting on their wealth, And in the multitude of their riches, Do shew themselves foolish.

content: 7 A brother doth no one at all ransom, He doth not give to God his atonement.
content_old: 7 A brother doth no one at all ransom, He doth not give to God his atonement.

content: 8 And precious is the redemption of their soul, And it hath ceased—to the age.
content_old: 8 And precious is the redemption of their soul, And it hath ceased—to the age.

content: 9 And still he liveth for ever, He seeth not the pit.
content_old: 9 And still he liveth for ever, He seeth not the pit.

content: 10 For he seeth wise men die, Together the foolish and brutish perish, And have left to others their wealth.
content_old: 10 For he seeth wise men die, Together the foolish and brutish perish, And have left to others their wealth.

content: 11 Their heart is: Their houses are to the age, Their tabernacles to all generations. They proclaimed their names over the lands.
content_old: 11 Their heart is: Their houses are to the age, Their tabernacles to all generations. They proclaimed their names over the lands.

content: 12 And man in honour doth not remain, He hath been like the beasts, they have been cut off.
content_old: 12 And man in honour doth not remain, He hath been like the beasts, they have been cut off.

content: 13 This their way is folly for them, And their posterity with their sayings are pleased. Selah.
content_old: 13 This their way is folly for them, And their posterity with their sayings are pleased. Selah.

content: 14 As sheep for Sheol they have set themselves, Death doth afflict them, And the upright rule over them in the morning, And their form is for consumption. Sheol is a dwelling for him.
content_old: 14 As sheep for Sheol they have set themselves, Death doth afflict them, And the upright rule over them in the morning, And their form is for consumption. Sheol is a dwelling for him.

content: 15 Only, God doth ransom my soul from the hand of Sheol, For He doth receive me. Selah.
content_old: 15 Only, God doth ransom my soul from the hand of Sheol, For He doth receive me. Selah.

content: 16 Fear not, when one maketh wealth, When the honour of his house is abundant,
content_old: 16 Fear not, when one maketh wealth, When the honour of his house is abundant,

content: 17 For at his death he receiveth nothing, His honour goeth not down after him.
content_old: 17 For at his death he receiveth nothing, His honour goeth not down after him.

content: 18 For his soul in his life he blesseth, (And they praise thee when thou dost well for thyself.)
content_old: 18 For his soul in his life he blesseth, (And they praise thee when thou dost well for thyself.)

content: 19 It cometh to the generation of his fathers, For ever they see not the light.
content_old: 19 It cometh to the generation of his fathers, For ever they see not the light.

content: 1 A Psalm of Asaph. The God of gods—Jehovah—hath spoken, And He calleth to the earth From the rising of the sun unto its going in.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of Asaph. The God of gods—Jehovah—hath spoken, And He calleth to the earth From the rising of the sun unto its going in.

content: 2 From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shone.
content_old: 2 From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shone.

content: 3 Our God cometh, and is not silent, Fire before Him doth devour, And round about him it hath been very tempestuous.
content_old: 3 Our God cometh, and is not silent, Fire before Him doth devour, And round about him it hath been very tempestuous.

content: 4 He doth call unto the heavens from above, And unto the earth, to judge His people.
content_old: 4 He doth call unto the heavens from above, And unto the earth, to judge His people.

content: 5 Gather ye to Me My saints, Making covenant with Me over a sacrifice.
content_old: 5 Gather ye to Me My saints, Making covenant with Me over a sacrifice.

content: 6 And the heavens declare His righteousness, For God Himself is judge. Selah.
content_old: 6 And the heavens declare His righteousness, For God Himself is judge. Selah.

content: 7 Hear, O My people, and I speak, O Israel, and I testify against thee, God, thy God am I.
content_old: 7 Hear, O My people, and I speak, O Israel, and I testify against thee, God, thy God am I.

content: 8 Not for thy sacrifices do I reprove thee, Yea, thy burnt-offerings Are before Me continually.
content_old: 8 Not for thy sacrifices do I reprove thee, Yea, thy burnt-offerings Are before Me continually.

content: 9 I take not from thy house a bullock, From thy folds he goats.
content_old: 9 I take not from thy house a bullock, From thy folds he goats.

content: 10 For Mine is every beast of the forest, The cattle on the hills of oxen.
content_old: 10 For Mine is every beast of the forest, The cattle on the hills of oxen.

content: 11 I have known every fowl of the mountains, And the wild beast of the field is with Me.
content_old: 11 I have known every fowl of the mountains, And the wild beast of the field is with Me.

content: 12 If I am hungry I tell not to thee, For Mine is the world and its fulness.
content_old: 12 If I am hungry I tell not to thee, For Mine is the world and its fulness.

content: 13 Do I eat the flesh of bulls, And drink the blood of he-goats?
content_old: 13 Do I eat the flesh of bulls, And drink the blood of he-goats?

content: 14 Sacrifice to God confession, And complete to the Most High thy vows.
content_old: 14 Sacrifice to God confession, And complete to the Most High thy vows.

content: 15 And call Me in a day of adversity, I deliver thee, and thou honourest Me.
content_old: 15 And call Me in a day of adversity, I deliver thee, and thou honourest Me.

content: 16 And to the wicked hath God said: What to thee—to recount My statutes? That thou liftest up My covenant on thy mouth?
content_old: 16 And to the wicked hath God said: What to thee—to recount My statutes? That thou liftest up My covenant on thy mouth?

content: 17 Yea, thou hast hated instruction, And dost cast My words behind thee.
content_old: 17 Yea, thou hast hated instruction, And dost cast My words behind thee.

content: 18 If thou hast seen a thief, Then thou art pleased with him, And with adulterers is thy portion.
content_old: 18 If thou hast seen a thief, Then thou art pleased with him, And with adulterers is thy portion.

content: 19 Thy mouth thou hast sent forth with evil, And thy tongue joineth deceit together,
content_old: 19 Thy mouth thou hast sent forth with evil, And thy tongue joineth deceit together,

content: 20 Thou sittest, against thy brother thou speakest, Against a son of thy mother givest slander.
content_old: 20 Thou sittest, against thy brother thou speakest, Against a son of thy mother givest slander.

content: 21 These thou didst, and I kept silent, Thou hast thought that I am like thee, I reprove thee, and set in array before thine eyes.
content_old: 21 These thou didst, and I kept silent, Thou hast thought that I am like thee, I reprove thee, and set in array before thine eyes.

content: 22 Understand this, I pray you, Ye who are forgetting God, Lest I tear, and there is no deliverer.
content_old: 22 Understand this, I pray you, Ye who are forgetting God, Lest I tear, and there is no deliverer.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David, in the coming inn unto him of Nathan the prophet, when he hath gone in unto Bath-Sheba. Favour me, O God, according to Thy kindness, According to the abundance of Thy mercies, Blot out my transgressions.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David, in the coming inn unto him of Nathan the prophet, when he hath gone in unto Bath-Sheba. Favour me, O God, according to Thy kindness, According to the abundance of Thy mercies, Blot out my transgressions.

content: 2 Thoroughly wash me from mine iniquity, And from my sin cleanse me,
content_old: 2 Thoroughly wash me from mine iniquity, And from my sin cleanse me,

content: 3 For my transgressions I do know, And my sin is before me continually.
content_old: 3 For my transgressions I do know, And my sin is before me continually.

content: 4 Against Thee, Thee only, I have sinned, And done the evil thing in Thine eyes, So that Thou art righteous in Thy words, Thou art pure in Thy judging.
content_old: 4 Against Thee, Thee only, I have sinned, And done the evil thing in Thine eyes, So that Thou art righteous in Thy words, Thou art pure in Thy judging.

content: 5 Lo, in iniquity I have been brought forth, And in sin doth my mother conceive me.
content_old: 5 Lo, in iniquity I have been brought forth, And in sin doth my mother conceive me.

content: 6 Lo, truth Thou hast desired in the inward parts, And in the hidden part Wisdom Thou causest me to know.
content_old: 6 Lo, truth Thou hast desired in the inward parts, And in the hidden part Wisdom Thou causest me to know.

content: 7 Thou cleansest me with hyssop and I am clean, Washest me, and than snow I am whiter.
content_old: 7 Thou cleansest me with hyssop and I am clean, Washest me, and than snow I am whiter.

content: 8 Thou causest me to hear joy and gladness, Thou makest joyful bones Thou hast bruised.
content_old: 8 Thou causest me to hear joy and gladness, Thou makest joyful bones Thou hast bruised.

content: 9 Hide Thy face from my sin. And all mine iniquities blot out.
content_old: 9 Hide Thy face from my sin. And all mine iniquities blot out.

content: 10 A clean heart prepare for me, O God, And a right spirit renew within me.
content_old: 10 A clean heart prepare for me, O God, And a right spirit renew within me.

content: 11 Cast me not forth from Thy presence, And Thy Holy Spirit take not from me.
content_old: 11 Cast me not forth from Thy presence, And Thy Holy Spirit take not from me.

content: 12 Restore to me the joy of Thy salvation, And a willing spirit doth sustain me.
content_old: 12 Restore to me the joy of Thy salvation, And a willing spirit doth sustain me.

content: 13 I teach transgressors Thy ways, And sinners unto Thee do return.
content_old: 13 I teach transgressors Thy ways, And sinners unto Thee do return.

content: 14 Deliver me from blood, O God, God of my salvation, My tongue singeth of Thy righteousness.
content_old: 14 Deliver me from blood, O God, God of my salvation, My tongue singeth of Thy righteousness.

content: 15 O Lord, my lips thou dost open, And my mouth declareth Thy praise.
content_old: 15 O Lord, my lips thou dost open, And my mouth declareth Thy praise.

content: 16 For Thou desirest not sacrifice, or I give it, Burnt-offering Thou acceptest not.
content_old: 16 For Thou desirest not sacrifice, or I give it, Burnt-offering Thou acceptest not.

content: 17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit, A heart broken and bruised, O God, Thou dost not despise.
content_old: 17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit, A heart broken and bruised, O God, Thou dost not despise.

content: 18 Do good in Thy good pleasure with Zion, Thou dost build the walls of Jerusalem.
content_old: 18 Do good in Thy good pleasure with Zion, Thou dost build the walls of Jerusalem.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—An instruction, by David, in the coming in of Doeg the Edomite, and he declareth to Saul, and saith to him, ‘David came in unto the house of Ahimelech.’ What, boasteth thou in evil, O mighty one? The kindness of God is all the day.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—An instruction, by David, in the coming in of Doeg the Edomite, and he declareth to Saul, and saith to him, ‘David came in unto the house of Ahimelech.’ What, boasteth thou in evil, O mighty one? The kindness of God is all the day.

content: 2 Mischiefs doth thy tongue devise, Like a sharp razor, working deceit.
content_old: 2 Mischiefs doth thy tongue devise, Like a sharp razor, working deceit.

content: 3 Thou hast loved evil rather than good, Lying, than speaking righteousness. Selah.
content_old: 3 Thou hast loved evil rather than good, Lying, than speaking righteousness. Selah.

content: 4 Thou hast loved all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
content_old: 4 Thou hast loved all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.

content: 5 Also—God doth break thee down for ever, Taketh thee, and pulleth thee out of the tent, And He hath uprooted thee Out of the land of the living. Selah.
content_old: 5 Also—God doth break thee down for ever, Taketh thee, and pulleth thee out of the tent, And He hath uprooted thee Out of the land of the living. Selah.

content: 6 And the righteous see, And fear, and laugh at him.
content_old: 6 And the righteous see, And fear, and laugh at him.

content: 7 ‘Lo, the man who maketh not God his strong place, And trusteth in the abundance of his riches, He is strong in his mischiefs.’
content_old: 7 ‘Lo, the man who maketh not God his strong place, And trusteth in the abundance of his riches, He is strong in his mischiefs.’

content: 8 And I, as a green olive in the house of God, I have trusted in the kindness of God, To the age and for ever,
content_old: 8 And I, as a green olive in the house of God, I have trusted in the kindness of God, To the age and for ever,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On a disease.’—An instruction, by David. A fool said in his heart, ‘There is no God.’ They have done corruptly, Yea, they have done abominable iniquity, There is none doing good.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On a disease.’—An instruction, by David. A fool said in his heart, ‘There is no God.’ They have done corruptly, Yea, they have done abominable iniquity, There is none doing good.

content: 2 God from the heavens looked on the sons of men, To see if there be an understanding one, One seeking God.
content_old: 2 God from the heavens looked on the sons of men, To see if there be an understanding one, One seeking God.

content: 3 Every one went back, together they became filthy, There is none doing good—not even one.
content_old: 3 Every one went back, together they became filthy, There is none doing good—not even one.

content: 4 Have not workers of iniquity known, Those eating my people have eaten bread, God they have not called.
