content_old: 4 Have not workers of iniquity known, Those eating my people have eaten bread, God they have not called.

content: 5 There they feared a fear—there was no fear, For God hath scattered the bones of him Who is encamping against thee, Thou hast put to shame, For God hath despised them.
content_old: 5 There they feared a fear—there was no fear, For God hath scattered the bones of him Who is encamping against thee, Thou hast put to shame, For God hath despised them.

content: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments.—An instruction, by David, in the coming in of the Ziphim, and they say to Saul, ‘Is not David hiding himself with us?’ O God, by Thy name save me, and by Thy might judge me.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments.—An instruction, by David, in the coming in of the Ziphim, and they say to Saul, ‘Is not David hiding himself with us?’ O God, by Thy name save me, and by Thy might judge me.

content: 2 O God, hear my prayer, Give ear to the sayings of my mouth,
content_old: 2 O God, hear my prayer, Give ear to the sayings of my mouth,

content: 3 For strangers have risen up against me And terrible ones have sought my soul, They have not set God before them. Selah.
content_old: 3 For strangers have risen up against me And terrible ones have sought my soul, They have not set God before them. Selah.

content: 4 Lo, God is a helper to me, The Lord is with those supporting my soul,
content_old: 4 Lo, God is a helper to me, The Lord is with those supporting my soul,

content: 5 Turn back doth the evil thing to mine enemies, In Thy truth cut them off.
content_old: 5 Turn back doth the evil thing to mine enemies, In Thy truth cut them off.

content: 6 With a free will-offering I sacrifice to Thee, I thank Thy name, O Jehovah, for it is good,
content_old: 6 With a free will-offering I sacrifice to Thee, I thank Thy name, O Jehovah, for it is good,

content: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments.—An instruction, by David. Give ear, O God, to my prayer, And hide not from my supplication.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments.—An instruction, by David. Give ear, O God, to my prayer, And hide not from my supplication.

content: 2 Attend to me, and answer me, I mourn in my meditation, and make a noise,
content_old: 2 Attend to me, and answer me, I mourn in my meditation, and make a noise,

content: 3 Because of the voice of an enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked, For they cause sorrow to move against me, And in anger they hate me.
content_old: 3 Because of the voice of an enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked, For they cause sorrow to move against me, And in anger they hate me.

content: 4 My heart is pained within me, And terrors of death have fallen on me.
content_old: 4 My heart is pained within me, And terrors of death have fallen on me.

content: 5 Fear and trembling come in to me, And horror doth cover me.
content_old: 5 Fear and trembling come in to me, And horror doth cover me.

content: 6 And I say, ‘Who doth give to me a pinion as a dove? I fly away and rest,
content_old: 6 And I say, ‘Who doth give to me a pinion as a dove? I fly away and rest,

content: 7 Lo, I move far off, I lodge in a wilderness. Selah.
content_old: 7 Lo, I move far off, I lodge in a wilderness. Selah.

content: 8 I hasten escape for myself, From a rushing wind, from a whirlwind.
content_old: 8 I hasten escape for myself, From a rushing wind, from a whirlwind.

content: 9 Swallow up, O Lord, divide their tongue, For I saw violence and strife in a city.
content_old: 9 Swallow up, O Lord, divide their tongue, For I saw violence and strife in a city.

content: 10 By day and by night they go round it, on its walls. Both iniquity and perverseness are in its midst,
content_old: 10 By day and by night they go round it, on its walls. Both iniquity and perverseness are in its midst,

content: 11 Mischiefs are in its midst. Fraud and deceit depart not from its street.
content_old: 11 Mischiefs are in its midst. Fraud and deceit depart not from its street.

content: 12 For an enemy reproacheth me not, or I bear it, He who is hating me Hath not magnified himself against me, Or I hide from him.
content_old: 12 For an enemy reproacheth me not, or I bear it, He who is hating me Hath not magnified himself against me, Or I hide from him.

content: 13 But thou, a man—as mine equal, My familiar friend, and mine acquaintance.
content_old: 13 But thou, a man—as mine equal, My familiar friend, and mine acquaintance.

content: 14 When together we sweeten counsel, Into the house of God we walk in company.
content_old: 14 When together we sweeten counsel, Into the house of God we walk in company.

content: 15 Desolations are upon them, They go down to Sheol—alive, For wickedness is in their dwelling, in their midst.
content_old: 15 Desolations are upon them, They go down to Sheol—alive, For wickedness is in their dwelling, in their midst.

content: 16 I—to God I call, and Jehovah saveth me.
content_old: 16 I—to God I call, and Jehovah saveth me.

content: 17 Evening, and morning, and noon, I meditate, and make a noise, and He heareth my voice,
content_old: 17 Evening, and morning, and noon, I meditate, and make a noise, and He heareth my voice,

content: 18 He hath ransomed in peace my soul From him who is near to me, For with the multitude they were with me.
content_old: 18 He hath ransomed in peace my soul From him who is near to me, For with the multitude they were with me.

content: 19 God doth hear and afflict them, And He sitteth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, and fear not God,
content_old: 19 God doth hear and afflict them, And He sitteth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, and fear not God,

content: 20 He hath sent forth his hands against his well-wishers, He hath polluted his covenant.
content_old: 20 He hath sent forth his hands against his well-wishers, He hath polluted his covenant.

content: 21 Sweeter than honey hath been his mouth, And his heart is war! Softer have been his words than oil, And they are drawn swords.
content_old: 21 Sweeter than honey hath been his mouth, And his heart is war! Softer have been his words than oil, And they are drawn swords.

content: 22 Cast on Jehovah that which He hath given thee, And He doth sustain thee, He doth not suffer for ever the moving of the righteous.
content_old: 22 Cast on Jehovah that which He hath given thee, And He doth sustain thee, He doth not suffer for ever the moving of the righteous.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Dumb Dove far off.’—A secret treasure of David, in the Philistines’ taking hold of him in Gath. Favour me, O God, for man swallowed me up, All the day fighting he oppresseth me,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Dumb Dove far off.’—A secret treasure of David, in the Philistines’ taking hold of him in Gath. Favour me, O God, for man swallowed me up, All the day fighting he oppresseth me,

content: 2 Mine enemies have swallowed up all the day, For many are fighting against me, O most High,
content_old: 2 Mine enemies have swallowed up all the day, For many are fighting against me, O most High,

content: 3 The day I am afraid I am confident toward Thee.
content_old: 3 The day I am afraid I am confident toward Thee.

content: 4 In God I praise His word, in God I have trusted, I fear not what flesh doth to me.
content_old: 4 In God I praise His word, in God I have trusted, I fear not what flesh doth to me.

content: 5 All the day they wrest my words, Concerning me all their thoughts are for evil,
content_old: 5 All the day they wrest my words, Concerning me all their thoughts are for evil,

content: 6 They assemble, they hide, they watch my heels, When they have expected my soul.
content_old: 6 They assemble, they hide, they watch my heels, When they have expected my soul.

content: 7 By iniquity they escape, In anger the peoples put down, O God.
content_old: 7 By iniquity they escape, In anger the peoples put down, O God.

content: 8 My wandering Thou hast counted, Thou—place Thou my tear in Thy bottle, Are they not in Thy book?
content_old: 8 My wandering Thou hast counted, Thou—place Thou my tear in Thy bottle, Are they not in Thy book?

content: 9 Then turn back do mine enemies in the day I call. This I have known, that God is for me.
content_old: 9 Then turn back do mine enemies in the day I call. This I have known, that God is for me.

content: 10 In God I praise the word, In Jehovah I praise the word.
content_old: 10 In God I praise the word, In Jehovah I praise the word.

content: 11 In God I trusted, I fear not what man doth to me,
content_old: 11 In God I trusted, I fear not what man doth to me,

content: 12 On me, O God, are Thy vows, I repay thank-offerings to Thee.
content_old: 12 On me, O God, are Thy vows, I repay thank-offerings to Thee.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not.’—A secret treasure of David, in his fleeing from the face of Saul into a cave. Favour me, O God, favour me, For in Thee is my soul trusting, And in the shadow of Thy wings I trust, Until the calamities pass over.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not.’—A secret treasure of David, in his fleeing from the face of Saul into a cave. Favour me, O God, favour me, For in Thee is my soul trusting, And in the shadow of Thy wings I trust, Until the calamities pass over.

content: 2 I call to God Most High, To God who is perfecting for me.
content_old: 2 I call to God Most High, To God who is perfecting for me.

content: 3 He sendeth from the heaven, and saveth me, He reproached—who is panting after me. Selah. God sendeth forth His kindness and His truth.
content_old: 3 He sendeth from the heaven, and saveth me, He reproached—who is panting after me. Selah. God sendeth forth His kindness and His truth.

content: 4 My soul is in the midst of lions, I lie down among flames—sons of men, Their teeth are a spear and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
content_old: 4 My soul is in the midst of lions, I lie down among flames—sons of men, Their teeth are a spear and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.

content: 5 Be Thou exalted above the heavens, O God, Above all the earth Thine honour.
content_old: 5 Be Thou exalted above the heavens, O God, Above all the earth Thine honour.

content: 6 A net they have prepared for my steps, Bowed down hath my soul, They have digged before me a pit, They have fallen into its midst. Selah.
content_old: 6 A net they have prepared for my steps, Bowed down hath my soul, They have digged before me a pit, They have fallen into its midst. Selah.

content: 7 Prepared is my heart, O God, Prepared is my heart, I sing and praise.
content_old: 7 Prepared is my heart, O God, Prepared is my heart, I sing and praise.

content: 8 Awake, mine honour, awake, psaltery and harp, I awake the morning dawn.
content_old: 8 Awake, mine honour, awake, psaltery and harp, I awake the morning dawn.

content: 9 I thank Thee among the peoples, O Lord, I praise Thee among the nations.
content_old: 9 I thank Thee among the peoples, O Lord, I praise Thee among the nations.

content: 10 For great unto the heavens is Thy kindness, And unto the clouds Thy truth.
content_old: 10 For great unto the heavens is Thy kindness, And unto the clouds Thy truth.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not.’—A secret treasure, by David. Is it true, O dumb one, righteously ye speak? Uprightly ye judge, O sons of men?
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not.’—A secret treasure, by David. Is it true, O dumb one, righteously ye speak? Uprightly ye judge, O sons of men?

content: 2 Even in heart ye work iniquities, In the land the violence of your hands ye ponder.
content_old: 2 Even in heart ye work iniquities, In the land the violence of your hands ye ponder.

content: 3 The wicked have been estranged from the womb, They have erred from the belly, speaking lies.
content_old: 3 The wicked have been estranged from the womb, They have erred from the belly, speaking lies.

content: 4 Their poison is as poison of a serpent, As a deaf asp shutting its ear,
content_old: 4 Their poison is as poison of a serpent, As a deaf asp shutting its ear,

content: 5 Which hearkeneth not to the voice of whisperers, A charmer of charms most skilful.
content_old: 5 Which hearkeneth not to the voice of whisperers, A charmer of charms most skilful.

content: 6 O God, break their teeth in their mouth, The jaw-teeth of young lions break down, O Jehovah.
content_old: 6 O God, break their teeth in their mouth, The jaw-teeth of young lions break down, O Jehovah.

content: 7 They are melted as waters, They go up and down for themselves, His arrow proceedeth as they cut themselves off.
content_old: 7 They are melted as waters, They go up and down for themselves, His arrow proceedeth as they cut themselves off.

content: 8 As a snail that melteth he goeth on, As an untimely birth of a woman, They have not seen the sun.
content_old: 8 As a snail that melteth he goeth on, As an untimely birth of a woman, They have not seen the sun.

content: 9 Before your pots discern the bramble, As well the raw as the heated He whirleth away.
content_old: 9 Before your pots discern the bramble, As well the raw as the heated He whirleth away.

content: 10 The righteous rejoiceth that he hath seen vengeance, His steps he washeth in the blood of the wicked.
content_old: 10 The righteous rejoiceth that he hath seen vengeance, His steps he washeth in the blood of the wicked.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not,’ by David.—A secret treasure, in Saul’s sending, and they watch the house to put him to death. Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God, From my withstanders set me on high.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not,’ by David.—A secret treasure, in Saul’s sending, and they watch the house to put him to death. Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God, From my withstanders set me on high.

content: 2 Deliver me from workers of iniquity, And from men of blood save me.
content_old: 2 Deliver me from workers of iniquity, And from men of blood save me.

content: 3 For, lo, they laid wait for my soul, Assembled against me are strong ones, Not my transgression nor my sin, O Jehovah.
content_old: 3 For, lo, they laid wait for my soul, Assembled against me are strong ones, Not my transgression nor my sin, O Jehovah.

content: 4 Without punishment they run and prepare themselves, Stir up to meet me, and see.
content_old: 4 Without punishment they run and prepare themselves, Stir up to meet me, and see.

content: 5 And Thou, Jehovah, God of Hosts, God of Israel, Awake to inspect all the nations. Favour not any treacherous dealers of iniquity. Selah.
content_old: 5 And Thou, Jehovah, God of Hosts, God of Israel, Awake to inspect all the nations. Favour not any treacherous dealers of iniquity. Selah.

content: 6 They turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And go round about the city.
content_old: 6 They turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And go round about the city.

content: 7 Lo, they belch out with their mouths, Swords are in their lips, for ‘Who heareth?’
content_old: 7 Lo, they belch out with their mouths, Swords are in their lips, for ‘Who heareth?’

content: 8 And Thou, O Jehovah dost laugh at them, Thou dost mock at all the nations.
content_old: 8 And Thou, O Jehovah dost laugh at them, Thou dost mock at all the nations.

content: 9 O my Strength, unto Thee I take heed, For God is my tower—the God of my kindness.
content_old: 9 O my Strength, unto Thee I take heed, For God is my tower—the God of my kindness.

content: 10 God doth go before me, He causeth me to look on mine enemies.
content_old: 10 God doth go before me, He causeth me to look on mine enemies.

content: 11 Slay them not, lest my people forget, Shake them by Thy strength, And bring them down, O Lord our shield.
content_old: 11 Slay them not, lest my people forget, Shake them by Thy strength, And bring them down, O Lord our shield.

content: 12 The sin of their mouth is a word of their lips, And they are captured in their pride, And from the curse and lying they recount.
content_old: 12 The sin of their mouth is a word of their lips, And they are captured in their pride, And from the curse and lying they recount.

content: 13 Consume in fury, consume and they are not, And they know that God is ruling in Jacob, To the ends of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 13 Consume in fury, consume and they are not, And they know that God is ruling in Jacob, To the ends of the earth. Selah.

content: 14 And they turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And they go round about the city.
content_old: 14 And they turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And they go round about the city.

content: 15 They—they wander for food, If they are not satisfied—then they murmur.
content_old: 15 They—they wander for food, If they are not satisfied—then they murmur.

content: 16 And I—I sing of Thy strength, And I sing at morn of Thy kindness, For thou hast been a tower to me, And a refuge for me in a day of adversity.
content_old: 16 And I—I sing of Thy strength, And I sing at morn of Thy kindness, For thou hast been a tower to me, And a refuge for me in a day of adversity.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Concerning the Lily of Testimony,’ a secret treasure of David, to teach, in his striving with Aram-Naharaim, and with Aram-Zobah, and Joab turneth back and smiteth Edom in the valley of Salt—twelve thousand. O God, Thou hadst cast us off, Thou hadst broken us—hadst been angry!—Thou dost turn back to us.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Concerning the Lily of Testimony,’ a secret treasure of David, to teach, in his striving with Aram-Naharaim, and with Aram-Zobah, and Joab turneth back and smiteth Edom in the valley of Salt—twelve thousand. O God, Thou hadst cast us off, Thou hadst broken us—hadst been angry!—Thou dost turn back to us.

content: 2 Thou hast caused the land to tremble, Thou hast broken it, Heal its breaches, for it hath moved.
content_old: 2 Thou hast caused the land to tremble, Thou hast broken it, Heal its breaches, for it hath moved.

content: 3 Thou hast shewn Thy people a hard thing, Thou hast caused us to drink wine of trembling.
content_old: 3 Thou hast shewn Thy people a hard thing, Thou hast caused us to drink wine of trembling.

content: 4 Thou hast given to those fearing thee an ensign. To be lifted up as an ensign Because of truth. Selah.
content_old: 4 Thou hast given to those fearing thee an ensign. To be lifted up as an ensign Because of truth. Selah.

content: 5 That Thy beloved ones may be drawn out, Save with Thy right hand, and answer us.
content_old: 5 That Thy beloved ones may be drawn out, Save with Thy right hand, and answer us.

content: 6 God hath spoken in His holiness: I exult—I apportion Shechem, And the valley of Succoth I measure,
content_old: 6 God hath spoken in His holiness: I exult—I apportion Shechem, And the valley of Succoth I measure,

content: 7 Mine is Gilead, and mine is Manasseh, And Ephraim is the strength of my head, Judah is my lawgiver,
content_old: 7 Mine is Gilead, and mine is Manasseh, And Ephraim is the strength of my head, Judah is my lawgiver,

content: 8 Moab is my pot for washing, over Edom I cast my shoe, Shout, concerning me, O Philistia.
content_old: 8 Moab is my pot for washing, over Edom I cast my shoe, Shout, concerning me, O Philistia.

content: 9 Who doth bring me to a city of bulwarks? Who hath led me unto Edom?
content_old: 9 Who doth bring me to a city of bulwarks? Who hath led me unto Edom?

content: 10 Is it not Thou, O God? hast Thou cast us off? And dost Thou not go forth, O God, with our hosts!
content_old: 10 Is it not Thou, O God? hast Thou cast us off? And dost Thou not go forth, O God, with our hosts!

content: 11 Give to us help from adversity, And vain is the deliverance of man.
content_old: 11 Give to us help from adversity, And vain is the deliverance of man.

content: 1 To the Overseer, on stringed instruments.—By David. Hear, O God, my loud cry, attend to my prayer.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, on stringed instruments.—By David. Hear, O God, my loud cry, attend to my prayer.

content: 2 From the end of the land unto Thee I call, In the feebleness of my heart, Into a rock higher than I Thou dost lead me.
content_old: 2 From the end of the land unto Thee I call, In the feebleness of my heart, Into a rock higher than I Thou dost lead me.

content: 3 For Thou hast been a refuge for me, A tower of strength because of the enemy.
content_old: 3 For Thou hast been a refuge for me, A tower of strength because of the enemy.

content: 4 I sojourn in Thy tent to the ages, I trust in the secret place of Thy wings. Selah.
content_old: 4 I sojourn in Thy tent to the ages, I trust in the secret place of Thy wings. Selah.

content: 5 For Thou, O God, hast hearkened to my vows, Thou hast appointed the inheritance Of those fearing Thy name.
content_old: 5 For Thou, O God, hast hearkened to my vows, Thou hast appointed the inheritance Of those fearing Thy name.

content: 6 Days to the days of the king Thou addest, His years as generation and generation.
content_old: 6 Days to the days of the king Thou addest, His years as generation and generation.

content: 7 He dwelleth to the age before God, Kindness and truth appoint—they keep him.
content_old: 7 He dwelleth to the age before God, Kindness and truth appoint—they keep him.

content: 1 To the Overseer, for Jeduthun.—A Psalm of David. Only—toward God is my soul silent, From Him is my salvation.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, for Jeduthun.—A Psalm of David. Only—toward God is my soul silent, From Him is my salvation.

content: 2 Only—He is my rock, and my salvation, My tower, I am not much moved.
content_old: 2 Only—He is my rock, and my salvation, My tower, I am not much moved.

content: 3 Till when do ye devise mischief against a man? Ye are destroyed all of you, As a wall inclined, a hedge that is cast down.
content_old: 3 Till when do ye devise mischief against a man? Ye are destroyed all of you, As a wall inclined, a hedge that is cast down.

content: 4 Only—from his excellency They have consulted to drive away, They enjoy a lie, with their mouth they bless, And with their heart revile. Selah.
content_old: 4 Only—from his excellency They have consulted to drive away, They enjoy a lie, with their mouth they bless, And with their heart revile. Selah.

content: 5 Only—for God, be silent, O my soul, For from Him is my hope.
content_old: 5 Only—for God, be silent, O my soul, For from Him is my hope.

content: 6 Only—He is my rock and my salvation, My tower, I am not moved.
content_old: 6 Only—He is my rock and my salvation, My tower, I am not moved.

content: 7 On God is my salvation, and my honour, The rock of my strength, my refuge is in God.
content_old: 7 On God is my salvation, and my honour, The rock of my strength, my refuge is in God.

content: 8 Trust in Him at all times, O people, Pour forth before Him your heart, God is a refuge for us. Selah.
content_old: 8 Trust in Him at all times, O people, Pour forth before Him your heart, God is a refuge for us. Selah.

content: 9 Only—vanity are the low, a lie the high. In balances to go up they than vanity are lighter.
content_old: 9 Only—vanity are the low, a lie the high. In balances to go up they than vanity are lighter.

content: 10 Trust not in oppression, And in robbery become not vain, Wealth—when it increaseth—set not the heart.
content_old: 10 Trust not in oppression, And in robbery become not vain, Wealth—when it increaseth—set not the heart.

content: 11 Once hath God spoken, twice I heard this, That ‘strength is with God.’
content_old: 11 Once hath God spoken, twice I heard this, That ‘strength is with God.’

content: 1 A Psalm of David, in his being in the wilderness of Judah. O God, Thou art my God, earnestly do I seek Thee, Thirsted for Thee hath my soul, Longed for Thee hath my flesh, In a land dry and weary, without waters.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David, in his being in the wilderness of Judah. O God, Thou art my God, earnestly do I seek Thee, Thirsted for Thee hath my soul, Longed for Thee hath my flesh, In a land dry and weary, without waters.

content: 2 So in the sanctuary I have seen Thee, To behold Thy strength and Thine honour.
content_old: 2 So in the sanctuary I have seen Thee, To behold Thy strength and Thine honour.

content: 3 Because better is Thy kindness than life, My lips do praise Thee.
content_old: 3 Because better is Thy kindness than life, My lips do praise Thee.

content: 4 So I bless Thee in my life, in Thy name I lift up my hands.
content_old: 4 So I bless Thee in my life, in Thy name I lift up my hands.

content: 5 As with milk and fatness is my soul satisfied, And with singing lips doth my mouth praise.
content_old: 5 As with milk and fatness is my soul satisfied, And with singing lips doth my mouth praise.

content: 6 If I have remembered Thee on my couch, In the watches—I meditate on Thee.
content_old: 6 If I have remembered Thee on my couch, In the watches—I meditate on Thee.

content: 7 For Thou hast been a help to me, And in the shadow of Thy wings I sing.
content_old: 7 For Thou hast been a help to me, And in the shadow of Thy wings I sing.

content: 8 Cleaved hath my soul after Thee, On me hath Thy right hand taken hold.
content_old: 8 Cleaved hath my soul after Thee, On me hath Thy right hand taken hold.

content: 9 And they who for desolation seek my soul, Go in to the lower parts of the earth.
content_old: 9 And they who for desolation seek my soul, Go in to the lower parts of the earth.

content: 10 They cause him to run on the edge of the sword, A portion for foxes they are.
content_old: 10 They cause him to run on the edge of the sword, A portion for foxes they are.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Hear, O God, my voice, in my meditation, From the fear of an enemy Thou keepest my life,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Hear, O God, my voice, in my meditation, From the fear of an enemy Thou keepest my life,

content: 2 Hidest me from the secret counsel of evil doers, From the tumult of workers of iniquity.
content_old: 2 Hidest me from the secret counsel of evil doers, From the tumult of workers of iniquity.

content: 3 Who sharpened as a sword their tongue, They directed their arrow—a bitter word.
content_old: 3 Who sharpened as a sword their tongue, They directed their arrow—a bitter word.

content: 4 To shoot in secret places the perfect, Suddenly they shoot him, and fear not.
content_old: 4 To shoot in secret places the perfect, Suddenly they shoot him, and fear not.

content: 5 They strengthen for themselves an evil thing, They recount of the hiding of snares, They have said, ‘Who doth look at it?’
content_old: 5 They strengthen for themselves an evil thing, They recount of the hiding of snares, They have said, ‘Who doth look at it?’

content: 6 They search out perverse things, ‘We perfected a searching search,’ And the inward part of man, and the heart are deep.
content_old: 6 They search out perverse things, ‘We perfected a searching search,’ And the inward part of man, and the heart are deep.

content: 7 And God doth shoot them with an arrow, Sudden have been their wounds,
content_old: 7 And God doth shoot them with an arrow, Sudden have been their wounds,

content: 8 And they cause him to stumble, Against them is their own tongue, Every looker on them fleeth away.
content_old: 8 And they cause him to stumble, Against them is their own tongue, Every looker on them fleeth away.

content: 9 And all men fear, and declare the work of God, And His deed they have considered wisely.
content_old: 9 And all men fear, and declare the work of God, And His deed they have considered wisely.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. A Song. To Thee, silence—praise, O God, is in Zion, And to Thee is a vow completed.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. A Song. To Thee, silence—praise, O God, is in Zion, And to Thee is a vow completed.

content: 2 Hearer of prayer, to Thee all flesh cometh.
content_old: 2 Hearer of prayer, to Thee all flesh cometh.

content: 3 Matters of iniquities were mightier than I, Our transgressions—Thou dost cover them.
content_old: 3 Matters of iniquities were mightier than I, Our transgressions—Thou dost cover them.

content: 4 O the happiness of him whom Thou choosest, And drawest near, he inhabiteth Thy courts, We are satisfied with the goodness of Thy house, Thy holy temple.
content_old: 4 O the happiness of him whom Thou choosest, And drawest near, he inhabiteth Thy courts, We are satisfied with the goodness of Thy house, Thy holy temple.

content: 5 By fearful things in righteousness Thou answerest us, O God of our salvation, The confidence of all far off ends of earth and sea.
content_old: 5 By fearful things in righteousness Thou answerest us, O God of our salvation, The confidence of all far off ends of earth and sea.

content: 6 Establishing mountains by His power, He hath been girded with might,
content_old: 6 Establishing mountains by His power, He hath been girded with might,

content: 7 Restraining the noise of seas, the noise of their billows, And the multitude of the peoples.
content_old: 7 Restraining the noise of seas, the noise of their billows, And the multitude of the peoples.

content: 8 And the inhabitants of the uttermost parts From Thy signs are afraid, The outgoings of morning and evening Thou causest to sing.
content_old: 8 And the inhabitants of the uttermost parts From Thy signs are afraid, The outgoings of morning and evening Thou causest to sing.

content: 9 Thou hast inspected the earth, and waterest it, Thou makest it very rich, the rivulet of God is full of water, Thou preparest their corn, When thus Thou dost prepare it,
content_old: 9 Thou hast inspected the earth, and waterest it, Thou makest it very rich, the rivulet of God is full of water, Thou preparest their corn, When thus Thou dost prepare it,

content: 10 Its ridges have been filled, Deepened hath been its furrow, With showers Thou dost soften it, Its springing up Thou blessest.
content_old: 10 Its ridges have been filled, Deepened hath been its furrow, With showers Thou dost soften it, Its springing up Thou blessest.

content: 11 Thou hast crowned the year of Thy goodness, And Thy paths drop fatness.
content_old: 11 Thou hast crowned the year of Thy goodness, And Thy paths drop fatness.

content: 12 Drop do the pastures of a wilderness, And joy of the heights Thou girdest on.
content_old: 12 Drop do the pastures of a wilderness, And joy of the heights Thou girdest on.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Song, a Psalm. Shout ye to God, all the earth.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Song, a Psalm. Shout ye to God, all the earth.

content: 2 Praise ye the honour of His name, Make ye honourable His praise.
content_old: 2 Praise ye the honour of His name, Make ye honourable His praise.

content: 3 Say to God, ‘How fearful are Thy works, By the abundance of Thy strength, Thine enemies feign obedience to Thee.
content_old: 3 Say to God, ‘How fearful are Thy works, By the abundance of Thy strength, Thine enemies feign obedience to Thee.

content: 4 All the earth do bow to Thee, They sing praise to Thee, they praise Thy name.’ Selah.
content_old: 4 All the earth do bow to Thee, They sing praise to Thee, they praise Thy name.’ Selah.

content: 5 Come ye, and see the works of God, Fearful acts toward the sons of men.
content_old: 5 Come ye, and see the works of God, Fearful acts toward the sons of men.

content: 6 He hath turned a sea to dry land, Through a river they pass over on foot, There do we rejoice in Him.
content_old: 6 He hath turned a sea to dry land, Through a river they pass over on foot, There do we rejoice in Him.

content: 7 Ruling by His might to the age, His eyes among the nations do watch, The refractory exalt not themselves. Selah.
content_old: 7 Ruling by His might to the age, His eyes among the nations do watch, The refractory exalt not themselves. Selah.

content: 8 Bless, ye peoples, our God, And sound the voice of His praise,
content_old: 8 Bless, ye peoples, our God, And sound the voice of His praise,

content: 9 Who hath placed our soul in life, And suffered not our feet to be moved.
content_old: 9 Who hath placed our soul in life, And suffered not our feet to be moved.

content: 10 For Thou hast tried us, O God, Thou hast refined us as the refining of silver.
content_old: 10 For Thou hast tried us, O God, Thou hast refined us as the refining of silver.

content: 11 Thou hast brought us into a net, Thou hast placed pressure on our loins.
content_old: 11 Thou hast brought us into a net, Thou hast placed pressure on our loins.

content: 12 Thou hast caused man to ride at our head. We have entered into fire and into water, And Thou bringest us out to a watered place.
content_old: 12 Thou hast caused man to ride at our head. We have entered into fire and into water, And Thou bringest us out to a watered place.

content: 13 I enter Thy house with burnt-offerings, I complete to Thee my vows,
content_old: 13 I enter Thy house with burnt-offerings, I complete to Thee my vows,

content: 14 For opened were my lips, And my mouth spake in my distress:
content_old: 14 For opened were my lips, And my mouth spake in my distress:

content: 15 ‘Burnt-offerings of fatlings I offer to Thee, With perfume of rams, I prepare a bullock with he-goats.’ Selah.
content_old: 15 ‘Burnt-offerings of fatlings I offer to Thee, With perfume of rams, I prepare a bullock with he-goats.’ Selah.

content: 16 Come, hear, all ye who fear God, And I recount what he did for my soul.
content_old: 16 Come, hear, all ye who fear God, And I recount what he did for my soul.

content: 17 Unto Him with my mouth I have called, And exaltation is under my tongue.
content_old: 17 Unto Him with my mouth I have called, And exaltation is under my tongue.

content: 18 Iniquity, if I have seen in my heart, The Lord doth not hear.
content_old: 18 Iniquity, if I have seen in my heart, The Lord doth not hear.

content: 19 But God hath heard, He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
content_old: 19 But God hath heard, He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

content: 1 To the Overseer, with stringed instruments.—A Psalm, a Song. God doth favour us and bless us, Doth cause His face to shine with us. Selah.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, with stringed instruments.—A Psalm, a Song. God doth favour us and bless us, Doth cause His face to shine with us. Selah.

content: 2 For the knowledge in earth of Thy way, among all nations of Thy salvation.
content_old: 2 For the knowledge in earth of Thy way, among all nations of Thy salvation.

content: 3 Praise Thee do peoples, O God, Praise Thee do peoples, all of them.
content_old: 3 Praise Thee do peoples, O God, Praise Thee do peoples, all of them.

content: 4 Rejoice and sing do nations, For Thou judgest peoples uprightly, And peoples on earth comfortest. Selah.
content_old: 4 Rejoice and sing do nations, For Thou judgest peoples uprightly, And peoples on earth comfortest. Selah.

content: 5 Confess Thee do peoples, O God, Confess Thee do peoples—all of them.
content_old: 5 Confess Thee do peoples, O God, Confess Thee do peoples—all of them.

content: 6 Earth hath given her increase, God doth bless us—our God,
content_old: 6 Earth hath given her increase, God doth bless us—our God,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm, a song of David. Rise doth God—scattered are His enemies! And those hating Him flee from His face.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm, a song of David. Rise doth God—scattered are His enemies! And those hating Him flee from His face.

content: 2 As the driving away of smoke Thou drivest away, As the melting of wax before fire, The wicked perish at the presence of God.
content_old: 2 As the driving away of smoke Thou drivest away, As the melting of wax before fire, The wicked perish at the presence of God.

content: 3 And the righteous rejoice, they exult before God, And they joy with gladness.
content_old: 3 And the righteous rejoice, they exult before God, And they joy with gladness.

content: 4 Sing ye to God—praise His name, Raise up a highway for Him who is riding in deserts, In Jah is His name, and exult before Him.
content_old: 4 Sing ye to God—praise His name, Raise up a highway for Him who is riding in deserts, In Jah is His name, and exult before Him.

content: 5 Father of the fatherless, and judge of the widows, Is God in His holy habitation.
content_old: 5 Father of the fatherless, and judge of the widows, Is God in His holy habitation.

content: 6 God—causing the lonely to dwell at home, Bringing out bound ones into prosperity, Only—the refractory have inhabited a dry place.
content_old: 6 God—causing the lonely to dwell at home, Bringing out bound ones into prosperity, Only—the refractory have inhabited a dry place.

content: 7 O God, in Thy going forth before Thy people, In Thy stepping through the wilderness, Selah.
content_old: 7 O God, in Thy going forth before Thy people, In Thy stepping through the wilderness, Selah.

content: 8 The earth hath shaken, Yea, the heavens have dropped before God, This Sinai—before God, the God of Israel.
content_old: 8 The earth hath shaken, Yea, the heavens have dropped before God, This Sinai—before God, the God of Israel.

content: 9 A shower of free-will gifts thou shakest out, O God. Thine inheritance, when it hath been weary, Thou hast established it.
content_old: 9 A shower of free-will gifts thou shakest out, O God. Thine inheritance, when it hath been weary, Thou hast established it.

content: 10 Thy company have dwelt in it, Thou preparest in Thy goodness for the poor, O God.
content_old: 10 Thy company have dwelt in it, Thou preparest in Thy goodness for the poor, O God.

content: 11 The Lord doth give the saying, The female proclaimers are a numerous host.
content_old: 11 The Lord doth give the saying, The female proclaimers are a numerous host.

content: 12 Kings of hosts flee utterly away, And a female inhabitant of the house apportioneth spoil.
content_old: 12 Kings of hosts flee utterly away, And a female inhabitant of the house apportioneth spoil.

content: 13 Though ye do lie between two boundaries, Wings of a dove covered with silver, And her pinions with yellow gold.
content_old: 13 Though ye do lie between two boundaries, Wings of a dove covered with silver, And her pinions with yellow gold.

content: 14 When the Mighty spreadeth kings in it, It doth snow in Salmon.
content_old: 14 When the Mighty spreadeth kings in it, It doth snow in Salmon.

content: 15 A hill of God is the hill of Bashan, A hill of heights is the hill of Bashan.
content_old: 15 A hill of God is the hill of Bashan, A hill of heights is the hill of Bashan.

content: 16 Why do ye envy, O high hills, The hill God hath desired for His seat? Jehovah also doth tabernacle for ever.
content_old: 16 Why do ye envy, O high hills, The hill God hath desired for His seat? Jehovah also doth tabernacle for ever.

content: 17 The chariots of God are myriads, thousands of changes, The Lord is among them, in Sinai, in the sanctuary.
content_old: 17 The chariots of God are myriads, thousands of changes, The Lord is among them, in Sinai, in the sanctuary.

content: 18 Thou hast ascended on high, Thou hast taken captive captivity, Thou hast taken gifts for men, That even the refractory may rest, O Jah God.
content_old: 18 Thou hast ascended on high, Thou hast taken captive captivity, Thou hast taken gifts for men, That even the refractory may rest, O Jah God.

content: 19 Blessed is the Lord, day by day He layeth on us. God Himself is our salvation. Selah.
content_old: 19 Blessed is the Lord, day by day He layeth on us. God Himself is our salvation. Selah.

content: 20 God Himself is to us a God for deliverances, And Jehovah Lord hath the outgoings of death.
content_old: 20 God Himself is to us a God for deliverances, And Jehovah Lord hath the outgoings of death.

content: 21 Only—God doth smite The head of His enemies, The hairy crown of a habitual walker in his guilt.
content_old: 21 Only—God doth smite The head of His enemies, The hairy crown of a habitual walker in his guilt.

content: 22 The Lord said: ‘From Bashan I bring back, I bring back from the depths of the sea.
content_old: 22 The Lord said: ‘From Bashan I bring back, I bring back from the depths of the sea.

content: 23 So that thou dashest thy foot in blood, In the blood of enemies—the tongue of Thy dogs.’
content_old: 23 So that thou dashest thy foot in blood, In the blood of enemies—the tongue of Thy dogs.’

content: 24 They have seen Thy goings, O God, Goings of my God, my king, in the sanctuary.
content_old: 24 They have seen Thy goings, O God, Goings of my God, my king, in the sanctuary.

content: 25 Singers have been before, Behind are players on instruments, In the midst virgins playing with timbrels.
content_old: 25 Singers have been before, Behind are players on instruments, In the midst virgins playing with timbrels.

content: 26 In assemblies bless ye God, The Lord—from the fountain of Israel.
content_old: 26 In assemblies bless ye God, The Lord—from the fountain of Israel.

content: 27 There is little Benjamin their ruler, Heads of Judah their defence, Heads of Zebulun—heads of Naphtali.
content_old: 27 There is little Benjamin their ruler, Heads of Judah their defence, Heads of Zebulun—heads of Naphtali.

content: 28 Thy God hath commanded thy strength, Be strong, O God, this Thou hast wrought for us.
content_old: 28 Thy God hath commanded thy strength, Be strong, O God, this Thou hast wrought for us.

content: 29 Because of Thy temple at Jerusalem, To Thee do kings bring a present.
content_old: 29 Because of Thy temple at Jerusalem, To Thee do kings bring a present.

content: 30 Rebuke a beast of the reeds, a company of bulls, With calves of the peoples, Each humbling himself with pieces of silver, Scatter Thou peoples delighting in conflicts.
content_old: 30 Rebuke a beast of the reeds, a company of bulls, With calves of the peoples, Each humbling himself with pieces of silver, Scatter Thou peoples delighting in conflicts.

content: 31 Come do fat ones out of Egypt, Cush causeth her hands to run to God.
content_old: 31 Come do fat ones out of Egypt, Cush causeth her hands to run to God.

content: 32 Kingdoms of the earth, sing ye to God, Praise ye the Lord. Selah.
content_old: 32 Kingdoms of the earth, sing ye to God, Praise ye the Lord. Selah.

content: 33 To him who is riding on the heavens of the heavens of old, Lo, He giveth with His voice a strong voice.
content_old: 33 To him who is riding on the heavens of the heavens of old, Lo, He giveth with His voice a strong voice.

content: 34 Ascribe ye strength to God, Over Israel is His excellency, and His strength in the clouds.
content_old: 34 Ascribe ye strength to God, Over Israel is His excellency, and His strength in the clouds.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Lilies,’ by David. Save me, O God, for come have waters unto the soul.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Lilies,’ by David. Save me, O God, for come have waters unto the soul.

content: 2 I have sunk in deep mire, And there is no standing, I have come into the depths of the waters, And a flood hath overflown me.
content_old: 2 I have sunk in deep mire, And there is no standing, I have come into the depths of the waters, And a flood hath overflown me.

content: 3 I have been wearied with my calling, Burnt hath been my throat, Consumed have been mine eyes, waiting for my God.
content_old: 3 I have been wearied with my calling, Burnt hath been my throat, Consumed have been mine eyes, waiting for my God.

content: 4 Those hating me without cause Have been more than the hairs of my head, Mighty have been my destroyers, My lying enemies, That which I took not away—I bring back.
content_old: 4 Those hating me without cause Have been more than the hairs of my head, Mighty have been my destroyers, My lying enemies, That which I took not away—I bring back.

content: 5 O God, Thou—Thou hast known Concerning my overturn, And my desolations from Thee have not been hid.
content_old: 5 O God, Thou—Thou hast known Concerning my overturn, And my desolations from Thee have not been hid.

content: 6 Let not those waiting on Thee be ashamed because of me, O Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, Let not those seeking Thee Blush because of me, O God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Let not those waiting on Thee be ashamed because of me, O Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, Let not those seeking Thee Blush because of me, O God of Israel.

content: 7 For because of Thee I have borne reproach, Shame hath covered my face.
content_old: 7 For because of Thee I have borne reproach, Shame hath covered my face.

content: 8 A stranger I have been to my brother, And a foreigner to sons of my mother.
content_old: 8 A stranger I have been to my brother, And a foreigner to sons of my mother.

content: 9 For zeal for Thy house hath consumed me, And the reproaches of Thy reproachers Have fallen upon me.
content_old: 9 For zeal for Thy house hath consumed me, And the reproaches of Thy reproachers Have fallen upon me.

content: 10 And I weep in the fasting of my soul, And it is for a reproach to me.
content_old: 10 And I weep in the fasting of my soul, And it is for a reproach to me.

content: 11 And I make my clothing sackcloth, And I am to them for a simile.
content_old: 11 And I make my clothing sackcloth, And I am to them for a simile.

content: 12 Those sitting at the gate meditate concerning me, And those drinking strong drink, Play on instruments.
content_old: 12 Those sitting at the gate meditate concerning me, And those drinking strong drink, Play on instruments.

content: 13 And I—my prayer is to Thee, O Jehovah, A time of good pleasure, O God, In the abundance of Thy kindness, Answer me in the truth of Thy salvation.
content_old: 13 And I—my prayer is to Thee, O Jehovah, A time of good pleasure, O God, In the abundance of Thy kindness, Answer me in the truth of Thy salvation.

content: 14 Deliver me from the mire, and let me not sink, Let me be delivered from those hating me, And from deep places of waters.
content_old: 14 Deliver me from the mire, and let me not sink, Let me be delivered from those hating me, And from deep places of waters.

content: 15 Let not a flood of waters overflow me, Nor let the deep swallow me up, Nor let the pit shut her mouth upon me.
content_old: 15 Let not a flood of waters overflow me, Nor let the deep swallow me up, Nor let the pit shut her mouth upon me.

content: 16 Answer me, O Jehovah, for good is Thy kindness, According to the abundance Of Thy mercies turn Thou unto me,
content_old: 16 Answer me, O Jehovah, for good is Thy kindness, According to the abundance Of Thy mercies turn Thou unto me,

content: 17 And hide not Thy face from Thy servant, For I am in distress—haste, answer me.
content_old: 17 And hide not Thy face from Thy servant, For I am in distress—haste, answer me.

content: 18 Be near unto my soul—redeem it, Because of mine enemies ransom me.
content_old: 18 Be near unto my soul—redeem it, Because of mine enemies ransom me.

content: 19 Thou—Thou hast known my reproach, And my shame, and my blushing, Before Thee are all mine adversaries.
content_old: 19 Thou—Thou hast known my reproach, And my shame, and my blushing, Before Thee are all mine adversaries.

content: 20 Reproach hath broken my heart, and I am sick, And I look for a bemoaner, and there is none, And for comforters, and I have found none.
content_old: 20 Reproach hath broken my heart, and I am sick, And I look for a bemoaner, and there is none, And for comforters, and I have found none.

content: 21 And they give for my food gall, And for my thirst cause me to drink vinegar.
content_old: 21 And they give for my food gall, And for my thirst cause me to drink vinegar.

content: 22 Their table before them is for a snare, And for a recompence—for a trap.
content_old: 22 Their table before them is for a snare, And for a recompence—for a trap.

content: 23 Darkened are their eyes from seeing, And their loins continually shake Thou.
content_old: 23 Darkened are their eyes from seeing, And their loins continually shake Thou.

content: 24 Pour upon them Thine indignation, And the fierceness of Thine anger doth seize them.
content_old: 24 Pour upon them Thine indignation, And the fierceness of Thine anger doth seize them.

content: 25 Their tower is desolated, In their tents there is no dweller.
content_old: 25 Their tower is desolated, In their tents there is no dweller.

content: 26 For they have pursued him Thou hast smitten, And recount of the pain of Thy pierced ones.
content_old: 26 For they have pursued him Thou hast smitten, And recount of the pain of Thy pierced ones.

content: 27 Give punishment for their iniquity, And they enter not into Thy righteousness.
content_old: 27 Give punishment for their iniquity, And they enter not into Thy righteousness.

content: 28 They are blotted out of the book of life, And with the righteous are not written.
content_old: 28 They are blotted out of the book of life, And with the righteous are not written.

content: 29 And I am afflicted and pained, Thy salvation, O God, doth set me on high.
content_old: 29 And I am afflicted and pained, Thy salvation, O God, doth set me on high.

content: 30 I praise the name of God with a song, And I magnify Him with thanksgiving,
content_old: 30 I praise the name of God with a song, And I magnify Him with thanksgiving,

content: 31 And it is better to Jehovah than an ox, A bullock—horned—hoofed.
content_old: 31 And it is better to Jehovah than an ox, A bullock—horned—hoofed.

content: 32 The humble have seen—they rejoice, Ye who seek God—and your heart liveth.
content_old: 32 The humble have seen—they rejoice, Ye who seek God—and your heart liveth.

content: 33 For Jehovah hearkeneth unto the needy, And His bound ones He hath not despised.
content_old: 33 For Jehovah hearkeneth unto the needy, And His bound ones He hath not despised.

content: 34 The heavens and earth do praise Him, Seas, and every moving thing in them.
content_old: 34 The heavens and earth do praise Him, Seas, and every moving thing in them.

content: 35 For God doth save Zion, And doth build the cities of Judah, And they have dwelt there, and possess it.
content_old: 35 For God doth save Zion, And doth build the cities of Judah, And they have dwelt there, and possess it.

content: 1 To the Overseer, by David.—‘To cause to remember.’ O God, to deliver me, O Jehovah, for my help, haste.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, by David.—‘To cause to remember.’ O God, to deliver me, O Jehovah, for my help, haste.

content: 2 Let them be ashamed and confounded Who are seeking my soul, Let them be turned backward and blush Who are desiring my evil.
content_old: 2 Let them be ashamed and confounded Who are seeking my soul, Let them be turned backward and blush Who are desiring my evil.

content: 3 Let them turn back because of their shame, Who are saying, ‘Aha, aha.’
content_old: 3 Let them turn back because of their shame, Who are saying, ‘Aha, aha.’

content: 4 Let all those seeking Thee joy and be glad in Thee, And let those loving Thy salvation Say continually, ‘God is magnified.’
content_old: 4 Let all those seeking Thee joy and be glad in Thee, And let those loving Thy salvation Say continually, ‘God is magnified.’

content: 1 In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age.
content_old: 1 In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age.

content: 2 In Thy righteousness Thou dost deliver me, And dost cause me to escape, Incline unto me Thine ear, and save me.
content_old: 2 In Thy righteousness Thou dost deliver me, And dost cause me to escape, Incline unto me Thine ear, and save me.

content: 3 Be to me for a rock—a habitation, To go in continually, Thou hast given command to save me, For my rock and my bulwark art Thou.
content_old: 3 Be to me for a rock—a habitation, To go in continually, Thou hast given command to save me, For my rock and my bulwark art Thou.

content: 4 O my God, cause me to escape From the hand of the wicked, From the hand of the perverse and violent.
content_old: 4 O my God, cause me to escape From the hand of the wicked, From the hand of the perverse and violent.

content: 5 For Thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah, My trust from my youth.
content_old: 5 For Thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah, My trust from my youth.

content: 6 By Thee I have been supported from the womb, From my mother’s bowels Thou dost cut me out, In Thee is my praise continually.
content_old: 6 By Thee I have been supported from the womb, From my mother’s bowels Thou dost cut me out, In Thee is my praise continually.

content: 7 As a wonder I have been to many, And Thou art my strong refuge.
content_old: 7 As a wonder I have been to many, And Thou art my strong refuge.

content: 8 Filled is my mouth with Thy praise, All the day with Thy beauty.
content_old: 8 Filled is my mouth with Thy praise, All the day with Thy beauty.

content: 9 Cast me not off at the time of old age, According to the consumption of my power forsake me not.
content_old: 9 Cast me not off at the time of old age, According to the consumption of my power forsake me not.

content: 10 For mine enemies have spoken against me, And those watching my soul have taken counsel together,
content_old: 10 For mine enemies have spoken against me, And those watching my soul have taken counsel together,

content: 11 Saying, ‘God hath forsaken him, Pursue and catch him, for there is no deliverer.’
content_old: 11 Saying, ‘God hath forsaken him, Pursue and catch him, for there is no deliverer.’

content: 12 O God, be not far from me, O my God, for my help make haste.
content_old: 12 O God, be not far from me, O my God, for my help make haste.

content: 13 They are ashamed, they are consumed, Who are opposing my soul, They are covered with reproach and blushing, Who are seeking my evil,
content_old: 13 They are ashamed, they are consumed, Who are opposing my soul, They are covered with reproach and blushing, Who are seeking my evil,

content: 14 And I continually do wait with hope, And have added unto all Thy praise.
content_old: 14 And I continually do wait with hope, And have added unto all Thy praise.

content: 15 My mouth recounteth Thy righteousness, All the day Thy salvation, For I have not known the numbers.
content_old: 15 My mouth recounteth Thy righteousness, All the day Thy salvation, For I have not known the numbers.

content: 16 I come in the might of the Lord Jehovah, I mention Thy righteousness—Thine only.
content_old: 16 I come in the might of the Lord Jehovah, I mention Thy righteousness—Thine only.

content: 17 God, Thou hast taught me from my youth, And hitherto I declare Thy wonders.
content_old: 17 God, Thou hast taught me from my youth, And hitherto I declare Thy wonders.

content: 18 And also unto old age and grey hairs, O God, forsake me not, Till I declare Thy strength to a generation, To every one that cometh Thy might.
content_old: 18 And also unto old age and grey hairs, O God, forsake me not, Till I declare Thy strength to a generation, To every one that cometh Thy might.

content: 19 And Thy righteousness, O God, is unto the heights, Because Thou hast done great things, O God, who is like Thee?
content_old: 19 And Thy righteousness, O God, is unto the heights, Because Thou hast done great things, O God, who is like Thee?

content: 20 Because Thou hast showed me many and sad distresses, Thou turnest back—Thou revivest me, And from the depths of the earth, Thou turnest back—Thou bringest me up.
content_old: 20 Because Thou hast showed me many and sad distresses, Thou turnest back—Thou revivest me, And from the depths of the earth, Thou turnest back—Thou bringest me up.

content: 21 Thou dost increase my greatness, And Thou surroundest—Thou comfortest me,
content_old: 21 Thou dost increase my greatness, And Thou surroundest—Thou comfortest me,

content: 22 I also thank Thee with a vessel of psaltery, Thy truth, O my God, I sing to Thee with a harp, O Holy One of Israel,
content_old: 22 I also thank Thee with a vessel of psaltery, Thy truth, O my God, I sing to Thee with a harp, O Holy One of Israel,

content: 23 My lips cry aloud when I sing praise to Thee, And my soul that Thou hast redeemed,
content_old: 23 My lips cry aloud when I sing praise to Thee, And my soul that Thou hast redeemed,

content: 1 By Solomon. O God, Thy judgments to the king give, And Thy righteousness to the king’s son.
content_old: 1 By Solomon. O God, Thy judgments to the king give, And Thy righteousness to the king’s son.

content: 2 He judgeth Thy people with righteousness, And Thy poor with judgment.
content_old: 2 He judgeth Thy people with righteousness, And Thy poor with judgment.

content: 3 The mountains bear peace to the people, And the heights by righteousness.
content_old: 3 The mountains bear peace to the people, And the heights by righteousness.

content: 4 He judgeth the poor of the people, Giveth deliverance to the sons of the needy, And bruiseth the oppressor.
content_old: 4 He judgeth the poor of the people, Giveth deliverance to the sons of the needy, And bruiseth the oppressor.

content: 5 They fear Thee with the sun, and before the moon, Generation—generations.
content_old: 5 They fear Thee with the sun, and before the moon, Generation—generations.

content: 6 He cometh down as rain on mown grass, As showers—sprinkling the earth.
content_old: 6 He cometh down as rain on mown grass, As showers—sprinkling the earth.

content: 7 Flourish in his days doth the righteous, And abundance of peace till the moon is not.
content_old: 7 Flourish in his days doth the righteous, And abundance of peace till the moon is not.

content: 8 And he ruleth from sea unto sea, And from the river unto the ends of earth.
content_old: 8 And he ruleth from sea unto sea, And from the river unto the ends of earth.

content: 9 Before him bow do the inhabitants of the dry places, And his enemies lick the dust.
content_old: 9 Before him bow do the inhabitants of the dry places, And his enemies lick the dust.

content: 10 Kings of Tarshish and of the isles send back a present. Kings of Sheba and Seba a reward bring near.
content_old: 10 Kings of Tarshish and of the isles send back a present. Kings of Sheba and Seba a reward bring near.

content: 11 And all kings do bow themselves to him, All nations do serve him,
content_old: 11 And all kings do bow themselves to him, All nations do serve him,

content: 12 For he delivereth the needy who crieth, And the poor when he hath no helper,
content_old: 12 For he delivereth the needy who crieth, And the poor when he hath no helper,

content: 13 He hath pity on the poor and needy, And the souls of the needy he saveth,
content_old: 13 He hath pity on the poor and needy, And the souls of the needy he saveth,

content: 14 From fraud and from violence he redeemeth their soul, And precious is their blood in his eyes.
content_old: 14 From fraud and from violence he redeemeth their soul, And precious is their blood in his eyes.

content: 15 And he liveth, and giveth to him of the gold of Sheba, And prayeth for him continually, All the day he doth bless him.
content_old: 15 And he liveth, and giveth to him of the gold of Sheba, And prayeth for him continually, All the day he doth bless him.

content: 16 There is a handful of corn in the earth, On the top of mountains, Shake like Lebanon doth its fruit, And they flourish out of the city as the herb of the earth.
content_old: 16 There is a handful of corn in the earth, On the top of mountains, Shake like Lebanon doth its fruit, And they flourish out of the city as the herb of the earth.

content: 17 His name is to the age, Before the sun is his name continued, And they bless themselves in him, All nations do pronounce him happy.
content_old: 17 His name is to the age, Before the sun is his name continued, And they bless themselves in him, All nations do pronounce him happy.

content: 18 Blessed is Jehovah God, God of Israel, He alone is doing wonders,
content_old: 18 Blessed is Jehovah God, God of Israel, He alone is doing wonders,

content: 19 And blessed is the Name of His honour to the age, And the whole earth is filled with His honour. Amen, and amen!
content_old: 19 And blessed is the Name of His honour to the age, And the whole earth is filled with His honour. Amen, and amen!

content: 1 A Psalm of Asaph. Only—good to Israel is God, to the clean of heart. And I—as a little thing, My feet have been turned aside,
content_old: 1 A Psalm of Asaph. Only—good to Israel is God, to the clean of heart. And I—as a little thing, My feet have been turned aside,

content: 2 As nothing, have my steps slipped, For I have been envious of the boastful,
content_old: 2 As nothing, have my steps slipped, For I have been envious of the boastful,

content: 3 The peace of the wicked I see, That there are no bands at their death,
content_old: 3 The peace of the wicked I see, That there are no bands at their death,

content: 4 And their might is firm.
content_old: 4 And their might is firm.

content: 5 In the misery of mortals they are not, And with common men they are not plagued.
content_old: 5 In the misery of mortals they are not, And with common men they are not plagued.

content: 6 Therefore hath pride encircled them, Violence covereth them as a dress.
content_old: 6 Therefore hath pride encircled them, Violence covereth them as a dress.

content: 7 Their eye hath come out from fat. The imaginations of the heart transgressed;
content_old: 7 Their eye hath come out from fat. The imaginations of the heart transgressed;

content: 8 They do corruptly, And they speak in the wickedness of oppression, From on high they speak.
content_old: 8 They do corruptly, And they speak in the wickedness of oppression, From on high they speak.

content: 9 They have set in the heavens their mouth, And their tongue walketh in the earth.
content_old: 9 They have set in the heavens their mouth, And their tongue walketh in the earth.

content: 10 Therefore do His people return hither, And waters of fulness are wrung out to them.
content_old: 10 Therefore do His people return hither, And waters of fulness are wrung out to them.

content: 11 And they have said, ‘How hath God known? And is there knowledge in the Most High?’
content_old: 11 And they have said, ‘How hath God known? And is there knowledge in the Most High?’

content: 12 Lo, these are the wicked and easy ones of the age, They have increased strength.
content_old: 12 Lo, these are the wicked and easy ones of the age, They have increased strength.

content: 13 Only—a vain thing! I have purified my heart, And I wash in innocency my hands,
content_old: 13 Only—a vain thing! I have purified my heart, And I wash in innocency my hands,

content: 14 And I am plagued all the day, And my reproof is every morning.
content_old: 14 And I am plagued all the day, And my reproof is every morning.

content: 15 If I have said, ‘I recount thus,’ Lo, a generation of Thy sons I have deceived.
content_old: 15 If I have said, ‘I recount thus,’ Lo, a generation of Thy sons I have deceived.

content: 16 And I think to know this, Perverseness it is in mine eyes,
content_old: 16 And I think to know this, Perverseness it is in mine eyes,

content: 17 Till I come in to the sanctuaries of God, I attend to their latter end.
content_old: 17 Till I come in to the sanctuaries of God, I attend to their latter end.

content: 18 Only, in slippery places Thou dost set them, Thou hast caused them to fall to desolations.
content_old: 18 Only, in slippery places Thou dost set them, Thou hast caused them to fall to desolations.

content: 19 How have they become a desolation as in a moment, They have been ended—consumed from terrors.
content_old: 19 How have they become a desolation as in a moment, They have been ended—consumed from terrors.

content: 20 As a dream from awakening, O Lord, In awaking, their image Thou despisest.
content_old: 20 As a dream from awakening, O Lord, In awaking, their image Thou despisest.

content: 21 For my heart doth show itself violent, And my reins prick themselves,
content_old: 21 For my heart doth show itself violent, And my reins prick themselves,

content: 22 And I am brutish, and do not know. A beast I have been with Thee.
content_old: 22 And I am brutish, and do not know. A beast I have been with Thee.

content: 23 And I am continually with Thee, Thou hast laid hold on my right hand.
content_old: 23 And I am continually with Thee, Thou hast laid hold on my right hand.

content: 24 With Thy counsel Thou dost lead me, And after honour dost receive me.
content_old: 24 With Thy counsel Thou dost lead me, And after honour dost receive me.

content: 25 Whom have I in the heavens? And with Thee none I have desired in earth.
content_old: 25 Whom have I in the heavens? And with Thee none I have desired in earth.

content: 26 Consumed hath been my flesh and my heart, The rock of my heart and my portion is God to the age.
content_old: 26 Consumed hath been my flesh and my heart, The rock of my heart and my portion is God to the age.

content: 27 For, lo, those far from Thee do perish, Thou hast cut off every one, Who is going a whoring from Thee.
content_old: 27 For, lo, those far from Thee do perish, Thou hast cut off every one, Who is going a whoring from Thee.

content: 1 An Instruction of Asaph. Why, O God, hast Thou cast off for ever? Thine anger smoketh against the flock of Thy pasture.
content_old: 1 An Instruction of Asaph. Why, O God, hast Thou cast off for ever? Thine anger smoketh against the flock of Thy pasture.

content: 2 Remember Thy company. Thou didst purchase of old, Thou didst redeem the rod of Thy inheritance, This mount Zion—Thou didst dwell in it.
content_old: 2 Remember Thy company. Thou didst purchase of old, Thou didst redeem the rod of Thy inheritance, This mount Zion—Thou didst dwell in it.

content: 3 Lift up Thy steps to the perpetual desolations, Everything the enemy did wickedly in the sanctuary.
content_old: 3 Lift up Thy steps to the perpetual desolations, Everything the enemy did wickedly in the sanctuary.

content: 4 Roared have thine adversaries, In the midst of Thy meeting-places, They have set their ensigns as ensigns.
content_old: 4 Roared have thine adversaries, In the midst of Thy meeting-places, They have set their ensigns as ensigns.

content: 5 He is known as one bringing in on high Against a thicket of wood—axes.
content_old: 5 He is known as one bringing in on high Against a thicket of wood—axes.

content: 6 And now, its carvings together With axe and hatchet they break down,
content_old: 6 And now, its carvings together With axe and hatchet they break down,

content: 7 They have sent into fire Thy sanctuary, to the earth they polluted the tabernacle of Thy name,
content_old: 7 They have sent into fire Thy sanctuary, to the earth they polluted the tabernacle of Thy name,

content: 8 They said in their hearts, ‘Let us oppress them together,’ They did burn all the meeting-places of God in the land.
content_old: 8 They said in their hearts, ‘Let us oppress them together,’ They did burn all the meeting-places of God in the land.

content: 9 Our ensigns we have not seen, There is no more a prophet, Nor with us is one knowing how long.
content_old: 9 Our ensigns we have not seen, There is no more a prophet, Nor with us is one knowing how long.

content: 10 Till when, O God, doth an adversary reproach? Doth an enemy despise thy name for ever?
content_old: 10 Till when, O God, doth an adversary reproach? Doth an enemy despise thy name for ever?

content: 11 Why dost Thou turn back Thy hand, Even Thy right hand? From the midst of Thy bosom remove it.
content_old: 11 Why dost Thou turn back Thy hand, Even Thy right hand? From the midst of Thy bosom remove it.

content: 12 And God is my king of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.
content_old: 12 And God is my king of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.

content: 13 Thou hast broken by Thy strength a sea -monster, Thou hast shivered Heads of dragons by the waters,
content_old: 13 Thou hast broken by Thy strength a sea -monster, Thou hast shivered Heads of dragons by the waters,

content: 14 Thou hast broken the heads of leviathan, Thou makest him food, For the people of the dry places.
content_old: 14 Thou hast broken the heads of leviathan, Thou makest him food, For the people of the dry places.

content: 15 Thou hast cleaved a fountain and a stream, Thou hast dried up perennial flowings.
content_old: 15 Thou hast cleaved a fountain and a stream, Thou hast dried up perennial flowings.

content: 16 Thine is the day, also Thine is the night, Thou hast prepared a light giver—the sun.
content_old: 16 Thine is the day, also Thine is the night, Thou hast prepared a light giver—the sun.

content: 17 Thou hast set up all the borders of earth, Summer and winter Thou hast formed them.
content_old: 17 Thou hast set up all the borders of earth, Summer and winter Thou hast formed them.

content: 18 Remember this—an enemy reproached Jehovah, And a foolish people have despised Thy name.
content_old: 18 Remember this—an enemy reproached Jehovah, And a foolish people have despised Thy name.

content: 19 Give not up to a company, The soul of Thy turtle-dove, The company of Thy poor ones forget not for ever.
content_old: 19 Give not up to a company, The soul of Thy turtle-dove, The company of Thy poor ones forget not for ever.

content: 20 Look attentively to the covenant, For the dark places of earth, Have been full of habitations of violence.
content_old: 20 Look attentively to the covenant, For the dark places of earth, Have been full of habitations of violence.

content: 21 Let not the oppressed turn back ashamed, Let the poor and needy praise Thy name,
content_old: 21 Let not the oppressed turn back ashamed, Let the poor and needy praise Thy name,

content: 22 Arise, O God, plead Thy plea, Remember Thy reproach from a fool all the day.
content_old: 22 Arise, O God, plead Thy plea, Remember Thy reproach from a fool all the day.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not.’—A Psalm of Asaph.—A Song. We have given thanks to Thee, O God, We have given thanks, and near is Thy name, They have recounted Thy wonders.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘Destroy not.’—A Psalm of Asaph.—A Song. We have given thanks to Thee, O God, We have given thanks, and near is Thy name, They have recounted Thy wonders.

content: 2 When I receive an appointment, I—I do judge uprightly.
content_old: 2 When I receive an appointment, I—I do judge uprightly.

content: 3 Melted is the earth and all its inhabitants, I—I have pondered its pillars. Selah.
content_old: 3 Melted is the earth and all its inhabitants, I—I have pondered its pillars. Selah.

content: 4 I have said to the boastful, ‘Be not boastful,’ And to the wicked, ‘Raise not up a horn.’
content_old: 4 I have said to the boastful, ‘Be not boastful,’ And to the wicked, ‘Raise not up a horn.’

content: 5 Raise not up on high your horn, (Ye speak with a stiff neck.)
content_old: 5 Raise not up on high your horn, (Ye speak with a stiff neck.)

content: 6 For not from the east, or from the west, Nor from the wilderness—is elevation.
content_old: 6 For not from the east, or from the west, Nor from the wilderness—is elevation.

content: 7 But God is judge, This He maketh low—and this He lifteth up.
content_old: 7 But God is judge, This He maketh low—and this He lifteth up.

content: 8 For a cup is in the hand of Jehovah, And the wine hath foamed, It is full of mixture, and He poureth out of it, Only its dregs wring out, and drink, Do all the wicked of the earth,
content_old: 8 For a cup is in the hand of Jehovah, And the wine hath foamed, It is full of mixture, and He poureth out of it, Only its dregs wring out, and drink, Do all the wicked of the earth,

content: 9 And I—I declare it to the age, I sing praise to the God of Jacob.
content_old: 9 And I—I declare it to the age, I sing praise to the God of Jacob.

content: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments.—A Psalm of Asaph.—A Song. In Judah is God known, in Israel His name is great.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer with stringed instruments.—A Psalm of Asaph.—A Song. In Judah is God known, in Israel His name is great.

content: 2 And His tabernacle is in Salem, And His habitation in Zion.
content_old: 2 And His tabernacle is in Salem, And His habitation in Zion.

content: 3 There he hath shivered arrows of a bow, Shield, and sword, and battle. Selah.
content_old: 3 There he hath shivered arrows of a bow, Shield, and sword, and battle. Selah.

content: 4 Bright art Thou, honourable above hills of prey.
content_old: 4 Bright art Thou, honourable above hills of prey.

content: 5 Spoiled themselves have the mighty of heart, They have slept their sleep, And none of the men of might found their hands.
content_old: 5 Spoiled themselves have the mighty of heart, They have slept their sleep, And none of the men of might found their hands.

content: 6 From Thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, Both rider and horse have been fast asleep.
content_old: 6 From Thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, Both rider and horse have been fast asleep.

content: 7 Thou, fearful art Thou, And who doth stand before Thee, Since Thou hast been angry!
content_old: 7 Thou, fearful art Thou, And who doth stand before Thee, Since Thou hast been angry!

content: 8 From heaven Thou hast sounded judgment, Earth hath feared, and hath been still,
content_old: 8 From heaven Thou hast sounded judgment, Earth hath feared, and hath been still,

content: 9 In the rising of God to judgment, To save all the humble of earth. Selah.
content_old: 9 In the rising of God to judgment, To save all the humble of earth. Selah.

content: 10 For the fierceness of man praiseth Thee, The remnant of fierceness Thou girdest on.
content_old: 10 For the fierceness of man praiseth Thee, The remnant of fierceness Thou girdest on.

content: 11 Vow and complete to Jehovah your God, All ye surrounding him. They bring presents to the Fearful One.
content_old: 11 Vow and complete to Jehovah your God, All ye surrounding him. They bring presents to the Fearful One.

content: 1 To the Overseer, for Jeduthun.—A Psalm of Asaph. My voice is to God, and I cry, my voice is to God, And He hath given ear unto me.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer, for Jeduthun.—A Psalm of Asaph. My voice is to God, and I cry, my voice is to God, And He hath given ear unto me.

content: 2 In a day of my distress the Lord I sought, My hand by night hath been spread out, And it doth not cease, My soul hath refused to be comforted.
content_old: 2 In a day of my distress the Lord I sought, My hand by night hath been spread out, And it doth not cease, My soul hath refused to be comforted.

content: 3 I remember God, and make a noise, I meditate, and feeble is my spirit. Selah.
content_old: 3 I remember God, and make a noise, I meditate, and feeble is my spirit. Selah.

content: 4 Thou hast taken hold of the watches of mine eyes, I have been moved, and I speak not.
content_old: 4 Thou hast taken hold of the watches of mine eyes, I have been moved, and I speak not.

content: 5 I have reckoned the days of old, The years of the ages.
content_old: 5 I have reckoned the days of old, The years of the ages.

content: 6 I remember my music in the night, With my heart I meditate, and my spirit doth search diligently:
content_old: 6 I remember my music in the night, With my heart I meditate, and my spirit doth search diligently:

content: 7 To the ages doth the Lord cast off? Doth He add to be pleased no more?
content_old: 7 To the ages doth the Lord cast off? Doth He add to be pleased no more?

content: 8 Hath His kindness ceased for ever? The saying failed to all generations?
content_old: 8 Hath His kindness ceased for ever? The saying failed to all generations?

content: 9 Hath God forgotten His favours? Hath He shut up in anger His mercies? Selah.
content_old: 9 Hath God forgotten His favours? Hath He shut up in anger His mercies? Selah.

content: 10 And I say: ‘My weakness is, The changes of the right hand of the Most High.’
content_old: 10 And I say: ‘My weakness is, The changes of the right hand of the Most High.’

content: 11 I mention the doings of Jah, For I remember of old Thy wonders,
content_old: 11 I mention the doings of Jah, For I remember of old Thy wonders,

content: 12 And I have meditated on all Thy working, And I talk concerning Thy doings.
content_old: 12 And I have meditated on all Thy working, And I talk concerning Thy doings.

content: 13 O God, in holiness is Thy way, Who is a great god like God?
content_old: 13 O God, in holiness is Thy way, Who is a great god like God?

content: 14 Thou art the God doing wonders. Thou hast made known among the peoples Thy strength,
content_old: 14 Thou art the God doing wonders. Thou hast made known among the peoples Thy strength,

content: 15 Thou hast redeemed with strength Thy people, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
content_old: 15 Thou hast redeemed with strength Thy people, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

content: 16 The waters have seen Thee, O God, The waters have seen Thee, They are afraid—also depths are troubled.
content_old: 16 The waters have seen Thee, O God, The waters have seen Thee, They are afraid—also depths are troubled.

content: 17 Poured out waters have thick clouds, The skies have given forth a noise, Also—Thine arrows go up and down.
content_old: 17 Poured out waters have thick clouds, The skies have given forth a noise, Also—Thine arrows go up and down.

content: 18 The voice of Thy thunder is in the spheres, Lightnings have lightened the world, The earth hath trembled, yea, it shaketh.
content_old: 18 The voice of Thy thunder is in the spheres, Lightnings have lightened the world, The earth hath trembled, yea, it shaketh.

content: 19 In the sea is Thy way, And Thy paths are in many waters, And Thy tracks have not been known.
content_old: 19 In the sea is Thy way, And Thy paths are in many waters, And Thy tracks have not been known.

content: 1 An Instruction of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my law, Incline your ear to sayings of my mouth.
content_old: 1 An Instruction of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my law, Incline your ear to sayings of my mouth.

content: 2 I open with a simile my mouth, I bring forth hidden things of old,
content_old: 2 I open with a simile my mouth, I bring forth hidden things of old,

content: 3 That we have heard and do know, And our fathers have recounted to us.
content_old: 3 That we have heard and do know, And our fathers have recounted to us.

content: 4 We do not hide from their sons, To a later generation recounting praises of Jehovah, And His strength, and His wonders that He hath done.
content_old: 4 We do not hide from their sons, To a later generation recounting praises of Jehovah, And His strength, and His wonders that He hath done.

content: 5 And He raiseth up a testimony in Jacob, And a law hath placed in Israel, That He commanded our fathers, To make them known to their sons.
content_old: 5 And He raiseth up a testimony in Jacob, And a law hath placed in Israel, That He commanded our fathers, To make them known to their sons.

content: 6 So that a later generation doth know, Sons who are born, do rise and recount to their sons,
content_old: 6 So that a later generation doth know, Sons who are born, do rise and recount to their sons,

content: 7 And place in God their confidence, And forget not the doings of God, But keep His commands.
