content_old: 7 And place in God their confidence, And forget not the doings of God, But keep His commands.

content: 8 And they are not like their fathers, A generation apostate and rebellious, A generation! it hath not prepared its heart, Nor stedfast with God is its spirit.
content_old: 8 And they are not like their fathers, A generation apostate and rebellious, A generation! it hath not prepared its heart, Nor stedfast with God is its spirit.

content: 9 Sons of Ephraim—armed bearers of bow, Have turned in a day of conflict.
content_old: 9 Sons of Ephraim—armed bearers of bow, Have turned in a day of conflict.

content: 10 They have not kept the covenant of God, And in His law they have refused to walk,
content_old: 10 They have not kept the covenant of God, And in His law they have refused to walk,

content: 11 And they forget His doings, And His wonders that He shewed them.
content_old: 11 And they forget His doings, And His wonders that He shewed them.

content: 12 Before their fathers He hath done wonders, In the land of Egypt—the field of Zoan.
content_old: 12 Before their fathers He hath done wonders, In the land of Egypt—the field of Zoan.

content: 13 He cleft a sea, and causeth them to pass over, Yea, He causeth waters to stand as a heap.
content_old: 13 He cleft a sea, and causeth them to pass over, Yea, He causeth waters to stand as a heap.

content: 14 And leadeth them with a cloud by day, And all the night with a light of fire.
content_old: 14 And leadeth them with a cloud by day, And all the night with a light of fire.

content: 15 He cleaveth rocks in a wilderness, And giveth drink—as the great deep.
content_old: 15 He cleaveth rocks in a wilderness, And giveth drink—as the great deep.

content: 16 And bringeth out streams from a rock, And causeth waters to come down as rivers.
content_old: 16 And bringeth out streams from a rock, And causeth waters to come down as rivers.

content: 17 And they add still to sin against Him, To provoke the Most High in the dry place.
content_old: 17 And they add still to sin against Him, To provoke the Most High in the dry place.

content: 18 And they try God in their heart, To ask food for their lust.
content_old: 18 And they try God in their heart, To ask food for their lust.

content: 19 And they speak against God—they said: ‘Is God able to array a table in a wilderness?’
content_old: 19 And they speak against God—they said: ‘Is God able to array a table in a wilderness?’

content: 20 Lo, He hath smitten a rock, And waters flow, yea, streams overflow. ‘Also—bread is He able to give? Doth He prepare flesh for His people?’
content_old: 20 Lo, He hath smitten a rock, And waters flow, yea, streams overflow. ‘Also—bread is He able to give? Doth He prepare flesh for His people?’

content: 21 Therefore hath Jehovah heard, And He sheweth Himself wroth, And fire hath been kindled against Jacob, And anger also hath gone up against Israel,
content_old: 21 Therefore hath Jehovah heard, And He sheweth Himself wroth, And fire hath been kindled against Jacob, And anger also hath gone up against Israel,

content: 22 For they have not believed in God, Nor have they trusted in His salvation.
content_old: 22 For they have not believed in God, Nor have they trusted in His salvation.

content: 23 And He commandeth clouds from above, Yea, doors of the heavens He hath opened.
content_old: 23 And He commandeth clouds from above, Yea, doors of the heavens He hath opened.

content: 24 And He raineth on them manna to eat, Yea, corn of heaven He hath given to them.
content_old: 24 And He raineth on them manna to eat, Yea, corn of heaven He hath given to them.

content: 25 Food of the mighty hath each eaten, Venison He sent to them to satiety.
content_old: 25 Food of the mighty hath each eaten, Venison He sent to them to satiety.

content: 26 He causeth an east wind to journey in the heavens, And leadeth by His strength a south wind,
content_old: 26 He causeth an east wind to journey in the heavens, And leadeth by His strength a south wind,

content: 27 And He raineth on them flesh as dust, And as sand of the seas—winged fowl,
content_old: 27 And He raineth on them flesh as dust, And as sand of the seas—winged fowl,

content: 28 And causeth it to fall in the midst of His camp, Round about His tabernacles.
content_old: 28 And causeth it to fall in the midst of His camp, Round about His tabernacles.

content: 29 And they eat, and are greatly satisfied, And their desire He bringeth to them.
content_old: 29 And they eat, and are greatly satisfied, And their desire He bringeth to them.

content: 30 They have not been estranged from their desire, Yet is their food in their mouth,
content_old: 30 They have not been estranged from their desire, Yet is their food in their mouth,

content: 31 And the anger of God hath gone up against them, And He slayeth among their fat ones, And youths of Israel He caused to bend.
content_old: 31 And the anger of God hath gone up against them, And He slayeth among their fat ones, And youths of Israel He caused to bend.

content: 32 With all this they have sinned again, And have not believed in His wonders.
content_old: 32 With all this they have sinned again, And have not believed in His wonders.

content: 33 And He consumeth in vanity their days, And their years in trouble.
content_old: 33 And He consumeth in vanity their days, And their years in trouble.

content: 34 If He slew them, then they sought Him, And turned back, and sought God earnestly,
content_old: 34 If He slew them, then they sought Him, And turned back, and sought God earnestly,

content: 35 And they remember that God is their rock, And God Most High their redeemer.
content_old: 35 And they remember that God is their rock, And God Most High their redeemer.

content: 36 And—they deceive Him with their mouth, And with their tongue do lie to Him,
content_old: 36 And—they deceive Him with their mouth, And with their tongue do lie to Him,

content: 37 And their heart hath not been right with Him, And they have not been stedfast in His covenant.
content_old: 37 And their heart hath not been right with Him, And they have not been stedfast in His covenant.

content: 38 And He—the Merciful One, Pardoneth iniquity, and destroyeth not, And hath often turned back His anger, And waketh not up all His fury.
content_old: 38 And He—the Merciful One, Pardoneth iniquity, and destroyeth not, And hath often turned back His anger, And waketh not up all His fury.

content: 39 And He remembereth that they are flesh, A wind going on—and it returneth not.
content_old: 39 And He remembereth that they are flesh, A wind going on—and it returneth not.

content: 40 How often do they provoke Him in the wilderness, Grieve Him in the desolate place?
content_old: 40 How often do they provoke Him in the wilderness, Grieve Him in the desolate place?

content: 41 Yea, they turn back, and try God, And the Holy One of Israel have limited.
content_old: 41 Yea, they turn back, and try God, And the Holy One of Israel have limited.

content: 42 They have not remembered His hand The day He ransomed them from the adversary.
content_old: 42 They have not remembered His hand The day He ransomed them from the adversary.

content: 43 When He set His signs in Egypt, And His wonders in the field of Zoan,
content_old: 43 When He set His signs in Egypt, And His wonders in the field of Zoan,

content: 44 And He turneth to blood their streams, And their floods they drink not.
content_old: 44 And He turneth to blood their streams, And their floods they drink not.

content: 45 He sendeth among them the beetle, and it consumeth them, And the frog, and it destroyeth them,
content_old: 45 He sendeth among them the beetle, and it consumeth them, And the frog, and it destroyeth them,

content: 46 And giveth to the caterpillar their increase, And their labour to the locust.
content_old: 46 And giveth to the caterpillar their increase, And their labour to the locust.

content: 47 He destroyeth with hail their vine, And their sycamores with frost,
content_old: 47 He destroyeth with hail their vine, And their sycamores with frost,

content: 48 And delivereth up to the hail their beasts, And their cattle to the burning flames.
content_old: 48 And delivereth up to the hail their beasts, And their cattle to the burning flames.

content: 49 He sendeth on them the fury of His anger, Wrath, and indignation, and distress—A discharge of evil messengers.
content_old: 49 He sendeth on them the fury of His anger, Wrath, and indignation, and distress—A discharge of evil messengers.

content: 50 He pondereth a path for His anger, He kept not back their soul from death, Yea, their life to the pestilence He delivered up.
content_old: 50 He pondereth a path for His anger, He kept not back their soul from death, Yea, their life to the pestilence He delivered up.

content: 51 And He smiteth every first-born in Egypt, The first-fruit of the strong in tents of Ham.
content_old: 51 And He smiteth every first-born in Egypt, The first-fruit of the strong in tents of Ham.

content: 52 And causeth His people to journey as a flock, And guideth them as a drove in a wilderness,
content_old: 52 And causeth His people to journey as a flock, And guideth them as a drove in a wilderness,

content: 53 And He leadeth them confidently, And they have not been afraid, And their enemies hath the sea covered.
content_old: 53 And He leadeth them confidently, And they have not been afraid, And their enemies hath the sea covered.

content: 54 And He bringeth them in unto the border of His sanctuary, This mountain His right hand had got,
content_old: 54 And He bringeth them in unto the border of His sanctuary, This mountain His right hand had got,

content: 55 And casteth out nations from before them, And causeth them to fall in the line of inheritance, And causeth the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents,
content_old: 55 And casteth out nations from before them, And causeth them to fall in the line of inheritance, And causeth the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents,

content: 56 And they tempt and provoke God Most High, And His testimonies have not kept.
content_old: 56 And they tempt and provoke God Most High, And His testimonies have not kept.

content: 57 And they turn back, And deal treacherously like their fathers, They have been turned like a deceitful bow,
content_old: 57 And they turn back, And deal treacherously like their fathers, They have been turned like a deceitful bow,

content: 58 And make Him angry with their high places, And with their graven images make Him zealous,
content_old: 58 And make Him angry with their high places, And with their graven images make Him zealous,

content: 59 God hath heard, and sheweth Himself wroth. And kicketh exceedingly against Israel.
content_old: 59 God hath heard, and sheweth Himself wroth. And kicketh exceedingly against Israel.

content: 60 And He leaveth the tabernacle of Shiloh, The tent He had placed among men,
content_old: 60 And He leaveth the tabernacle of Shiloh, The tent He had placed among men,

content: 61 And He giveth His strength to captivity, And His beauty into the hand of an adversary,
content_old: 61 And He giveth His strength to captivity, And His beauty into the hand of an adversary,

content: 62 And delivereth up to the sword His people, And with His inheritance shewed Himself angry.
content_old: 62 And delivereth up to the sword His people, And with His inheritance shewed Himself angry.

content: 63 His young men hath fire consumed, And His virgins have not been praised.
content_old: 63 His young men hath fire consumed, And His virgins have not been praised.

content: 64 His priests by the sword have fallen, And their widows weep not.
content_old: 64 His priests by the sword have fallen, And their widows weep not.

content: 65 And the Lord waketh as a sleeper, As a mighty one crying aloud from wine.
content_old: 65 And the Lord waketh as a sleeper, As a mighty one crying aloud from wine.

content: 66 And He smiteth His adversaries backward, A reproach age-during He hath put on them,
content_old: 66 And He smiteth His adversaries backward, A reproach age-during He hath put on them,

content: 67 And He kicketh against the tent of Joseph, And on the tribe of Ephraim hath not fixed.
content_old: 67 And He kicketh against the tent of Joseph, And on the tribe of Ephraim hath not fixed.

content: 68 And He chooseth the tribe of Judah, With mount Zion that He loved,
content_old: 68 And He chooseth the tribe of Judah, With mount Zion that He loved,

content: 69 And buildeth His sanctuary as a high place, Like the earth, He founded it to the age.
content_old: 69 And buildeth His sanctuary as a high place, Like the earth, He founded it to the age.

content: 70 And He fixeth on David His servant, And taketh him from the folds of a flock,
content_old: 70 And He fixeth on David His servant, And taketh him from the folds of a flock,

content: 71 From behind suckling ones He hath brought him in, To rule over Jacob His people, And over Israel His inheritance.
content_old: 71 From behind suckling ones He hath brought him in, To rule over Jacob His people, And over Israel His inheritance.

content: 1 A Psalm of Asaph. O God, nations have come into Thy inheritance, They have defiled Thy holy temple, They made Jerusalem become heaps,
content_old: 1 A Psalm of Asaph. O God, nations have come into Thy inheritance, They have defiled Thy holy temple, They made Jerusalem become heaps,

content: 2 They gave the dead bodies of Thy servants Food for the fowls of the heavens, The flesh of Thy saints For the wild beast of the earth.
content_old: 2 They gave the dead bodies of Thy servants Food for the fowls of the heavens, The flesh of Thy saints For the wild beast of the earth.

content: 3 They have shed their blood As water round about Jerusalem, And there is none burying.
content_old: 3 They have shed their blood As water round about Jerusalem, And there is none burying.

content: 4 We have been a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a derision to our surrounders.
content_old: 4 We have been a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a derision to our surrounders.

content: 5 Till when, O Jehovah? art Thou angry for ever? Thy jealousy doth burn as fire.
content_old: 5 Till when, O Jehovah? art Thou angry for ever? Thy jealousy doth burn as fire.

content: 6 Pour Thy fury on the nations who have not known Thee, And on kingdoms that have not called in Thy name.
content_old: 6 Pour Thy fury on the nations who have not known Thee, And on kingdoms that have not called in Thy name.

content: 7 For one hath devoured Jacob, And his habitation they have made desolate.
content_old: 7 For one hath devoured Jacob, And his habitation they have made desolate.

content: 8 Remember not for us the iniquities of forefathers, Haste, let Thy mercies go before us, For we have been very weak.
content_old: 8 Remember not for us the iniquities of forefathers, Haste, let Thy mercies go before us, For we have been very weak.

content: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, Because of the honour of Thy name, And deliver us, and cover over our sins, For Thy name’s sake.
content_old: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, Because of the honour of Thy name, And deliver us, and cover over our sins, For Thy name’s sake.

content: 10 Why do the nations say, ‘Where is their God?’ Let be known among the nations before our eyes, The vengeance of the blood of Thy servants that is shed.
content_old: 10 Why do the nations say, ‘Where is their God?’ Let be known among the nations before our eyes, The vengeance of the blood of Thy servants that is shed.

content: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come in before Thee, According to the greatness of Thine arm, Leave Thou the sons of death.
content_old: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come in before Thee, According to the greatness of Thine arm, Leave Thou the sons of death.

content: 12 And turn Thou back to our neighbours, Sevenfold unto their bosom, their reproach, Wherewith they reproached Thee, O Lord.
content_old: 12 And turn Thou back to our neighbours, Sevenfold unto their bosom, their reproach, Wherewith they reproached Thee, O Lord.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Lilies.’ A testimony of Asaph.—A Psalm. Shepherd of Israel, give ear, Leading Joseph as a flock, Inhabiting the cherubs—shine forth,
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Lilies.’ A testimony of Asaph.—A Psalm. Shepherd of Israel, give ear, Leading Joseph as a flock, Inhabiting the cherubs—shine forth,

content: 2 Before Ephraim, and Benjamin, and Manasseh, Wake up Thy might, and come for our salvation.
content_old: 2 Before Ephraim, and Benjamin, and Manasseh, Wake up Thy might, and come for our salvation.

content: 3 O God, cause us to turn back, And cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved.
content_old: 3 O God, cause us to turn back, And cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved.

content: 4 Jehovah, God of Hosts, till when? Thou hast burned against the prayer of Thy people.
content_old: 4 Jehovah, God of Hosts, till when? Thou hast burned against the prayer of Thy people.

content: 5 Thou hast caused them to eat bread of tears, And causest them to drink With tears a third time.
content_old: 5 Thou hast caused them to eat bread of tears, And causest them to drink With tears a third time.

content: 6 Thou makest us a strife to our neighbours, And our enemies mock at it.
content_old: 6 Thou makest us a strife to our neighbours, And our enemies mock at it.

content: 7 God of Hosts, turn us back, And cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved.
content_old: 7 God of Hosts, turn us back, And cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved.

content: 8 A vine out of Egypt Thou dost bring, Thou dost cast out nations, and plantest it.
content_old: 8 A vine out of Egypt Thou dost bring, Thou dost cast out nations, and plantest it.

content: 9 Thou hast looked before it, and dost root it, And it filleth the land,
content_old: 9 Thou hast looked before it, and dost root it, And it filleth the land,

content: 10 Covered have been hills with its shadow, And its boughs are cedars of God.
content_old: 10 Covered have been hills with its shadow, And its boughs are cedars of God.

content: 11 It sendeth forth its branches unto the sea, And unto the river its sucklings.
content_old: 11 It sendeth forth its branches unto the sea, And unto the river its sucklings.

content: 12 Why hast Thou broken down its hedges, And all passing by the way have plucked it?
content_old: 12 Why hast Thou broken down its hedges, And all passing by the way have plucked it?

content: 13 A boar out of the forest doth waste it, And a wild beast of the fields consumeth it.
content_old: 13 A boar out of the forest doth waste it, And a wild beast of the fields consumeth it.

content: 14 God of Hosts, turn back, we beseech Thee, Look from heaven, and see, and inspect this vine,
content_old: 14 God of Hosts, turn back, we beseech Thee, Look from heaven, and see, and inspect this vine,

content: 15 And the root that Thy right hand planted, And the branch Thou madest strong for Thee,
content_old: 15 And the root that Thy right hand planted, And the branch Thou madest strong for Thee,

content: 16 Burnt with fire—cut down, From the rebuke of Thy face they perish.
content_old: 16 Burnt with fire—cut down, From the rebuke of Thy face they perish.

content: 17 Let Thy hand be on the man of Thy right hand, On the son of man Thou hast strengthened for Thyself.
content_old: 17 Let Thy hand be on the man of Thy right hand, On the son of man Thou hast strengthened for Thyself.

content: 18 And we do not go back from Thee, Thou dost revive us, and in Thy name we call.
content_old: 18 And we do not go back from Thee, Thou dost revive us, and in Thy name we call.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Gittith.’ By Asaph. Cry aloud to God our strength, Shout to the God of Jacob.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Gittith.’ By Asaph. Cry aloud to God our strength, Shout to the God of Jacob.

content: 2 Lift up a song, and give out a timbrel, A pleasant harp with psaltery.
content_old: 2 Lift up a song, and give out a timbrel, A pleasant harp with psaltery.

content: 3 Blow in the month a trumpet, In the new moon, at the day of our festival,
content_old: 3 Blow in the month a trumpet, In the new moon, at the day of our festival,

content: 4 For a statute to Israel it is, An ordinance of the God of Jacob.
content_old: 4 For a statute to Israel it is, An ordinance of the God of Jacob.

content: 5 A testimony on Joseph He hath placed it, In his going forth over the land of Egypt. A lip, I have not known—I hear.
content_old: 5 A testimony on Joseph He hath placed it, In his going forth over the land of Egypt. A lip, I have not known—I hear.

content: 6 From the burden his shoulder I turned aside, His hands from the basket pass over.
content_old: 6 From the burden his shoulder I turned aside, His hands from the basket pass over.

content: 7 In distress thou hast called and I deliver thee, I answer thee in the secret place of thunder, I try thee by the waters of Meribah. Selah.
content_old: 7 In distress thou hast called and I deliver thee, I answer thee in the secret place of thunder, I try thee by the waters of Meribah. Selah.

content: 8 Hear, O My people, and I testify to thee, O Israel, if thou dost hearken to me:
content_old: 8 Hear, O My people, and I testify to thee, O Israel, if thou dost hearken to me:

content: 9 There is not in thee a strange god, And thou bowest not thyself to a strange god.
content_old: 9 There is not in thee a strange god, And thou bowest not thyself to a strange god.

content: 10 I am Jehovah thy God, Who bringeth thee up out of the land of Egypt. Enlarge thy mouth, and I fill it.
content_old: 10 I am Jehovah thy God, Who bringeth thee up out of the land of Egypt. Enlarge thy mouth, and I fill it.

content: 11 But, My people hearkened not to My voice, And Israel hath not consented to Me.
content_old: 11 But, My people hearkened not to My voice, And Israel hath not consented to Me.

content: 12 And I send them away in the enmity of their heart, They walk in their own counsels.
content_old: 12 And I send them away in the enmity of their heart, They walk in their own counsels.

content: 13 O that My people were hearkening to Me, Israel in My ways would walk.
content_old: 13 O that My people were hearkening to Me, Israel in My ways would walk.

content: 14 As a little thing their enemies I cause to bow, And against their adversaries I turn back My hand,
content_old: 14 As a little thing their enemies I cause to bow, And against their adversaries I turn back My hand,

content: 15 Those hating Jehovah feign obedience to Him, But their time is—to the age.
content_old: 15 Those hating Jehovah feign obedience to Him, But their time is—to the age.

content: 1 —A Psalm of Asaph. God hath stood in the company of God, In the midst God doth judge.
content_old: 1 —A Psalm of Asaph. God hath stood in the company of God, In the midst God doth judge.

content: 2 Till when do ye judge perversely? And the face of the wicked lift up? Selah.
content_old: 2 Till when do ye judge perversely? And the face of the wicked lift up? Selah.

content: 3 Judge ye the weak and fatherless, The afflicted and the poor declare righteous.
content_old: 3 Judge ye the weak and fatherless, The afflicted and the poor declare righteous.

content: 4 Let the weak and needy escape, From the hand of the wicked deliver them.
content_old: 4 Let the weak and needy escape, From the hand of the wicked deliver them.

content: 5 They knew not, nor do they understand, In darkness they walk habitually, Moved are all the foundations of earth.
content_old: 5 They knew not, nor do they understand, In darkness they walk habitually, Moved are all the foundations of earth.

content: 6 I—I have said, ‘Gods ye are, And sons of the Most High—all of you,
content_old: 6 I—I have said, ‘Gods ye are, And sons of the Most High—all of you,

content: 7 But as man ye die, and as one of the heads ye fall,
content_old: 7 But as man ye die, and as one of the heads ye fall,

content: 1 A Song,—A Psalm of Asaph. O God, let there be no silence to Thee, Be not silent, nor be quiet, O God.
content_old: 1 A Song,—A Psalm of Asaph. O God, let there be no silence to Thee, Be not silent, nor be quiet, O God.

content: 2 For, lo, Thine enemies do roar, And those hating Thee have lifted up the head,
content_old: 2 For, lo, Thine enemies do roar, And those hating Thee have lifted up the head,

content: 3 Against Thy people they take crafty counsel, And consult against Thy hidden ones.
content_old: 3 Against Thy people they take crafty counsel, And consult against Thy hidden ones.

content: 4 They have said, ‘Come, And we cut them off from being a nation, And the name of Israel is not remembered any more.’
content_old: 4 They have said, ‘Come, And we cut them off from being a nation, And the name of Israel is not remembered any more.’

content: 5 For they consulted in heart together, Against Thee a covenant they make,
content_old: 5 For they consulted in heart together, Against Thee a covenant they make,

content: 6 Tents of Edom, and Ishmaelites, Moab, and the Hagarenes,
content_old: 6 Tents of Edom, and Ishmaelites, Moab, and the Hagarenes,

content: 7 Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with inhabitants of Tyre,
content_old: 7 Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with inhabitants of Tyre,

content: 8 Asshur also is joined with them, They have been an arm to sons of Lot. Selah.
content_old: 8 Asshur also is joined with them, They have been an arm to sons of Lot. Selah.

content: 9 Do to them as to Midian, As to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the stream Kishon.
content_old: 9 Do to them as to Midian, As to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the stream Kishon.

content: 10 They were destroyed at Endor, They were dung for the ground!
content_old: 10 They were destroyed at Endor, They were dung for the ground!

content: 11 Make their nobles as Oreb and as Zeeb, And as Zebah and Zalmunna all their princes,
content_old: 11 Make their nobles as Oreb and as Zeeb, And as Zebah and Zalmunna all their princes,

content: 12 Who have said, ‘Let us occupy for ourselves The comely places of God.’
content_old: 12 Who have said, ‘Let us occupy for ourselves The comely places of God.’

content: 13 O my God, make them as a rolling thing, As stubble before wind.
content_old: 13 O my God, make them as a rolling thing, As stubble before wind.

content: 14 As a fire doth burn a forest, And as a flame setteth hills on fire,
content_old: 14 As a fire doth burn a forest, And as a flame setteth hills on fire,

content: 15 So dost Thou pursue them with Thy whirlwind, And with Thy hurricane troublest them.
content_old: 15 So dost Thou pursue them with Thy whirlwind, And with Thy hurricane troublest them.

content: 16 Fill their faces with shame, And they seek Thy name, O Jehovah.
content_old: 16 Fill their faces with shame, And they seek Thy name, O Jehovah.

content: 17 They are ashamed and troubled for ever, Yea, they are confounded and lost.
content_old: 17 They are ashamed and troubled for ever, Yea, they are confounded and lost.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Gittith By sons of Korah.’—A Psalm. How beloved Thy tabernacles, Jehovah of Hosts!
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—‘On the Gittith By sons of Korah.’—A Psalm. How beloved Thy tabernacles, Jehovah of Hosts!

content: 2 My soul desired, yea, it hath also been consumed, For the courts of Jehovah, My heart and my flesh cry aloud unto the living God,
content_old: 2 My soul desired, yea, it hath also been consumed, For the courts of Jehovah, My heart and my flesh cry aloud unto the living God,

content: 3 (Even a sparrow hath found a house, And a swallow a nest for herself, Where she hath placed her brood,) Thine altars, O Jehovah of Hosts, My king and my God.
content_old: 3 (Even a sparrow hath found a house, And a swallow a nest for herself, Where she hath placed her brood,) Thine altars, O Jehovah of Hosts, My king and my God.

content: 4 O the happiness of those inhabiting Thy house, Yet do they praise Thee. Selah.
content_old: 4 O the happiness of those inhabiting Thy house, Yet do they praise Thee. Selah.

content: 5 O the happiness of a man whose strength is in Thee, Highways are in their heart.
content_old: 5 O the happiness of a man whose strength is in Thee, Highways are in their heart.

content: 6 Those passing through a valley of weeping, A fountain do make it, Blessings also cover the director.
content_old: 6 Those passing through a valley of weeping, A fountain do make it, Blessings also cover the director.

content: 7 They go from strength unto strength, He appeareth unto God in Zion.
content_old: 7 They go from strength unto strength, He appeareth unto God in Zion.

content: 8 O Jehovah, God of Hosts, hear my prayer, Give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 8 O Jehovah, God of Hosts, hear my prayer, Give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 9 Our shield, see, O God, And behold the face of Thine anointed,
content_old: 9 Our shield, see, O God, And behold the face of Thine anointed,

content: 10 For good is a day in Thy courts, O Teacher! I have chosen rather to be at the threshold, In the house of my God, Than to dwell in tents of wickedness.
content_old: 10 For good is a day in Thy courts, O Teacher! I have chosen rather to be at the threshold, In the house of my God, Than to dwell in tents of wickedness.

content: 11 For a sun and a shield is Jehovah God, Grace and honour doth Jehovah give. He withholdeth not good To those walking in uprightness.
content_old: 11 For a sun and a shield is Jehovah God, Grace and honour doth Jehovah give. He withholdeth not good To those walking in uprightness.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Thou hast accepted, O Jehovah, Thy land, Thou hast turned to the captivity of Jacob.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Thou hast accepted, O Jehovah, Thy land, Thou hast turned to the captivity of Jacob.

content: 2 Thou hast borne away the iniquity of Thy people, Thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
content_old: 2 Thou hast borne away the iniquity of Thy people, Thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

content: 3 Thou hast gathered up all Thy wrath, Thou hast turned back from the fierceness of Thine anger.
content_old: 3 Thou hast gathered up all Thy wrath, Thou hast turned back from the fierceness of Thine anger.

content: 4 Turn back to us, O God of our salvation, And make void Thine anger with us.
content_old: 4 Turn back to us, O God of our salvation, And make void Thine anger with us.

content: 5 To the age art Thou angry against us? Dost Thou draw out Thine anger To generation and generation?
content_old: 5 To the age art Thou angry against us? Dost Thou draw out Thine anger To generation and generation?

content: 6 Dost Thou not turn back? Thou revivest us, And Thy people do rejoice in Thee.
content_old: 6 Dost Thou not turn back? Thou revivest us, And Thy people do rejoice in Thee.

content: 7 Show us, O Jehovah, thy kindness, And Thy salvation Thou dost give to us.
content_old: 7 Show us, O Jehovah, thy kindness, And Thy salvation Thou dost give to us.

content: 8 I hear what God Jehovah speaketh, For He speaketh peace unto His people, And unto His saints, and they turn not back to folly.
content_old: 8 I hear what God Jehovah speaketh, For He speaketh peace unto His people, And unto His saints, and they turn not back to folly.

content: 9 Only, near to those fearing Him is His salvation, That honour may dwell in our land.
content_old: 9 Only, near to those fearing Him is His salvation, That honour may dwell in our land.

content: 10 Kindness and truth have met, Righteousness and peace have kissed,
content_old: 10 Kindness and truth have met, Righteousness and peace have kissed,

content: 11 Truth from the earth springeth up, And righteousness from heaven looketh out,
content_old: 11 Truth from the earth springeth up, And righteousness from heaven looketh out,

content: 12 Jehovah also giveth that which is good, And our land doth give its increase.
content_old: 12 Jehovah also giveth that which is good, And our land doth give its increase.

content: 1 A Prayer of David. Incline, O Jehovah, Thine ear, Answer me, for I am poor and needy.
content_old: 1 A Prayer of David. Incline, O Jehovah, Thine ear, Answer me, for I am poor and needy.

content: 2 Keep my soul, for I am pious, Save Thy servant—who is trusting to Thee, O Thou, my God.
content_old: 2 Keep my soul, for I am pious, Save Thy servant—who is trusting to Thee, O Thou, my God.

content: 3 Favour me, O Lord, for to Thee I call all the day.
content_old: 3 Favour me, O Lord, for to Thee I call all the day.

content: 4 Rejoice the soul of Thy servant, For unto Thee, O Lord, my soul I lift up.
content_old: 4 Rejoice the soul of Thy servant, For unto Thee, O Lord, my soul I lift up.

content: 5 For Thou, Lord, art good and forgiving. And abundant in kindness to all calling Thee.
content_old: 5 For Thou, Lord, art good and forgiving. And abundant in kindness to all calling Thee.

content: 6 Hear, O Jehovah, my prayer, And attend to the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 Hear, O Jehovah, my prayer, And attend to the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 In a day of my distress I call Thee, For Thou dost answer me.
content_old: 7 In a day of my distress I call Thee, For Thou dost answer me.

content: 8 There is none like Thee among the gods, O Lord, And like Thy works there are none.
content_old: 8 There is none like Thee among the gods, O Lord, And like Thy works there are none.

content: 9 All nations that Thou hast made Come and bow themselves before Thee, O Lord, And give honour to Thy name.
content_old: 9 All nations that Thou hast made Come and bow themselves before Thee, O Lord, And give honour to Thy name.

content: 10 For great art Thou, and doing wonders, Thou art God Thyself alone.
content_old: 10 For great art Thou, and doing wonders, Thou art God Thyself alone.

content: 11 Show me, O Jehovah, Thy way, I walk in Thy truth, My heart doth rejoice to fear Thy name.
content_old: 11 Show me, O Jehovah, Thy way, I walk in Thy truth, My heart doth rejoice to fear Thy name.

content: 12 I confess Thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And I honour Thy name to the age.
content_old: 12 I confess Thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And I honour Thy name to the age.

content: 13 For Thy kindness is great toward me, And Thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.
content_old: 13 For Thy kindness is great toward me, And Thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.

content: 14 O God, the proud have risen up against me, And a company of the terrible sought my soul, And have not placed Thee before them,
content_old: 14 O God, the proud have risen up against me, And a company of the terrible sought my soul, And have not placed Thee before them,

content: 15 And Thou, O Lord, art God, merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abundant in kindness and truth.
content_old: 15 And Thou, O Lord, art God, merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abundant in kindness and truth.

content: 16 Look unto me, and favour me, Give Thy strength to Thy servant, And give salvation to a son of Thine handmaid.
content_old: 16 Look unto me, and favour me, Give Thy strength to Thy servant, And give salvation to a son of Thine handmaid.

content: 1 By sons of Korah.—A Psalm, a song. His foundation is in holy mountains.
content_old: 1 By sons of Korah.—A Psalm, a song. His foundation is in holy mountains.

content: 2 Jehovah is loving the gates of Zion Above all the tabernacles of Jacob.
content_old: 2 Jehovah is loving the gates of Zion Above all the tabernacles of Jacob.

content: 3 Honourable things are spoken in Thee, O city of God. Selah.
content_old: 3 Honourable things are spoken in Thee, O city of God. Selah.

content: 4 I mention Rahab and Babel to those knowing Me, Lo, Philistia, and Tyre, with Cush! This one was born there.
content_old: 4 I mention Rahab and Babel to those knowing Me, Lo, Philistia, and Tyre, with Cush! This one was born there.

content: 5 And of Zion it is said: Each one was born in her, And He, the Most High, doth establish her.
content_old: 5 And of Zion it is said: Each one was born in her, And He, the Most High, doth establish her.

content: 6 Jehovah doth recount in the describing of the peoples, ‘This one was born there.’ Selah.
content_old: 6 Jehovah doth recount in the describing of the peoples, ‘This one was born there.’ Selah.

content: 1 A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah, to the Overseer, ‘Concerning the Sickness of Afflictions.’—An instruction, by Heman the Ezrahite. O Jehovah, God of my salvation, Daily I have cried, nightly before Thee,
content_old: 1 A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah, to the Overseer, ‘Concerning the Sickness of Afflictions.’—An instruction, by Heman the Ezrahite. O Jehovah, God of my salvation, Daily I have cried, nightly before Thee,

content: 2 My prayer cometh in before Thee, Incline Thine ear to my loud cry,
content_old: 2 My prayer cometh in before Thee, Incline Thine ear to my loud cry,

content: 3 For my soul hath been full of evils, And my life hath come to Sheol.
content_old: 3 For my soul hath been full of evils, And my life hath come to Sheol.

content: 4 I have been reckoned with those going down to the pit, I have been as a man without strength.
content_old: 4 I have been reckoned with those going down to the pit, I have been as a man without strength.

content: 5 Among the dead—free, As pierced ones lying in the grave, Whom Thou hast not remembered any more, Yea, they by Thy hand have been cut off.
content_old: 5 Among the dead—free, As pierced ones lying in the grave, Whom Thou hast not remembered any more, Yea, they by Thy hand have been cut off.

content: 6 Thou hast put me in the lowest pit, In dark places, in depths.
content_old: 6 Thou hast put me in the lowest pit, In dark places, in depths.

content: 7 Upon me hath Thy fury lain, And with all Thy breakers Thou hast afflicted. Selah.
content_old: 7 Upon me hath Thy fury lain, And with all Thy breakers Thou hast afflicted. Selah.

content: 8 Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me, Thou hast made me an abomination to them, Shut up—I go not forth.
content_old: 8 Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me, Thou hast made me an abomination to them, Shut up—I go not forth.

content: 9 Mine eye hath grieved because of affliction, I called Thee, O Jehovah, all the day, I have spread out unto Thee my hands.
content_old: 9 Mine eye hath grieved because of affliction, I called Thee, O Jehovah, all the day, I have spread out unto Thee my hands.

content: 10 To the dead dost Thou do wonders? Do Rephaim rise? do they thank Thee? Selah.
content_old: 10 To the dead dost Thou do wonders? Do Rephaim rise? do they thank Thee? Selah.

content: 11 Is Thy kindness recounted in the grave? Thy faithfulness in destruction?
content_old: 11 Is Thy kindness recounted in the grave? Thy faithfulness in destruction?

content: 12 Are Thy wonders known in the darkness? And Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
content_old: 12 Are Thy wonders known in the darkness? And Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

content: 13 And I, unto Thee, O Jehovah, I have cried, And in the morning doth my prayer come before Thee.
content_old: 13 And I, unto Thee, O Jehovah, I have cried, And in the morning doth my prayer come before Thee.

content: 14 Why, O Jehovah, castest Thou off my soul? Thou hidest Thy face from me.
content_old: 14 Why, O Jehovah, castest Thou off my soul? Thou hidest Thy face from me.

content: 15 I am afflicted, and expiring from youth, I have borne Thy terrors—I pine away.
content_old: 15 I am afflicted, and expiring from youth, I have borne Thy terrors—I pine away.

content: 16 Over me hath Thy wrath passed, Thy terrors have cut me off,
content_old: 16 Over me hath Thy wrath passed, Thy terrors have cut me off,

content: 17 They have surrounded me as waters all the day, They have gone round against me together,
content_old: 17 They have surrounded me as waters all the day, They have gone round against me together,

content: 1 An instruction, by Ethan the Ezrahite. Of the kind acts of Jehovah, to the age I sing, To all generations I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth,
content_old: 1 An instruction, by Ethan the Ezrahite. Of the kind acts of Jehovah, to the age I sing, To all generations I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth,

content: 2 For I said, ‘To the age is kindness built, The heavens! Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness in them.’
content_old: 2 For I said, ‘To the age is kindness built, The heavens! Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness in them.’

content: 3 I have made a covenant for My chosen, I have sworn to David My servant:
content_old: 3 I have made a covenant for My chosen, I have sworn to David My servant:

content: 4 ‘Even to the age do I establish thy seed, And have built to generation and generation thy throne. Selah.
content_old: 4 ‘Even to the age do I establish thy seed, And have built to generation and generation thy throne. Selah.

content: 5 And the heavens confess Thy wonders, O Jehovah, Thy faithfulness also is in an assembly of holy ones.
content_old: 5 And the heavens confess Thy wonders, O Jehovah, Thy faithfulness also is in an assembly of holy ones.

content: 6 For who in the sky, Compareth himself to Jehovah? Is like to Jehovah among sons of the mighty?
content_old: 6 For who in the sky, Compareth himself to Jehovah? Is like to Jehovah among sons of the mighty?

content: 7 God is very terrible, In the secret counsel of His holy ones, And fearful over all surrounding Him.
content_old: 7 God is very terrible, In the secret counsel of His holy ones, And fearful over all surrounding Him.

content: 8 O Jehovah, God of Hosts, Who is like Thee—a strong Jah? And Thy faithfulness is round about Thee.
content_old: 8 O Jehovah, God of Hosts, Who is like Thee—a strong Jah? And Thy faithfulness is round about Thee.

content: 9 Thou art ruler over the pride of the sea, In the lifting up of its billows Thou dost restrain them.
content_old: 9 Thou art ruler over the pride of the sea, In the lifting up of its billows Thou dost restrain them.

content: 10 Thou hast bruised Rahab, as one wounded. With the arm of Thy strength Thou hast scattered Thine enemies.
content_old: 10 Thou hast bruised Rahab, as one wounded. With the arm of Thy strength Thou hast scattered Thine enemies.

content: 11 Thine are the heavens—the earth also is Thine, The habitable world and its fulness, Thou hast founded them.
content_old: 11 Thine are the heavens—the earth also is Thine, The habitable world and its fulness, Thou hast founded them.

content: 12 North and south Thou hast appointed them, Tabor and Hermon in Thy name do sing.
content_old: 12 North and south Thou hast appointed them, Tabor and Hermon in Thy name do sing.

content: 13 Thou hast an arm with might, Strong is Thy hand—high Thy right hand.
content_old: 13 Thou hast an arm with might, Strong is Thy hand—high Thy right hand.

content: 14 Righteousness and judgment Are the fixed place of Thy throne, Kindness and truth go before Thy face.
content_old: 14 Righteousness and judgment Are the fixed place of Thy throne, Kindness and truth go before Thy face.

content: 15 O the happiness of the people knowing the shout, O Jehovah, in the light of Thy face they walk habitually.
content_old: 15 O the happiness of the people knowing the shout, O Jehovah, in the light of Thy face they walk habitually.

content: 16 In Thy name they rejoice all the day, And in Thy righteousness they are exalted,
content_old: 16 In Thy name they rejoice all the day, And in Thy righteousness they are exalted,

content: 17 For the beauty of their strength art Thou, And in Thy good will is our horn exalted,
content_old: 17 For the beauty of their strength art Thou, And in Thy good will is our horn exalted,

content: 18 For of Jehovah is our shield, And of the Holy One of Israel our king.
content_old: 18 For of Jehovah is our shield, And of the Holy One of Israel our king.

content: 19 Then Thou hast spoken in vision, To Thy saint, yea, Thou sayest, I have placed help upon a mighty one, Exalted a chosen one out of the people,
content_old: 19 Then Thou hast spoken in vision, To Thy saint, yea, Thou sayest, I have placed help upon a mighty one, Exalted a chosen one out of the people,

content: 20 I have found David My servant, With My holy oil I have anointed him.
content_old: 20 I have found David My servant, With My holy oil I have anointed him.

content: 21 With whom My hand is established, My arm also doth strengthen him.
content_old: 21 With whom My hand is established, My arm also doth strengthen him.

content: 22 An enemy exacteth not upon him, And a son of perverseness afflicteth him not.
content_old: 22 An enemy exacteth not upon him, And a son of perverseness afflicteth him not.

content: 23 And I have beaten down before him his adversaries, And those hating him I plague,
content_old: 23 And I have beaten down before him his adversaries, And those hating him I plague,

content: 24 And My faithfulness and kindness are with him, And in My name is his horn exalted.
content_old: 24 And My faithfulness and kindness are with him, And in My name is his horn exalted.

content: 25 And I have set on the sea his hand, And on the rivers his right hand.
content_old: 25 And I have set on the sea his hand, And on the rivers his right hand.

content: 26 He proclaimeth me: ‘Thou art my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation.’
content_old: 26 He proclaimeth me: ‘Thou art my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation.’

content: 27 I also first-born do appoint him, Highest of the kings of the earth.
content_old: 27 I also first-born do appoint him, Highest of the kings of the earth.

content: 28 To the age I keep for him My kindness, And My covenant is stedfast with him.
content_old: 28 To the age I keep for him My kindness, And My covenant is stedfast with him.

content: 29 And I have set his seed for ever, And his throne as the days of the heavens.
content_old: 29 And I have set his seed for ever, And his throne as the days of the heavens.

content: 30 If his sons forsake My law, And in My judgments do not walk;
content_old: 30 If his sons forsake My law, And in My judgments do not walk;

content: 31 If My statutes they pollute, And My commands do not keep,
content_old: 31 If My statutes they pollute, And My commands do not keep,

content: 32 I have looked after with a rod their transgression, And with strokes their iniquity,
content_old: 32 I have looked after with a rod their transgression, And with strokes their iniquity,

content: 33 And My kindness I break not from him, Nor do I deal falsely in My faithfulness.
content_old: 33 And My kindness I break not from him, Nor do I deal falsely in My faithfulness.

content: 34 I profane not My covenant, And that which is going forth from My lips I change not.
content_old: 34 I profane not My covenant, And that which is going forth from My lips I change not.

content: 35 Once I have sworn by My holiness, I lie not to David,
content_old: 35 Once I have sworn by My holiness, I lie not to David,

content: 36 His seed is to the age, And his throne is as the sun before Me,
content_old: 36 His seed is to the age, And his throne is as the sun before Me,

content: 37 As the moon it is established—to the age, And the witness in the sky is stedfast. Selah.
content_old: 37 As the moon it is established—to the age, And the witness in the sky is stedfast. Selah.

content: 38 And Thou, Thou hast cast off, and dost reject, Thou hast shown Thyself wroth With Thine anointed,
content_old: 38 And Thou, Thou hast cast off, and dost reject, Thou hast shown Thyself wroth With Thine anointed,

content: 39 Hast rejected the covenant of Thy servant, Thou hast polluted to the earth his crown,
content_old: 39 Hast rejected the covenant of Thy servant, Thou hast polluted to the earth his crown,

content: 40 Thou hast broken down all his hedges, Thou hast made his fenced places a ruin.
content_old: 40 Thou hast broken down all his hedges, Thou hast made his fenced places a ruin.

content: 41 Spoiled him have all passing by the way, He hath been a reproach to his neighbours,
content_old: 41 Spoiled him have all passing by the way, He hath been a reproach to his neighbours,

content: 42 Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries, Thou hast caused all his enemies to rejoice.
content_old: 42 Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries, Thou hast caused all his enemies to rejoice.

content: 43 Also—Thou turnest back the sharpness of his sword, And hast not established him in battle,
content_old: 43 Also—Thou turnest back the sharpness of his sword, And hast not established him in battle,

content: 44 Hast caused him to cease from his brightness, And his throne to the earth hast cast down.
content_old: 44 Hast caused him to cease from his brightness, And his throne to the earth hast cast down.

content: 45 Thou hast shortened the days of his youth, Hast covered him over with shame. Selah.
content_old: 45 Thou hast shortened the days of his youth, Hast covered him over with shame. Selah.

content: 46 Till when, O Jehovah, art Thou hidden? For ever doth Thy fury burn as fire?
content_old: 46 Till when, O Jehovah, art Thou hidden? For ever doth Thy fury burn as fire?

content: 47 Remember, I pray Thee, what is life-time? Wherefore in vain hast Thou created All the sons of men?
content_old: 47 Remember, I pray Thee, what is life-time? Wherefore in vain hast Thou created All the sons of men?

content: 48 Who is the man that liveth, and doth not see death? He delivereth his soul from the hand of Sheol. Selah.
content_old: 48 Who is the man that liveth, and doth not see death? He delivereth his soul from the hand of Sheol. Selah.

content: 49 Where are Thy former kindnesses, O Lord. Thou hast sworn to David in Thy faithfulness,
content_old: 49 Where are Thy former kindnesses, O Lord. Thou hast sworn to David in Thy faithfulness,

content: 50 Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Thy servants, I have borne in my bosom all the strivings of the peoples,
content_old: 50 Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Thy servants, I have borne in my bosom all the strivings of the peoples,

content: 51 Wherewith Thine enemies reproached, O Jehovah, Wherewith they have reproached The steps of Thine anointed.
content_old: 51 Wherewith Thine enemies reproached, O Jehovah, Wherewith they have reproached The steps of Thine anointed.

content: 1 A Prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, a habitation Thou—Thou hast been, To us—in generation and generation,
content_old: 1 A Prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, a habitation Thou—Thou hast been, To us—in generation and generation,

content: 2 Before mountains were brought forth, And Thou dost form the earth and the world, Even from age unto age Thou art God.
content_old: 2 Before mountains were brought forth, And Thou dost form the earth and the world, Even from age unto age Thou art God.

content: 3 Thou turnest man unto a bruised thing, And sayest, Turn back, ye sons of men.
content_old: 3 Thou turnest man unto a bruised thing, And sayest, Turn back, ye sons of men.

content: 4 For a thousand years in Thine eyes are as yesterday, For it passeth on, yea, a watch by night.
content_old: 4 For a thousand years in Thine eyes are as yesterday, For it passeth on, yea, a watch by night.

content: 5 Thou hast inundated them, they are asleep, In the morning as grass he changeth.
content_old: 5 Thou hast inundated them, they are asleep, In the morning as grass he changeth.

content: 6 In the morning it flourisheth, and hath changed, At evening it is cut down, and hath withered.
content_old: 6 In the morning it flourisheth, and hath changed, At evening it is cut down, and hath withered.

content: 7 For we were consumed in Thine anger, And in Thy fury we have been troubled.
content_old: 7 For we were consumed in Thine anger, And in Thy fury we have been troubled.

content: 8 Thou hast set our iniquities before Thee, Our hidden things at the light of Thy face,
content_old: 8 Thou hast set our iniquities before Thee, Our hidden things at the light of Thy face,

content: 9 For all our days pined away in Thy wrath, We consumed our years as a meditation.
content_old: 9 For all our days pined away in Thy wrath, We consumed our years as a meditation.

content: 10 Days of our years, in them are seventy years, And if, by reason of might, eighty years, Yet is their enlargement labour and vanity, For it hath been cut off hastily, and we fly away.
content_old: 10 Days of our years, in them are seventy years, And if, by reason of might, eighty years, Yet is their enlargement labour and vanity, For it hath been cut off hastily, and we fly away.

content: 11 Who knoweth the power of Thine anger? And according to Thy fear—Thy wrath?
content_old: 11 Who knoweth the power of Thine anger? And according to Thy fear—Thy wrath?

content: 12 To number our days aright let us know, And we bring the heart to wisdom.
content_old: 12 To number our days aright let us know, And we bring the heart to wisdom.

content: 13 Turn back, O Jehovah, till when? And repent concerning Thy servants.
content_old: 13 Turn back, O Jehovah, till when? And repent concerning Thy servants.

content: 14 Satisfy us at morn with Thy kindness, And we sing and rejoice all our days.
content_old: 14 Satisfy us at morn with Thy kindness, And we sing and rejoice all our days.

content: 15 Cause us to rejoice according to the days Wherein Thou hast afflicted us, The years we have seen evil.
content_old: 15 Cause us to rejoice according to the days Wherein Thou hast afflicted us, The years we have seen evil.

content: 16 Let Thy work appear unto Thy servants, And Thine honour on their sons.
content_old: 16 Let Thy work appear unto Thy servants, And Thine honour on their sons.

content: 1 He who is dwelling In the secret place of the Most High, In the shade of the Mighty lodgeth habitually,
content_old: 1 He who is dwelling In the secret place of the Most High, In the shade of the Mighty lodgeth habitually,

content: 2 He is saying of Jehovah, ‘My refuge, and my bulwark, my God, I trust in Him,’
content_old: 2 He is saying of Jehovah, ‘My refuge, and my bulwark, my God, I trust in Him,’

content: 3 For He delivereth thee from the snare of a fowler, From a calamitous pestilence.
content_old: 3 For He delivereth thee from the snare of a fowler, From a calamitous pestilence.

content: 4 With His pinion He covereth thee over, And under His wings thou dost trust, A shield and buckler is His truth.
content_old: 4 With His pinion He covereth thee over, And under His wings thou dost trust, A shield and buckler is His truth.

content: 5 Thou art not afraid of fear by night, Of arrow that flieth by day,
content_old: 5 Thou art not afraid of fear by night, Of arrow that flieth by day,

content: 6 Of pestilence in thick darkness that walketh, Of destruction that destroyeth at noon,
content_old: 6 Of pestilence in thick darkness that walketh, Of destruction that destroyeth at noon,

content: 7 There fall at thy side a thousand, And a myriad at thy right hand, Unto thee it cometh not nigh.
content_old: 7 There fall at thy side a thousand, And a myriad at thy right hand, Unto thee it cometh not nigh.

content: 8 But with thine eyes thou lookest, And the reward of the wicked thou seest,
content_old: 8 But with thine eyes thou lookest, And the reward of the wicked thou seest,

content: 9 (For Thou, O Jehovah, art my refuge,) The Most High thou madest thy habitation.
content_old: 9 (For Thou, O Jehovah, art my refuge,) The Most High thou madest thy habitation.

content: 10 Evil happeneth not unto thee, And a plague cometh not near thy tent,
content_old: 10 Evil happeneth not unto thee, And a plague cometh not near thy tent,

content: 11 For His messengers He chargeth for thee, To keep thee in all thy ways,
content_old: 11 For His messengers He chargeth for thee, To keep thee in all thy ways,

content: 12 On the hands they bear thee up, Lest thou smite against a stone thy foot.
content_old: 12 On the hands they bear thee up, Lest thou smite against a stone thy foot.

content: 13 On lion and asp thou treadest, Thou trampest young lion and dragon.
content_old: 13 On lion and asp thou treadest, Thou trampest young lion and dragon.

content: 14 Because in Me he hath delighted, I also deliver him—I set him on high, Because he hath known My name.
content_old: 14 Because in Me he hath delighted, I also deliver him—I set him on high, Because he hath known My name.

content: 15 He doth call Me, and I answer him, I am with him in distress, I deliver him, and honour him.
content_old: 15 He doth call Me, and I answer him, I am with him in distress, I deliver him, and honour him.

content: 1 A Psalm.—A Song for the sabbath-day. Good to give thanks to Jehovah, And to sing praises to Thy name, O Most High,
content_old: 1 A Psalm.—A Song for the sabbath-day. Good to give thanks to Jehovah, And to sing praises to Thy name, O Most High,

content: 2 To declare in the morning Thy kindness, And Thy faithfulness in the nights.
content_old: 2 To declare in the morning Thy kindness, And Thy faithfulness in the nights.

content: 3 On ten strings and on psaltery, On higgaion, with harp.
content_old: 3 On ten strings and on psaltery, On higgaion, with harp.

content: 4 For Thou hast caused me to rejoice, O Jehovah, in Thy work, Concerning the works of Thy hands I sing.
content_old: 4 For Thou hast caused me to rejoice, O Jehovah, in Thy work, Concerning the works of Thy hands I sing.

content: 5 How great have been Thy works, O Jehovah, Very deep have been Thy thoughts.
content_old: 5 How great have been Thy works, O Jehovah, Very deep have been Thy thoughts.

content: 6 A brutish man doth not know, And a fool understandeth not this;—
content_old: 6 A brutish man doth not know, And a fool understandeth not this;—

content: 7 When the wicked flourish as a herb, And blossom do all workers of iniquity—For their being destroyed for ever and ever!
content_old: 7 When the wicked flourish as a herb, And blossom do all workers of iniquity—For their being destroyed for ever and ever!

content: 8 And Thou art high to the age, O Jehovah.
content_old: 8 And Thou art high to the age, O Jehovah.

content: 9 For, lo, Thine enemies, O Jehovah, For, lo, Thine enemies, do perish, Separate themselves do all workers of iniquity.
content_old: 9 For, lo, Thine enemies, O Jehovah, For, lo, Thine enemies, do perish, Separate themselves do all workers of iniquity.

content: 10 And Thou exaltest as a reem my horn, I have been anointed with fresh oil.
content_old: 10 And Thou exaltest as a reem my horn, I have been anointed with fresh oil.

content: 11 And mine eye looketh on mine enemies, Of those rising up against me, The evil doers, do mine ears hear.
content_old: 11 And mine eye looketh on mine enemies, Of those rising up against me, The evil doers, do mine ears hear.

content: 12 The righteous as a palm-tree flourisheth, As a cedar in Lebanon he groweth.
content_old: 12 The righteous as a palm-tree flourisheth, As a cedar in Lebanon he groweth.

content: 13 Those planted in the house of Jehovah, In the courts of our God do flourish.
content_old: 13 Those planted in the house of Jehovah, In the courts of our God do flourish.

content: 14 Still they bring forth in old age, Fat and flourishing are they,
content_old: 14 Still they bring forth in old age, Fat and flourishing are they,

content: 1 Jehovah hath reigned, Excellency He hath put on, Jehovah put on strength, He girded Himself, Also—established is the world, unmoved.
content_old: 1 Jehovah hath reigned, Excellency He hath put on, Jehovah put on strength, He girded Himself, Also—established is the world, unmoved.

content: 2 Established is Thy throne since then, From the age Thou art.
content_old: 2 Established is Thy throne since then, From the age Thou art.

content: 3 Floods have lifted up, O Jehovah, Floods have lifted up their voice, Floods lift up their breakers.
content_old: 3 Floods have lifted up, O Jehovah, Floods have lifted up their voice, Floods lift up their breakers.

content: 4 Than the voices of many mighty waters, Breakers of a sea, mighty on high is Jehovah,
content_old: 4 Than the voices of many mighty waters, Breakers of a sea, mighty on high is Jehovah,

content: 1 God of vengeance—Jehovah! God of vengeance, shine forth.
content_old: 1 God of vengeance—Jehovah! God of vengeance, shine forth.

content: 2 Be lifted up, O Judge of the earth, Send back a recompence on the proud.
content_old: 2 Be lifted up, O Judge of the earth, Send back a recompence on the proud.

content: 3 Till when do the wicked, O Jehovah? Till when do the wicked exult?
content_old: 3 Till when do the wicked, O Jehovah? Till when do the wicked exult?

content: 4 They utter—they speak an old saw, All working iniquity do boast themselves.
content_old: 4 They utter—they speak an old saw, All working iniquity do boast themselves.

content: 5 Thy people, O Jehovah, they bruise, And Thine inheritance they afflict.
content_old: 5 Thy people, O Jehovah, they bruise, And Thine inheritance they afflict.

content: 6 Widow and sojourner they slay, And fatherless ones they murder.
content_old: 6 Widow and sojourner they slay, And fatherless ones they murder.

content: 7 And they say, ‘Jehovah doth not see, And the God of Jacob doth not consider.’
content_old: 7 And they say, ‘Jehovah doth not see, And the God of Jacob doth not consider.’

content: 8 Consider, ye brutish among the people, And ye foolish, when do ye act wisely?
content_old: 8 Consider, ye brutish among the people, And ye foolish, when do ye act wisely?

content: 9 He who planteth the ear doth He not hear? He who formeth the eye doth He not see?
content_old: 9 He who planteth the ear doth He not hear? He who formeth the eye doth He not see?

content: 10 He who is instructing nations, Doth He not reprove? He who is teaching man knowledge is Jehovah.
content_old: 10 He who is instructing nations, Doth He not reprove? He who is teaching man knowledge is Jehovah.

content: 11 He knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
content_old: 11 He knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

content: 12 O the happiness of the man Whom Thou instructest, O Jah, And out of Thy law teachest him,
content_old: 12 O the happiness of the man Whom Thou instructest, O Jah, And out of Thy law teachest him,

content: 13 To give rest to him from days of evil, While a pit is digged for the wicked.
content_old: 13 To give rest to him from days of evil, While a pit is digged for the wicked.

content: 14 For Jehovah leaveth not His people, And His inheritance forsaketh not.
content_old: 14 For Jehovah leaveth not His people, And His inheritance forsaketh not.

content: 15 For to righteousness judgment turneth back, And after it all the upright of heart,
content_old: 15 For to righteousness judgment turneth back, And after it all the upright of heart,

content: 16 Who riseth up for me with evil doers? Who stationeth himself for me with workers of iniquity?
content_old: 16 Who riseth up for me with evil doers? Who stationeth himself for me with workers of iniquity?

content: 17 Unless Jehovah were a help to me, My soul had almost inhabited silence.
content_old: 17 Unless Jehovah were a help to me, My soul had almost inhabited silence.

content: 18 If I have said, ‘My foot hath slipped,’ Thy kindness, O Jehovah, supporteth me.
content_old: 18 If I have said, ‘My foot hath slipped,’ Thy kindness, O Jehovah, supporteth me.

content: 19 In the abundance of my thoughts within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.
content_old: 19 In the abundance of my thoughts within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.

content: 20 Is a throne of mischief joined with Thee? A framer of perverseness by statute?
content_old: 20 Is a throne of mischief joined with Thee? A framer of perverseness by statute?

content: 21 They decree against the soul of the righteous, And innocent blood declare wicked.
content_old: 21 They decree against the soul of the righteous, And innocent blood declare wicked.

content: 22 And Jehovah is for a high place to me, And my God is for a rock—my refuge,
content_old: 22 And Jehovah is for a high place to me, And my God is for a rock—my refuge,

content: 1 Come, we sing to Jehovah, We shout to the rock of our salvation.
content_old: 1 Come, we sing to Jehovah, We shout to the rock of our salvation.

content: 2 We come before His face with thanksgiving, With psalms we shout to Him.
content_old: 2 We come before His face with thanksgiving, With psalms we shout to Him.

content: 3 For a great God is Jehovah, And a great king over all gods.
content_old: 3 For a great God is Jehovah, And a great king over all gods.

content: 4 In whose hand are the deep places of earth, And the strong places of hills are His.
content_old: 4 In whose hand are the deep places of earth, And the strong places of hills are His.

content: 5 Whose is the sea, and He made it, And His hands formed the dry land.
content_old: 5 Whose is the sea, and He made it, And His hands formed the dry land.

content: 6 Come in, we bow ourselves, and we bend, We kneel before Jehovah our Maker.
content_old: 6 Come in, we bow ourselves, and we bend, We kneel before Jehovah our Maker.

content: 7 For He is our God, and we the people of His pasture, And the flock of His hand, To-day, if to His voice ye hearken,
content_old: 7 For He is our God, and we the people of His pasture, And the flock of His hand, To-day, if to His voice ye hearken,

content: 8 Harden not your heart as in Meribah, As in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
content_old: 8 Harden not your heart as in Meribah, As in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

content: 9 Where your fathers have tried Me, Have proved Me, yea, have seen My work.
content_old: 9 Where your fathers have tried Me, Have proved Me, yea, have seen My work.

content: 10 Forty years I am weary of the generation, And I say, ‘A people erring in heart—they! And they have not known My ways:’
content_old: 10 Forty years I am weary of the generation, And I say, ‘A people erring in heart—they! And they have not known My ways:’

content: 1 Sing to Jehovah a new song, Sing to Jehovah all the earth.
content_old: 1 Sing to Jehovah a new song, Sing to Jehovah all the earth.

content: 2 Sing to Jehovah, bless His name, Proclaim from day to day His salvation.
content_old: 2 Sing to Jehovah, bless His name, Proclaim from day to day His salvation.

content: 3 Declare among nations His honour, Among all the peoples His wonders.
content_old: 3 Declare among nations His honour, Among all the peoples His wonders.

content: 4 For great is Jehovah, and praised greatly, Fearful He is over all gods.
content_old: 4 For great is Jehovah, and praised greatly, Fearful He is over all gods.

content: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are nought, And Jehovah made the heavens.
content_old: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are nought, And Jehovah made the heavens.

content: 6 Honour and majesty are before Him, Strength and beauty in His sanctuary.
content_old: 6 Honour and majesty are before Him, Strength and beauty in His sanctuary.

content: 7 Ascribe to Jehovah, O families of the peoples, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.
content_old: 7 Ascribe to Jehovah, O families of the peoples, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.

content: 8 Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Lift up a present and come in to His courts.
content_old: 8 Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Lift up a present and come in to His courts.

content: 9 Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the honour of holiness, Be afraid of His presence, all the earth.
content_old: 9 Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the honour of holiness, Be afraid of His presence, all the earth.

content: 10 Say among nations, ‘Jehovah hath reigned, Also—established is the world, unmoved, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.’
content_old: 10 Say among nations, ‘Jehovah hath reigned, Also—established is the world, unmoved, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.’

content: 11 The heavens joy, and the earth is joyful, The sea and its fulness roar.
content_old: 11 The heavens joy, and the earth is joyful, The sea and its fulness roar.

content: 12 The field exulteth, and all that is in it, Then sing do all trees of the forest,
content_old: 12 The field exulteth, and all that is in it, Then sing do all trees of the forest,

content: 1 Jehovah hath reigned, The earth is joyful, many isles rejoice.
content_old: 1 Jehovah hath reigned, The earth is joyful, many isles rejoice.

content: 2 Cloud and darkness are round about Him, Righteousness and judgment the basis of His throne.
content_old: 2 Cloud and darkness are round about Him, Righteousness and judgment the basis of His throne.

content: 3 Fire before Him goeth, And burneth round about His adversaries.
content_old: 3 Fire before Him goeth, And burneth round about His adversaries.

content: 4 Lightened have His lightnings the world, The earth hath seen, and is pained.
content_old: 4 Lightened have His lightnings the world, The earth hath seen, and is pained.

content: 5 Hills, like wax, melted before Jehovah, Before the Lord of all the earth.
content_old: 5 Hills, like wax, melted before Jehovah, Before the Lord of all the earth.

content: 6 The heavens declared His righteousness, And all the peoples have seen His honour.
content_old: 6 The heavens declared His righteousness, And all the peoples have seen His honour.

content: 7 Ashamed are all servants of a graven image, Those boasting themselves in idols, Bow yourselves to him, all ye gods.
content_old: 7 Ashamed are all servants of a graven image, Those boasting themselves in idols, Bow yourselves to him, all ye gods.

content: 8 Zion hath heard and rejoiceth, And daughters of Judah are joyful, Because of Thy judgments, O Jehovah.
content_old: 8 Zion hath heard and rejoiceth, And daughters of Judah are joyful, Because of Thy judgments, O Jehovah.

content: 9 For Thou, Jehovah, art Most High over all the earth, Greatly Thou hast been exalted over all gods.
content_old: 9 For Thou, Jehovah, art Most High over all the earth, Greatly Thou hast been exalted over all gods.

content: 10 Ye who love Jehovah, hate evil, He is keeping the souls of His saints, From the hand of the wicked he delivereth them.
content_old: 10 Ye who love Jehovah, hate evil, He is keeping the souls of His saints, From the hand of the wicked he delivereth them.

content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, And for the upright of heart—joy.
content_old: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, And for the upright of heart—joy.

content: 1 A Psalm. Sing ye to Jehovah a new song, For wonders He hath done, Given salvation to Him hath His right hand and His holy arm.
content_old: 1 A Psalm. Sing ye to Jehovah a new song, For wonders He hath done, Given salvation to Him hath His right hand and His holy arm.

content: 2 Jehovah hath made known His salvation, Before the eyes of the nations, He hath revealed His righteousness,
content_old: 2 Jehovah hath made known His salvation, Before the eyes of the nations, He hath revealed His righteousness,

content: 3 He hath remembered His kindness, And His faithfulness to the house of Israel, All ends of earth have seen the salvation of our God.
content_old: 3 He hath remembered His kindness, And His faithfulness to the house of Israel, All ends of earth have seen the salvation of our God.

content: 4 Shout to Jehovah, all the earth, Break forth, and cry aloud, and sing.
content_old: 4 Shout to Jehovah, all the earth, Break forth, and cry aloud, and sing.

content: 5 Sing to Jehovah with harp, With harp, and voice of praise,
content_old: 5 Sing to Jehovah with harp, With harp, and voice of praise,

content: 6 With trumpets, and voice of a cornet, Shout ye before the king Jehovah.
content_old: 6 With trumpets, and voice of a cornet, Shout ye before the king Jehovah.

content: 7 Roar doth the sea and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.
content_old: 7 Roar doth the sea and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.

content: 8 Floods clap hand, together hills cry aloud,
content_old: 8 Floods clap hand, together hills cry aloud,

content: 1 Jehovah hath reigned, peoples tremble, The Inhabitant of the cherubs, the earth shaketh.
content_old: 1 Jehovah hath reigned, peoples tremble, The Inhabitant of the cherubs, the earth shaketh.

content: 2 Jehovah in Zion is great, And high He is over all the peoples.
content_old: 2 Jehovah in Zion is great, And high He is over all the peoples.

content: 3 They praise Thy name, ‘Great, and fearful, holy it is.’
content_old: 3 They praise Thy name, ‘Great, and fearful, holy it is.’

content: 4 And the strength of the king Hath loved judgment, Thou—Thou hast established uprightness; Judgment and righteousness in Jacob, Thou—Thou hast done.
content_old: 4 And the strength of the king Hath loved judgment, Thou—Thou hast established uprightness; Judgment and righteousness in Jacob, Thou—Thou hast done.

content: 5 Exalt ye Jehovah our God, And bow yourselves at His footstool, holy is He.
content_old: 5 Exalt ye Jehovah our God, And bow yourselves at His footstool, holy is He.

content: 6 Moses and Aaron among His priests, And Samuel among those proclaiming His name. They are calling unto Jehovah, And He doth answer them.
content_old: 6 Moses and Aaron among His priests, And Samuel among those proclaiming His name. They are calling unto Jehovah, And He doth answer them.

content: 7 In a pillar of cloud He speaketh unto them, They have kept His testimonies, And the statute He hath given to them.
content_old: 7 In a pillar of cloud He speaketh unto them, They have kept His testimonies, And the statute He hath given to them.

content: 8 O Jehovah, our God, Thou hast afflicted them, A God forgiving Thou hast been to them, And taking vengeance on their actions.
content_old: 8 O Jehovah, our God, Thou hast afflicted them, A God forgiving Thou hast been to them, And taking vengeance on their actions.

content: 1 A Psalm of Thanksgiving. Shout to Jehovah, all the earth.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of Thanksgiving. Shout to Jehovah, all the earth.

content: 2 Serve Jehovah with joy, come before him with singing.
content_old: 2 Serve Jehovah with joy, come before him with singing.

content: 3 Know that Jehovah He is God, He made us, and we are His, His people—and the flock of His pasture.
content_old: 3 Know that Jehovah He is God, He made us, and we are His, His people—and the flock of His pasture.

content: 4 Enter ye His gates with thanksgiving, His courts with praise, Give ye thanks to Him, bless ye His Name.
content_old: 4 Enter ye His gates with thanksgiving, His courts with praise, Give ye thanks to Him, bless ye His Name.

content: 1 A Psalm of David. Kindness and judgment I sing, To Thee, O Jehovah, I sing praise.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David. Kindness and judgment I sing, To Thee, O Jehovah, I sing praise.

content: 2 I act wisely in a perfect way, When dost Thou come in unto me? I walk habitually in the integrity of my heart, In the midst of my house.
content_old: 2 I act wisely in a perfect way, When dost Thou come in unto me? I walk habitually in the integrity of my heart, In the midst of my house.

content: 3 I set not before mine eyes a worthless thing, The work of those turning aside I have hated, It adhereth not to me.
content_old: 3 I set not before mine eyes a worthless thing, The work of those turning aside I have hated, It adhereth not to me.

content: 4 A perverse heart turneth aside from me, Wickedness I know not.
content_old: 4 A perverse heart turneth aside from me, Wickedness I know not.

content: 5 Whoso slandereth in secret his neighbour, Him I cut off, The high of eyes and proud of heart, him I endure not.
content_old: 5 Whoso slandereth in secret his neighbour, Him I cut off, The high of eyes and proud of heart, him I endure not.

content: 6 Mine eyes are on the faithful of the land, To dwell with me, Whoso is walking in a perfect way, he serveth me.
content_old: 6 Mine eyes are on the faithful of the land, To dwell with me, Whoso is walking in a perfect way, he serveth me.

content: 7 He dwelleth not in my house who is working deceit, Whoso is speaking lies Is not established before mine eyes.
content_old: 7 He dwelleth not in my house who is working deceit, Whoso is speaking lies Is not established before mine eyes.

content: 1 A Prayer of the afflicted when he is feeble, and before Jehovah poureth out his plaint. O Jehovah, hear my prayer, yea, my cry to Thee cometh.
content_old: 1 A Prayer of the afflicted when he is feeble, and before Jehovah poureth out his plaint. O Jehovah, hear my prayer, yea, my cry to Thee cometh.

content: 2 Hide not Thou Thy face from me, In a day of mine adversity, Incline unto me Thine ear, In the day I call, haste, answer me.
content_old: 2 Hide not Thou Thy face from me, In a day of mine adversity, Incline unto me Thine ear, In the day I call, haste, answer me.

content: 3 For consumed in smoke have been my days, And my bones as a fire-brand have burned.
content_old: 3 For consumed in smoke have been my days, And my bones as a fire-brand have burned.

content: 4 Smitten as the herb, and withered, is my heart, For I have forgotten to eat my bread.
content_old: 4 Smitten as the herb, and withered, is my heart, For I have forgotten to eat my bread.

content: 5 From the voice of my sighing Hath my bone cleaved to my flesh.
content_old: 5 From the voice of my sighing Hath my bone cleaved to my flesh.

content: 6 I have been like to a pelican of the wilderness, I have been as an owl of the dry places.
content_old: 6 I have been like to a pelican of the wilderness, I have been as an owl of the dry places.

content: 7 I have watched, and I am As a bird alone on the roof.
content_old: 7 I have watched, and I am As a bird alone on the roof.

content: 8 All the day mine enemies reproached me, Those mad at me have sworn against me.
content_old: 8 All the day mine enemies reproached me, Those mad at me have sworn against me.

content: 9 Because ashes as bread I have eaten, And my drink with weeping have mingled,
content_old: 9 Because ashes as bread I have eaten, And my drink with weeping have mingled,

content: 10 From Thine indignation and Thy wrath, For Thou hast lifted me up, And dost cast me down.
content_old: 10 From Thine indignation and Thy wrath, For Thou hast lifted me up, And dost cast me down.

content: 11 My days as a shadow are stretched out, And I—as the herb I am withered.
content_old: 11 My days as a shadow are stretched out, And I—as the herb I am withered.

content: 12 And Thou, O Jehovah, to the age abidest, And Thy memorial to all generations.
content_old: 12 And Thou, O Jehovah, to the age abidest, And Thy memorial to all generations.

content: 13 Thou—Thou risest—Thou pitiest Zion, For the time to favour her, For the appointed time hath come.
content_old: 13 Thou—Thou risest—Thou pitiest Zion, For the time to favour her, For the appointed time hath come.

content: 14 For Thy servants have been pleased with her stones, And her dust they favour.
content_old: 14 For Thy servants have been pleased with her stones, And her dust they favour.

content: 15 And nations fear the name of Jehovah, And all kings of the earth Thine honour,
content_old: 15 And nations fear the name of Jehovah, And all kings of the earth Thine honour,

content: 16 For Jehovah hath builded Zion, He hath been seen in His honour,
content_old: 16 For Jehovah hath builded Zion, He hath been seen in His honour,
