content: 91 According to Thine ordinances They have stood this day, for the whole are Thy servants.
content_old: 91 According to Thine ordinances They have stood this day, for the whole are Thy servants.

content: 92 Unless Thy law were my delights, Then had I perished in mine affliction.
content_old: 92 Unless Thy law were my delights, Then had I perished in mine affliction.

content: 93 To the age I forget not Thy precepts, For by them Thou hast quickened me.
content_old: 93 To the age I forget not Thy precepts, For by them Thou hast quickened me.

content: 94 I am Thine, save Thou me, For Thy precepts I have sought.
content_old: 94 I am Thine, save Thou me, For Thy precepts I have sought.

content: 95 Thy wicked waited for me to destroy me, Thy testimonies I understand.
content_old: 95 Thy wicked waited for me to destroy me, Thy testimonies I understand.

content: 96 Of all perfection I have seen an end, Broad is Thy command—exceedingly!
content_old: 96 Of all perfection I have seen an end, Broad is Thy command—exceedingly!

content: 97 Mem. O how I have loved Thy law! All the day it is my meditation.
content_old: 97 Mem. O how I have loved Thy law! All the day it is my meditation.

content: 98 Than mine enemies Thy command maketh me wiser, For it is before me to the age.
content_old: 98 Than mine enemies Thy command maketh me wiser, For it is before me to the age.

content: 99 Above all my teachers I have acted wisely. For Thy testimonies are my meditation.
content_old: 99 Above all my teachers I have acted wisely. For Thy testimonies are my meditation.

content: 100 Above elders I understand more, For Thy precepts I have kept.
content_old: 100 Above elders I understand more, For Thy precepts I have kept.

content: 101 From every evil path I restrained my feet, So that I keep Thy word.
content_old: 101 From every evil path I restrained my feet, So that I keep Thy word.

content: 102 From Thy judgments I turned not aside, For Thou—Thou hast directed me.
content_old: 102 From Thy judgments I turned not aside, For Thou—Thou hast directed me.

content: 103 How sweet to my palate hath been Thy saying, Above honey to my mouth.
content_old: 103 How sweet to my palate hath been Thy saying, Above honey to my mouth.

content: 104 From Thy precepts I have understanding, Therefore I have hated every false path!
content_old: 104 From Thy precepts I have understanding, Therefore I have hated every false path!

content: 105 Nun. A lamp to my foot is Thy word, And a light to my path.
content_old: 105 Nun. A lamp to my foot is Thy word, And a light to my path.

content: 106 I have sworn, and I confirm it, To keep the judgments of Thy righteousness.
content_old: 106 I have sworn, and I confirm it, To keep the judgments of Thy righteousness.

content: 107 I have been afflicted very much, O Jehovah, quicken me, according to Thy word.
content_old: 107 I have been afflicted very much, O Jehovah, quicken me, according to Thy word.

content: 108 Free-will-offerings of my mouth, Accept, I pray Thee, O Jehovah, And Thy judgments teach Thou me.
content_old: 108 Free-will-offerings of my mouth, Accept, I pray Thee, O Jehovah, And Thy judgments teach Thou me.

content: 109 My soul is in my hand continually, And Thy law I have not forgotten.
content_old: 109 My soul is in my hand continually, And Thy law I have not forgotten.

content: 110 The wicked have laid a snare for me, And from thy precepts I wandered not.
content_old: 110 The wicked have laid a snare for me, And from thy precepts I wandered not.

content: 111 I have inherited Thy testimonies to the age, For the joy of my heart are they.
content_old: 111 I have inherited Thy testimonies to the age, For the joy of my heart are they.

content: 112 I have inclined my heart To do Thy statutes, to the age—to the end!
content_old: 112 I have inclined my heart To do Thy statutes, to the age—to the end!

content: 113 Samech. Doubting ones I have hated, And Thy law I have loved.
content_old: 113 Samech. Doubting ones I have hated, And Thy law I have loved.

content: 114 My hiding place and my shield art Thou, For Thy word I have hoped.
content_old: 114 My hiding place and my shield art Thou, For Thy word I have hoped.

content: 115 Turn aside from me, ye evil-doers, And I keep the commands of my God.
content_old: 115 Turn aside from me, ye evil-doers, And I keep the commands of my God.

content: 116 Sustain me according to Thy saying, And I live, and Thou puttest me not to shame Because of my hope.
content_old: 116 Sustain me according to Thy saying, And I live, and Thou puttest me not to shame Because of my hope.

content: 117 Support Thou me, and I am saved, And I look on Thy statutes continually.
content_old: 117 Support Thou me, and I am saved, And I look on Thy statutes continually.

content: 118 Thou hast trodden down All going astray from Thy statutes, For falsehood is their deceit.
content_old: 118 Thou hast trodden down All going astray from Thy statutes, For falsehood is their deceit.

content: 119 Dross! Thou hast caused to cease All the wicked of the earth; Therefore I have loved Thy testimonies.
content_old: 119 Dross! Thou hast caused to cease All the wicked of the earth; Therefore I have loved Thy testimonies.

content: 120 Trembled from Thy fear hath my flesh, And from Thy judgments I have been afraid!
content_old: 120 Trembled from Thy fear hath my flesh, And from Thy judgments I have been afraid!

content: 121 Ain. I have done judgment and righteousness, Leave me not to mine oppressors.
content_old: 121 Ain. I have done judgment and righteousness, Leave me not to mine oppressors.

content: 122 Make sure Thy servant for good, Let not the proud oppress me.
content_old: 122 Make sure Thy servant for good, Let not the proud oppress me.

content: 123 Mine eyes have been consumed for Thy salvation. And for the saying of Thy righteousness.
content_old: 123 Mine eyes have been consumed for Thy salvation. And for the saying of Thy righteousness.

content: 124 Do with Thy servant according to Thy kindness. And Thy statutes teach Thou me.
content_old: 124 Do with Thy servant according to Thy kindness. And Thy statutes teach Thou me.

content: 125 Thy servant am I—cause me to understand, And I know Thy testimonies.
content_old: 125 Thy servant am I—cause me to understand, And I know Thy testimonies.

content: 126 Time for Jehovah to work! they have made void Thy law.
content_old: 126 Time for Jehovah to work! they have made void Thy law.

content: 127 Therefore I have loved Thy commands Above gold—even fine gold.
content_old: 127 Therefore I have loved Thy commands Above gold—even fine gold.

content: 128 Therefore all my appointments I have declared wholly right, Every path of falsehood I have hated!
content_old: 128 Therefore all my appointments I have declared wholly right, Every path of falsehood I have hated!

content: 129 Pe. Wonderful are Thy testimonies, Therefore hath my soul kept them.
content_old: 129 Pe. Wonderful are Thy testimonies, Therefore hath my soul kept them.

content: 130 The opening of Thy words enlighteneth, Instructing the simple.
content_old: 130 The opening of Thy words enlighteneth, Instructing the simple.

content: 131 My mouth I have opened, yea, I pant, For, for Thy commands I have longed.
content_old: 131 My mouth I have opened, yea, I pant, For, for Thy commands I have longed.

content: 132 Look unto me, and favour me, As customary to those loving Thy name.
content_old: 132 Look unto me, and favour me, As customary to those loving Thy name.

content: 133 My steps establish by Thy saying, And any iniquity doth not rule over me.
content_old: 133 My steps establish by Thy saying, And any iniquity doth not rule over me.

content: 134 Ransom me from the oppression of man, And I observe Thy precepts,
content_old: 134 Ransom me from the oppression of man, And I observe Thy precepts,

content: 135 Thy face cause to shine on Thy servant, And teach me Thy statutes.
content_old: 135 Thy face cause to shine on Thy servant, And teach me Thy statutes.

content: 136 Rivulets of waters have come down mine eyes, Because they have not kept Thy law!
content_old: 136 Rivulets of waters have come down mine eyes, Because they have not kept Thy law!

content: 137 Tzade. Righteous art Thou, O Jehovah, And upright are Thy judgments.
content_old: 137 Tzade. Righteous art Thou, O Jehovah, And upright are Thy judgments.

content: 138 Thou hast appointed Thy testimonies, Righteous and exceeding faithful,
content_old: 138 Thou hast appointed Thy testimonies, Righteous and exceeding faithful,

content: 139 Cut me off hath my zeal, For mine adversaries forgot Thy words.
content_old: 139 Cut me off hath my zeal, For mine adversaries forgot Thy words.

content: 140 Tried is thy saying exceedingly, And Thy servant hath loved it.
content_old: 140 Tried is thy saying exceedingly, And Thy servant hath loved it.

content: 141 Small I am, and despised, Thy precepts I have not forgotten.
content_old: 141 Small I am, and despised, Thy precepts I have not forgotten.

content: 142 Thy righteousness is righteousness to the age, And Thy law is truth.
content_old: 142 Thy righteousness is righteousness to the age, And Thy law is truth.

content: 143 Adversity and distress have found me, Thy commands are my delights.
content_old: 143 Adversity and distress have found me, Thy commands are my delights.

content: 144 The righteousness of Thy testimonies is to Cause me to understand, and I live!
content_old: 144 The righteousness of Thy testimonies is to Cause me to understand, and I live!

content: 145 Koph. I have called with the whole heart, Answer me, O Jehovah, Thy statutes I keep,
content_old: 145 Koph. I have called with the whole heart, Answer me, O Jehovah, Thy statutes I keep,

content: 146 I have called Thee, save Thou me, And I do keep Thy testimonies.
content_old: 146 I have called Thee, save Thou me, And I do keep Thy testimonies.

content: 147 I have gone forward in the dawn, and I cry, For Thy word I have hoped.
content_old: 147 I have gone forward in the dawn, and I cry, For Thy word I have hoped.

content: 148 Mine eyes have gone before the watches, To meditate in Thy saying.
content_old: 148 Mine eyes have gone before the watches, To meditate in Thy saying.

content: 149 My voice hear, according to Thy kindness, Jehovah, according to Thy judgment quicken me.
content_old: 149 My voice hear, according to Thy kindness, Jehovah, according to Thy judgment quicken me.

content: 150 Near have been my wicked pursuers, From Thy law they have been far off.
content_old: 150 Near have been my wicked pursuers, From Thy law they have been far off.

content: 151 Near art Thou, O Jehovah, And all Thy commands are truth.
content_old: 151 Near art Thou, O Jehovah, And all Thy commands are truth.

content: 152 Of old I have known Thy testimonies, That to the age Thou hast founded them!
content_old: 152 Of old I have known Thy testimonies, That to the age Thou hast founded them!

content: 153 Resh. See my affliction, and deliver Thou me, For Thy law I have not forgotten.
content_old: 153 Resh. See my affliction, and deliver Thou me, For Thy law I have not forgotten.

content: 154 Plead my plea, and redeem me, According to Thy saying quicken me.
content_old: 154 Plead my plea, and redeem me, According to Thy saying quicken me.

content: 155 Far from the wicked is salvation, For Thy statutes they have not sought.
content_old: 155 Far from the wicked is salvation, For Thy statutes they have not sought.

content: 156 Thy mercies are many, O Jehovah, According to Thy judgments quicken me.
content_old: 156 Thy mercies are many, O Jehovah, According to Thy judgments quicken me.

content: 157 Many are my pursuers, and adversaries, From Thy testimonies I have not turned aside.
content_old: 157 Many are my pursuers, and adversaries, From Thy testimonies I have not turned aside.

content: 158 I have seen treacherous ones, And grieve myself, Because Thy saying they have not kept.
content_old: 158 I have seen treacherous ones, And grieve myself, Because Thy saying they have not kept.

content: 159 See, for thy precepts I have loved, Jehovah, According to Thy kindness quicken me.
content_old: 159 See, for thy precepts I have loved, Jehovah, According to Thy kindness quicken me.

content: 160 The sum of Thy word is truth, And to the age is every judgment of Thy righteousness!
content_old: 160 The sum of Thy word is truth, And to the age is every judgment of Thy righteousness!

content: 161 Shin. Princes have pursued me without cause, And because of Thy words was my heart afraid.
content_old: 161 Shin. Princes have pursued me without cause, And because of Thy words was my heart afraid.

content: 162 I do rejoice concerning Thy saying, As one finding abundant spoil.
content_old: 162 I do rejoice concerning Thy saying, As one finding abundant spoil.

content: 163 Falsehood I have hated, yea I abominate it, Thy law I have loved.
content_old: 163 Falsehood I have hated, yea I abominate it, Thy law I have loved.

content: 164 Seven times in a day I have praised Thee, Because of the judgments of Thy righteousness.
content_old: 164 Seven times in a day I have praised Thee, Because of the judgments of Thy righteousness.

content: 165 Abundant peace have those loving Thy law, And they have no stumbling-block.
content_old: 165 Abundant peace have those loving Thy law, And they have no stumbling-block.

content: 166 I have waited for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy commands I have done.
content_old: 166 I have waited for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy commands I have done.

content: 167 Kept hath my soul Thy testimonies, And I do love them exceedingly.
content_old: 167 Kept hath my soul Thy testimonies, And I do love them exceedingly.

content: 168 I have kept Thy precepts and Thy testimonies, For all my ways are before Thee!
content_old: 168 I have kept Thy precepts and Thy testimonies, For all my ways are before Thee!

content: 169 Taw. My loud cry cometh near before Thee, O Jehovah; According to Thy word cause me to understand.
content_old: 169 Taw. My loud cry cometh near before Thee, O Jehovah; According to Thy word cause me to understand.

content: 170 My supplication cometh in before Thee, According to Thy saying deliver Thou me.
content_old: 170 My supplication cometh in before Thee, According to Thy saying deliver Thou me.

content: 171 My lips do utter praise, For Thou dost teach me Thy statutes.
content_old: 171 My lips do utter praise, For Thou dost teach me Thy statutes.

content: 172 My tongue doth sing of Thy saying, For all Thy commands are righteous.
content_old: 172 My tongue doth sing of Thy saying, For all Thy commands are righteous.

content: 173 Thy hand is for a help to me, For Thy commands I have chosen.
content_old: 173 Thy hand is for a help to me, For Thy commands I have chosen.

content: 174 I have longed for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy law is my delight.
content_old: 174 I have longed for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy law is my delight.

content: 175 My soul liveth, and it doth praise Thee, And Thy judgments do help me.
content_old: 175 My soul liveth, and it doth praise Thee, And Thy judgments do help me.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Unto Jehovah in my distress I have called, And He answereth me.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Unto Jehovah in my distress I have called, And He answereth me.

content: 2 O Jehovah, deliver my soul from a lying lip, From a deceitful tongue!
content_old: 2 O Jehovah, deliver my soul from a lying lip, From a deceitful tongue!

content: 3 What doth He give to thee? And what doth He add to thee? O deceitful tongue!
content_old: 3 What doth He give to thee? And what doth He add to thee? O deceitful tongue!

content: 4 Sharp arrows of a mighty one, with broom-coals.
content_old: 4 Sharp arrows of a mighty one, with broom-coals.

content: 5 Woe to me, for I have inhabited Mesech, I have dwelt with tents of Kedar.
content_old: 5 Woe to me, for I have inhabited Mesech, I have dwelt with tents of Kedar.

content: 6 Too much hath my soul dwelt with him who is hating peace.
content_old: 6 Too much hath my soul dwelt with him who is hating peace.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. I lift up mine eyes unto the hills, Whence doth my help come?
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. I lift up mine eyes unto the hills, Whence doth my help come?

content: 2 My help is from Jehovah, maker of heaven and earth,
content_old: 2 My help is from Jehovah, maker of heaven and earth,

content: 3 He suffereth not thy foot to be moved, Thy preserver slumbereth not.
content_old: 3 He suffereth not thy foot to be moved, Thy preserver slumbereth not.

content: 4 Lo, He slumbereth not, nor sleepeth, He who is preserving Israel.
content_old: 4 Lo, He slumbereth not, nor sleepeth, He who is preserving Israel.

content: 5 Jehovah is thy preserver, Jehovah is thy shade on thy right hand,
content_old: 5 Jehovah is thy preserver, Jehovah is thy shade on thy right hand,

content: 6 By day the sun doth not smite thee, Nor the moon by night.
content_old: 6 By day the sun doth not smite thee, Nor the moon by night.

content: 7 Jehovah preserveth thee from all evil, He doth preserve thy soul.
content_old: 7 Jehovah preserveth thee from all evil, He doth preserve thy soul.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. I have rejoiced in those saying to me, ‘To the house of Jehovah we go.’
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. I have rejoiced in those saying to me, ‘To the house of Jehovah we go.’

content: 2 Our feet have been standing in thy gates, O Jerusalem!
content_old: 2 Our feet have been standing in thy gates, O Jerusalem!

content: 3 Jerusalem—the builded one—Is as a city that is joined to itself together.
content_old: 3 Jerusalem—the builded one—Is as a city that is joined to itself together.

content: 4 For thither have tribes gone up, Tribes of Jah, companies of Israel, To give thanks to the name of Jehovah.
content_old: 4 For thither have tribes gone up, Tribes of Jah, companies of Israel, To give thanks to the name of Jehovah.

content: 5 For there have sat thrones of judgment, Thrones of the house of David.
content_old: 5 For there have sat thrones of judgment, Thrones of the house of David.

content: 6 Ask ye the peace of Jerusalem, At rest are those loving thee.
content_old: 6 Ask ye the peace of Jerusalem, At rest are those loving thee.

content: 7 Peace is in thy bulwark, rest in thy high places,
content_old: 7 Peace is in thy bulwark, rest in thy high places,

content: 8 For the sake of my brethren and my companions, Let me speak, I pray thee, ‘Peace be in thee.’
content_old: 8 For the sake of my brethren and my companions, Let me speak, I pray thee, ‘Peace be in thee.’

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Unto Thee I have lifted up mine eyes, O dweller in the heavens.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Unto Thee I have lifted up mine eyes, O dweller in the heavens.

content: 2 Lo, as eyes of men-servants Are unto the hand of their masters, As eyes of a maid-servant Are unto the hand of her mistress, So are our eyes unto Jehovah our God, Till that He doth favour us.
content_old: 2 Lo, as eyes of men-servants Are unto the hand of their masters, As eyes of a maid-servant Are unto the hand of her mistress, So are our eyes unto Jehovah our God, Till that He doth favour us.

content: 3 Favour us, O Jehovah, favour us, For greatly have we been filled with contempt,
content_old: 3 Favour us, O Jehovah, favour us, For greatly have we been filled with contempt,

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. Save for Jehovah—who hath been for us, (Pray, let Israel say),
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. Save for Jehovah—who hath been for us, (Pray, let Israel say),

content: 2 Save for Jehovah—who hath been for us, In the rising up of man against us,
content_old: 2 Save for Jehovah—who hath been for us, In the rising up of man against us,

content: 3 Then alive they had swallowed us up, In the burning of their anger against us,
content_old: 3 Then alive they had swallowed us up, In the burning of their anger against us,

content: 4 Then the waters had overflowed us, The stream passed over our soul,
content_old: 4 Then the waters had overflowed us, The stream passed over our soul,

content: 5 Then passed over our soul had the proud waters.
content_old: 5 Then passed over our soul had the proud waters.

content: 6 Blessed is Jehovah who hath not given us, A prey to their teeth.
content_old: 6 Blessed is Jehovah who hath not given us, A prey to their teeth.

content: 7 Our soul as a bird hath escaped from a snare of fowlers, The snare was broken, and we have escaped.
content_old: 7 Our soul as a bird hath escaped from a snare of fowlers, The snare was broken, and we have escaped.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Those trusting in Jehovah are as Mount Zion, It is not moved—to the age it abideth.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Those trusting in Jehovah are as Mount Zion, It is not moved—to the age it abideth.

content: 2 Jerusalem! mountains are round about her, And Jehovah is round about His people, From henceforth even unto the age.
content_old: 2 Jerusalem! mountains are round about her, And Jehovah is round about His people, From henceforth even unto the age.

content: 3 For the rod of wickedness resteth not On the lot of the righteous, That the righteous put not forth on iniquity their hands.
content_old: 3 For the rod of wickedness resteth not On the lot of the righteous, That the righteous put not forth on iniquity their hands.

content: 4 Do good, O Jehovah, to the good, And to the upright in their hearts.
content_old: 4 Do good, O Jehovah, to the good, And to the upright in their hearts.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. In Jehovah’s turning back to the captivity of Zion, We have been as dreamers.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. In Jehovah’s turning back to the captivity of Zion, We have been as dreamers.

content: 2 Then filled with laughter is our mouth, And our tongue with singing, Then do they say among nations, ‘Jehovah did great things with these.’
content_old: 2 Then filled with laughter is our mouth, And our tongue with singing, Then do they say among nations, ‘Jehovah did great things with these.’

content: 3 Jehovah did great things with us, We have been joyful.
content_old: 3 Jehovah did great things with us, We have been joyful.

content: 4 Turn again, O Jehovah, to our captivity, As streams in the south.
content_old: 4 Turn again, O Jehovah, to our captivity, As streams in the south.

content: 5 Those sowing in tears, with singing do reap,
content_old: 5 Those sowing in tears, with singing do reap,

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by Solomon. If Jehovah doth not build the house, In vain have its builders laboured at it, If Jehovah doth not watch a city, In vain hath a watchman waked.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by Solomon. If Jehovah doth not build the house, In vain have its builders laboured at it, If Jehovah doth not watch a city, In vain hath a watchman waked.

content: 2 Vain for you who are rising early, Who delay sitting, eating the bread of griefs, So He giveth to His beloved one sleep.
content_old: 2 Vain for you who are rising early, Who delay sitting, eating the bread of griefs, So He giveth to His beloved one sleep.

content: 3 Lo, an inheritance of Jehovah are sons, A reward is the fruit of the womb.
content_old: 3 Lo, an inheritance of Jehovah are sons, A reward is the fruit of the womb.

content: 4 As arrows in the hand of a mighty one, So are the sons of the young men.
content_old: 4 As arrows in the hand of a mighty one, So are the sons of the young men.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. O the happiness of every one fearing Jehovah, Who is walking in His ways.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. O the happiness of every one fearing Jehovah, Who is walking in His ways.

content: 2 The labour of thy hands thou surely eatest, Happy art thou, and good is to thee.
content_old: 2 The labour of thy hands thou surely eatest, Happy art thou, and good is to thee.

content: 3 Thy wife is as a fruitful vine in the sides of thy house, Thy sons as olive plants around thy table.
content_old: 3 Thy wife is as a fruitful vine in the sides of thy house, Thy sons as olive plants around thy table.

content: 4 Lo, surely thus is the man blessed who is fearing Jehovah.
content_old: 4 Lo, surely thus is the man blessed who is fearing Jehovah.

content: 5 Jehovah doth bless thee out of Zion, Look, then, on the good of Jerusalem, All the days of thy life,
content_old: 5 Jehovah doth bless thee out of Zion, Look, then, on the good of Jerusalem, All the days of thy life,

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Often they distressed me from my youth, Pray, let Israel say:
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Often they distressed me from my youth, Pray, let Israel say:

content: 2 Often they distressed me from my youth, Yet they have not prevailed over me.
content_old: 2 Often they distressed me from my youth, Yet they have not prevailed over me.

content: 3 Over my back have ploughers ploughed, They have made long their furrows.
content_old: 3 Over my back have ploughers ploughed, They have made long their furrows.

content: 4 Jehovah is righteous, He hath cut asunder cords of the wicked.
content_old: 4 Jehovah is righteous, He hath cut asunder cords of the wicked.

content: 5 Confounded and turn backward do all hating Zion.
content_old: 5 Confounded and turn backward do all hating Zion.

content: 6 They are as grass of the roofs, That before it was drawn out withereth,
content_old: 6 They are as grass of the roofs, That before it was drawn out withereth,

content: 7 That hath not filled the hand of a reaper, And the bosom of a binder of sheaves.
content_old: 7 That hath not filled the hand of a reaper, And the bosom of a binder of sheaves.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. From depths I have called Thee, Jehovah.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. From depths I have called Thee, Jehovah.

content: 2 Lord, hearken to my voice, Thine ears are attentive to the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 2 Lord, hearken to my voice, Thine ears are attentive to the voice of my supplications.

content: 3 If iniquities Thou dost observe, O Lord, who doth stand?
content_old: 3 If iniquities Thou dost observe, O Lord, who doth stand?

content: 4 But with Thee is forgiveness, that Thou mayest be feared.
content_old: 4 But with Thee is forgiveness, that Thou mayest be feared.

content: 5 I hoped for Jehovah—hoped hath my soul, And for His word I have waited.
content_old: 5 I hoped for Jehovah—hoped hath my soul, And for His word I have waited.

content: 6 My soul is for the Lord, More than those watching for morning, Watching for morning!
content_old: 6 My soul is for the Lord, More than those watching for morning, Watching for morning!

content: 7 Israel doth wait on Jehovah, For with Jehovah is kindness, And abundant with Him is redemption.
content_old: 7 Israel doth wait on Jehovah, For with Jehovah is kindness, And abundant with Him is redemption.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. Jehovah, my heart hath not been haughty, Nor have mine eyes been high, Nor have I walked in great things, And in things too wonderful for me.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. Jehovah, my heart hath not been haughty, Nor have mine eyes been high, Nor have I walked in great things, And in things too wonderful for me.

content: 2 Have I not compared, and kept silent my soul, As a weaned one by its mother? As a weaned one by me is my soul.
content_old: 2 Have I not compared, and kept silent my soul, As a weaned one by its mother? As a weaned one by me is my soul.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Remember, Jehovah, for David, all his afflictions.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Remember, Jehovah, for David, all his afflictions.

content: 2 Who hath sworn to Jehovah. He hath vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
content_old: 2 Who hath sworn to Jehovah. He hath vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

content: 3 ‘If I enter into the tent of my house, If I go up on the couch of my bed,
content_old: 3 ‘If I enter into the tent of my house, If I go up on the couch of my bed,

content: 4 If I give sleep to mine eyes, To mine eyelids—slumber,
content_old: 4 If I give sleep to mine eyes, To mine eyelids—slumber,

content: 5 Till I do find a place for Jehovah, Tabernacles for the Mighty One of Jacob.
content_old: 5 Till I do find a place for Jehovah, Tabernacles for the Mighty One of Jacob.

content: 6 ‘Lo, we have heard it in Ephratah, We have found it in the fields of the forest.
content_old: 6 ‘Lo, we have heard it in Ephratah, We have found it in the fields of the forest.

content: 7 We come in to His tabernacles, We bow ourselves at His footstool.
content_old: 7 We come in to His tabernacles, We bow ourselves at His footstool.

content: 8 Arise, O Jehovah, to Thy rest, Thou, and the ark of Thy strength,
content_old: 8 Arise, O Jehovah, to Thy rest, Thou, and the ark of Thy strength,

content: 9 Thy priests do put on righteousness, And Thy pious ones cry aloud.
content_old: 9 Thy priests do put on righteousness, And Thy pious ones cry aloud.

content: 10 For the sake of David Thy servant, Turn not back the face of Thine anointed.
content_old: 10 For the sake of David Thy servant, Turn not back the face of Thine anointed.

content: 11 Jehovah hath sworn truth to David, He turneth not back from it: Of the fruit of thy body, I set on the throne for thee.
content_old: 11 Jehovah hath sworn truth to David, He turneth not back from it: Of the fruit of thy body, I set on the throne for thee.

content: 12 If thy sons keep My covenant, And My testimonies that I teach them, Their sons also for ever and ever, Do sit on the throne for thee.
content_old: 12 If thy sons keep My covenant, And My testimonies that I teach them, Their sons also for ever and ever, Do sit on the throne for thee.

content: 13 For Jehovah hath fixed on Zion, He hath desired it for a seat to Himself,
content_old: 13 For Jehovah hath fixed on Zion, He hath desired it for a seat to Himself,

content: 14 This is My rest for ever and ever, Here do I sit, for I have desired it.
content_old: 14 This is My rest for ever and ever, Here do I sit, for I have desired it.

content: 15 Her provision I greatly bless, Her needy ones I satisfy with bread,
content_old: 15 Her provision I greatly bless, Her needy ones I satisfy with bread,

content: 16 And her priests I clothe with salvation, And her pious ones do sing aloud.
content_old: 16 And her priests I clothe with salvation, And her pious ones do sing aloud.

content: 17 There I cause to spring up a horn for David, I have arranged a lamp for Mine anointed.
content_old: 17 There I cause to spring up a horn for David, I have arranged a lamp for Mine anointed.

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. Lo, how good and how pleasant The dwelling of brethren—even together!
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents, by David. Lo, how good and how pleasant The dwelling of brethren—even together!

content: 2 As the good oil on the head, Coming down on the beard, the beard of Aaron, That cometh down on the skirt of his robes,
content_old: 2 As the good oil on the head, Coming down on the beard, the beard of Aaron, That cometh down on the skirt of his robes,

content: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Lo, bless Jehovah, all servants of Jehovah, Who are standing in the house of Jehovah by night.
content_old: 1 A Song of the Ascents. Lo, bless Jehovah, all servants of Jehovah, Who are standing in the house of Jehovah by night.

content: 2 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, And bless ye Jehovah.
content_old: 2 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, And bless ye Jehovah.

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise ye the name of Jehovah, Praise, ye servants of Jehovah,
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise ye the name of Jehovah, Praise, ye servants of Jehovah,

content: 2 Who are standing in the house of Jehovah, In the courts of the house of our God.
content_old: 2 Who are standing in the house of Jehovah, In the courts of the house of our God.

content: 3 Praise ye Jah! for Jehovah is good, Sing praise to His name, for it is pleasant.
content_old: 3 Praise ye Jah! for Jehovah is good, Sing praise to His name, for it is pleasant.

content: 4 For Jacob hath Jah chosen for Himself, Israel for His peculiar treasure.
content_old: 4 For Jacob hath Jah chosen for Himself, Israel for His peculiar treasure.

content: 5 For I have known that great is Jehovah, Yea, our Lord is above all gods.
content_old: 5 For I have known that great is Jehovah, Yea, our Lord is above all gods.

content: 6 All that Jehovah pleased He hath done, In the heavens and in earth, In the seas and all deep places,
content_old: 6 All that Jehovah pleased He hath done, In the heavens and in earth, In the seas and all deep places,

content: 7 Causing vapours to ascend from the end of the earth, Lightnings for the rain He hath made, Bringing forth wind from His treasures.
content_old: 7 Causing vapours to ascend from the end of the earth, Lightnings for the rain He hath made, Bringing forth wind from His treasures.

content: 8 Who smote the first-born of Egypt, From man unto beast.
content_old: 8 Who smote the first-born of Egypt, From man unto beast.

content: 9 He sent tokens and wonders into thy midst, O Egypt, On Pharaoh and on all his servants.
content_old: 9 He sent tokens and wonders into thy midst, O Egypt, On Pharaoh and on all his servants.

content: 10 Who smote many nations, and slew strong kings,
content_old: 10 Who smote many nations, and slew strong kings,

content: 11 Even Sihon king of the Amorite, And Og king of Bashan, And all kingdoms of Canaan.
content_old: 11 Even Sihon king of the Amorite, And Og king of Bashan, And all kingdoms of Canaan.

content: 12 And He gave their land an inheritance, An inheritance to Israel His people,
content_old: 12 And He gave their land an inheritance, An inheritance to Israel His people,

content: 13 O Jehovah, Thy name is to the age, O Jehovah, Thy memorial to all generations.
content_old: 13 O Jehovah, Thy name is to the age, O Jehovah, Thy memorial to all generations.

content: 14 For Jehovah doth judge His people, And for His servants comforteth Himself.
content_old: 14 For Jehovah doth judge His people, And for His servants comforteth Himself.

content: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, Work of the hands of man.
content_old: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, Work of the hands of man.

content: 16 A mouth they have, and they speak not, Eyes they have, and they see not,
content_old: 16 A mouth they have, and they speak not, Eyes they have, and they see not,

content: 17 Ears they have, and they give not ear, Nose—there is no breath in their mouth!
content_old: 17 Ears they have, and they give not ear, Nose—there is no breath in their mouth!

content: 18 Like them are their makers, Every one who is trusting in them.
content_old: 18 Like them are their makers, Every one who is trusting in them.

content: 19 O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah, O house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah,
content_old: 19 O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah, O house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah,

content: 20 O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah, Those fearing Jehovah, bless ye Jehovah.
content_old: 20 O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah, Those fearing Jehovah, bless ye Jehovah.

content: 1 Give ye thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 1 Give ye thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age is His kindness.

content: 2 Give ye thanks to the God of gods, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 2 Give ye thanks to the God of gods, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 3 Give ye thanks to the Lord of lords, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 3 Give ye thanks to the Lord of lords, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 4 To Him doing great wonders by Himself alone, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 4 To Him doing great wonders by Himself alone, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 5 To Him making the heavens by understanding, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 5 To Him making the heavens by understanding, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 6 To Him spreading the earth over the waters, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 6 To Him spreading the earth over the waters, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 7 To Him making great lights, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 7 To Him making great lights, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 8 The sun to rule by day, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 8 The sun to rule by day, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 9 The moon and stars to rule by night, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 9 The moon and stars to rule by night, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 10 To Him smiting Egypt in their first-born, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 10 To Him smiting Egypt in their first-born, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 11 And bringing forth Israel from their midst, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 11 And bringing forth Israel from their midst, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 12 By a strong hand, and a stretched-out-arm, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 12 By a strong hand, and a stretched-out-arm, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 13 To Him cutting the sea of Suph into parts, For to the age is His kindness,
content_old: 13 To Him cutting the sea of Suph into parts, For to the age is His kindness,

content: 14 And caused Israel to pass through its midst, For to the age is His kindness,
content_old: 14 And caused Israel to pass through its midst, For to the age is His kindness,

content: 15 And shook out Pharaoh and his force in the sea of Suph, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 15 And shook out Pharaoh and his force in the sea of Suph, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 16 To Him leading His people in a wilderness, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 16 To Him leading His people in a wilderness, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 17 To Him smiting great kings, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 17 To Him smiting great kings, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 18 Yea, He doth slay honourable kings, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 18 Yea, He doth slay honourable kings, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 19 Even Sihon king of the Amorite, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 19 Even Sihon king of the Amorite, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 20 And Og king of Bashan, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 20 And Og king of Bashan, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 21 And He gave their land for inheritance, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 21 And He gave their land for inheritance, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 22 An inheritance to Israel His servant, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 22 An inheritance to Israel His servant, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 23 Who in our lowliness hath remembered us, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 23 Who in our lowliness hath remembered us, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 24 And He delivereth us from our adversaries, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 24 And He delivereth us from our adversaries, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 25 Giving food to all flesh, For to the age is His kindness.
content_old: 25 Giving food to all flesh, For to the age is His kindness.

content: 1 By rivers of Babylon—There we did sit, Yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.
content_old: 1 By rivers of Babylon—There we did sit, Yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.

content: 2 On willows in its midst we hung our harps.
content_old: 2 On willows in its midst we hung our harps.

content: 3 For there our captors asked us the words of a song, And our spoilers—joy: ‘Sing ye to us of a song of Zion.’
content_old: 3 For there our captors asked us the words of a song, And our spoilers—joy: ‘Sing ye to us of a song of Zion.’

content: 4 How do we sing the song of Jehovah, On the land of a stranger?
content_old: 4 How do we sing the song of Jehovah, On the land of a stranger?

content: 5 If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, my right hand forgetteth!
content_old: 5 If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, my right hand forgetteth!

content: 6 My tongue doth cleave to my palate, If I do not remember thee, If I do not exalt Jerusalem above my chief joy.
content_old: 6 My tongue doth cleave to my palate, If I do not remember thee, If I do not exalt Jerusalem above my chief joy.

content: 7 Remember, Jehovah, for the sons of Edom, The day of Jerusalem, Those saying, ‘Rase, rase to its foundation!’
content_old: 7 Remember, Jehovah, for the sons of Edom, The day of Jerusalem, Those saying, ‘Rase, rase to its foundation!’

content: 8 O daughter of Babylon, O destroyed one, O the happiness of him who repayeth to thee thy deed, That thou hast done to us.
content_old: 8 O daughter of Babylon, O destroyed one, O the happiness of him who repayeth to thee thy deed, That thou hast done to us.

content: 1 By David. I confess Thee, with all my heart, Before the gods I do praise Thee.
content_old: 1 By David. I confess Thee, with all my heart, Before the gods I do praise Thee.

content: 2 I bow myself toward Thy holy temple, And I confess Thy name, For Thy kindness, and for Thy truth, For Thou hast made great Thy saying above all Thy name.
content_old: 2 I bow myself toward Thy holy temple, And I confess Thy name, For Thy kindness, and for Thy truth, For Thou hast made great Thy saying above all Thy name.

content: 3 In the day I called, when Thou dost answer me, Thou dost strengthen me in my soul with strength.
content_old: 3 In the day I called, when Thou dost answer me, Thou dost strengthen me in my soul with strength.

content: 4 O Jehovah, all kings of earth confess Thee, When they have heard the sayings of Thy mouth.
content_old: 4 O Jehovah, all kings of earth confess Thee, When they have heard the sayings of Thy mouth.

content: 5 And they sing in the ways of Jehovah, For great is the honour of Jehovah.
content_old: 5 And they sing in the ways of Jehovah, For great is the honour of Jehovah.

content: 6 For high is Jehovah, and the lowly He seeth, And the haughty from afar He knoweth.
content_old: 6 For high is Jehovah, and the lowly He seeth, And the haughty from afar He knoweth.

content: 7 If I walk in the midst of distress Thou quickenest me, Against the anger of mine enemies Thou sendest forth Thy hand, And Thy right hand doth save me.
content_old: 7 If I walk in the midst of distress Thou quickenest me, Against the anger of mine enemies Thou sendest forth Thy hand, And Thy right hand doth save me.

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm by David. Jehovah, Thou hast searched me, and knowest.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm by David. Jehovah, Thou hast searched me, and knowest.

content: 2 Thou—Thou hast known my sitting down, And my rising up, Thou hast attended to my thoughts from afar.
content_old: 2 Thou—Thou hast known my sitting down, And my rising up, Thou hast attended to my thoughts from afar.

content: 3 My path and my couch Thou hast fanned, And with all my ways hast been acquainted.
content_old: 3 My path and my couch Thou hast fanned, And with all my ways hast been acquainted.

content: 4 For there is not a word in my tongue, Lo, O Jehovah, Thou hast known it all!
content_old: 4 For there is not a word in my tongue, Lo, O Jehovah, Thou hast known it all!

content: 5 Behind and before Thou hast besieged me, And Thou dost place on me Thy hand.
content_old: 5 Behind and before Thou hast besieged me, And Thou dost place on me Thy hand.

content: 6 Knowledge too wonderful for me, It hath been set on high, I am not able for it.
content_old: 6 Knowledge too wonderful for me, It hath been set on high, I am not able for it.

content: 7 Whither do I go from Thy Spirit? And whither from Thy face do I flee?
content_old: 7 Whither do I go from Thy Spirit? And whither from Thy face do I flee?

content: 8 If I ascend the heavens—there Thou art, And spread out a couch in Sheol, lo, Thee!
content_old: 8 If I ascend the heavens—there Thou art, And spread out a couch in Sheol, lo, Thee!

content: 9 I take the wings of morning, I dwell in the uttermost part of the sea,
content_old: 9 I take the wings of morning, I dwell in the uttermost part of the sea,

content: 10 Also there Thy hand doth lead me, And Thy right hand doth hold me.
content_old: 10 Also there Thy hand doth lead me, And Thy right hand doth hold me.

content: 11 And I say, ‘Surely darkness bruiseth me, Then night is light to me.
content_old: 11 And I say, ‘Surely darkness bruiseth me, Then night is light to me.

content: 12 Also darkness hideth not from Thee, And night as day shineth, as is darkness so is light.
content_old: 12 Also darkness hideth not from Thee, And night as day shineth, as is darkness so is light.

content: 13 For Thou—Thou hast possessed my reins, Thou dost cover me in my mother’s belly.
content_old: 13 For Thou—Thou hast possessed my reins, Thou dost cover me in my mother’s belly.

content: 14 I confess Thee, because that with wonders I have been distinguished. Wonderful are Thy works, And my soul is knowing it well.
content_old: 14 I confess Thee, because that with wonders I have been distinguished. Wonderful are Thy works, And my soul is knowing it well.

content: 15 My substance was not hid from Thee, When I was made in secret, Curiously wrought in the lower part of earth.
content_old: 15 My substance was not hid from Thee, When I was made in secret, Curiously wrought in the lower part of earth.

content: 16 Mine unformed substance Thine eyes saw, And on Thy book all of them are written, The days they were formed—And not one among them.
content_old: 16 Mine unformed substance Thine eyes saw, And on Thy book all of them are written, The days they were formed—And not one among them.

content: 17 And to me how precious have been Thy thoughts, O God, how great hath been their sum!
content_old: 17 And to me how precious have been Thy thoughts, O God, how great hath been their sum!

content: 18 I recount them! than the sand they are more, I have waked, and I am still with Thee.
content_old: 18 I recount them! than the sand they are more, I have waked, and I am still with Thee.

content: 19 Dost Thou slay, O God, the wicked? Then, men of blood, turn aside from me!
content_old: 19 Dost Thou slay, O God, the wicked? Then, men of blood, turn aside from me!

content: 20 Who exchange Thee for wickedness, Lifted up to vanity are Thine enemies.
content_old: 20 Who exchange Thee for wickedness, Lifted up to vanity are Thine enemies.

content: 21 Do not I hate, Jehovah, those hating Thee? And with Thy withstanders grieve myself?
content_old: 21 Do not I hate, Jehovah, those hating Thee? And with Thy withstanders grieve myself?

content: 22 With perfect hatred I have hated them, Enemies they have become to me.
content_old: 22 With perfect hatred I have hated them, Enemies they have become to me.

content: 23 Search me, O God, and know my heart, Try me, and know my thoughts,
content_old: 23 Search me, O God, and know my heart, Try me, and know my thoughts,

content: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Deliver me, O Jehovah, from an evil man, From one of violence Thou keepest me.
content_old: 1 To the Overseer.—A Psalm of David. Deliver me, O Jehovah, from an evil man, From one of violence Thou keepest me.

content: 2 Who have devised evils in the heart, All the day they assemble for wars.
content_old: 2 Who have devised evils in the heart, All the day they assemble for wars.

content: 3 They sharpened their tongue as a serpent, Poison of an adder is under their lips. Selah.
content_old: 3 They sharpened their tongue as a serpent, Poison of an adder is under their lips. Selah.

content: 4 Preserve me, Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked, From one of violence Thou keepest me, Who have devised to overthrow my steps.
content_old: 4 Preserve me, Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked, From one of violence Thou keepest me, Who have devised to overthrow my steps.

content: 5 The proud hid a snare for me—and cords, They spread a net by the side of the path, Snares they have set for me. Selah.
content_old: 5 The proud hid a snare for me—and cords, They spread a net by the side of the path, Snares they have set for me. Selah.

content: 6 I have said to Jehovah, ‘My God art Thou, Hear, Jehovah, the voice of my supplications.’
content_old: 6 I have said to Jehovah, ‘My God art Thou, Hear, Jehovah, the voice of my supplications.’

content: 7 O Jehovah, my Lord, strength of my salvation, Thou hast covered my head in the day of armour.
content_old: 7 O Jehovah, my Lord, strength of my salvation, Thou hast covered my head in the day of armour.

content: 8 Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked, His wicked device bring not forth, They are high. Selah.
content_old: 8 Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked, His wicked device bring not forth, They are high. Selah.

content: 9 The chief of my surrounders, The perverseness of their lips covereth them.
content_old: 9 The chief of my surrounders, The perverseness of their lips covereth them.

content: 10 They cause to fall on themselves burning coals, Into fire He doth cast them, Into deep pits—they arise not.
content_old: 10 They cause to fall on themselves burning coals, Into fire He doth cast them, Into deep pits—they arise not.

content: 11 A talkative man is not established in the earth, One of violence—evil hunteth to overflowing.
content_old: 11 A talkative man is not established in the earth, One of violence—evil hunteth to overflowing.

content: 12 I have known that Jehovah doth execute The judgment of the afflicted, The judgment of the needy.
content_old: 12 I have known that Jehovah doth execute The judgment of the afflicted, The judgment of the needy.

content: 1 A Psalm, by David. O Jehovah, I have called Thee, haste to me, Give ear to my voice when I call to Thee.
content_old: 1 A Psalm, by David. O Jehovah, I have called Thee, haste to me, Give ear to my voice when I call to Thee.

content: 2 My prayer is prepared—incense before Thee, The lifting up of my hands—the evening present.
content_old: 2 My prayer is prepared—incense before Thee, The lifting up of my hands—the evening present.

content: 3 Set, O Jehovah, a watch for my mouth, Watch Thou over the door of my lips.
content_old: 3 Set, O Jehovah, a watch for my mouth, Watch Thou over the door of my lips.

content: 4 Incline not my heart to an evil thing, To do habitually actions in wickedness, With men working iniquity, Yea, I eat not of their pleasant things.
content_old: 4 Incline not my heart to an evil thing, To do habitually actions in wickedness, With men working iniquity, Yea, I eat not of their pleasant things.

content: 5 The righteous doth beat me in kindness. And doth reprove me, Oil of the head my head disalloweth not, For still my prayer is about their vexations.
content_old: 5 The righteous doth beat me in kindness. And doth reprove me, Oil of the head my head disalloweth not, For still my prayer is about their vexations.

content: 6 Their judges have been released by the sides of a rock, And they have heard my sayings, For they have been pleasant.
content_old: 6 Their judges have been released by the sides of a rock, And they have heard my sayings, For they have been pleasant.

content: 7 As one tilling and ripping up in the land, Have our bones been scattered at the command of Saul.
content_old: 7 As one tilling and ripping up in the land, Have our bones been scattered at the command of Saul.

content: 8 But to Thee, O Jehovah, my Lord, are mine eyes, In Thee I have trusted, Make not bare my soul.
content_old: 8 But to Thee, O Jehovah, my Lord, are mine eyes, In Thee I have trusted, Make not bare my soul.

content: 9 Keep me from the gin they laid for me, Even snares of workers of iniquity.
content_old: 9 Keep me from the gin they laid for me, Even snares of workers of iniquity.

content: 1 An Instruction of David, a Prayer when he is in the cave. My voice is unto Jehovah, I cry, My voice is unto Jehovah, I entreat grace.
content_old: 1 An Instruction of David, a Prayer when he is in the cave. My voice is unto Jehovah, I cry, My voice is unto Jehovah, I entreat grace.

content: 2 I pour forth before Him my meditation, My distress before Him I declare.
content_old: 2 I pour forth before Him my meditation, My distress before Him I declare.

content: 3 When my spirit hath been feeble in me, Then Thou hast known my path; In the way in which I walk, They have hid a snare for me.
content_old: 3 When my spirit hath been feeble in me, Then Thou hast known my path; In the way in which I walk, They have hid a snare for me.

content: 4 Looking on the right hand—and seeing, And I have none recognizing; Perished hath refuge from me, There is none inquiring for my soul.
content_old: 4 Looking on the right hand—and seeing, And I have none recognizing; Perished hath refuge from me, There is none inquiring for my soul.

content: 5 I have cried unto thee, O Jehovah, I have said, ‘Thou art my refuge, My portion in the land of the living.’
content_old: 5 I have cried unto thee, O Jehovah, I have said, ‘Thou art my refuge, My portion in the land of the living.’

content: 6 Attend Thou unto my loud cry, For I have become very low, Deliver Thou me from my pursuers, For they have been stronger than I.
content_old: 6 Attend Thou unto my loud cry, For I have become very low, Deliver Thou me from my pursuers, For they have been stronger than I.

content: 1 A Psalm of David. O Jehovah, hear my prayer, Give ear unto my supplications, In Thy faithfulness answer me—in Thy righteousness.
content_old: 1 A Psalm of David. O Jehovah, hear my prayer, Give ear unto my supplications, In Thy faithfulness answer me—in Thy righteousness.

content: 2 And enter not into judgment with Thy servant, For no one living is justified before Thee.
content_old: 2 And enter not into judgment with Thy servant, For no one living is justified before Thee.

content: 3 For an enemy hath pursued my soul, He hath bruised to the earth my life, He hath caused me to dwell in dark places, As the dead of old.
content_old: 3 For an enemy hath pursued my soul, He hath bruised to the earth my life, He hath caused me to dwell in dark places, As the dead of old.

content: 4 And my spirit in me is become feeble, Within me is my heart become desolate.
content_old: 4 And my spirit in me is become feeble, Within me is my heart become desolate.

content: 5 I have remembered days of old, I have meditated on all Thine acts, On the work of Thy hand I muse.
content_old: 5 I have remembered days of old, I have meditated on all Thine acts, On the work of Thy hand I muse.

content: 6 I have spread forth my hands unto Thee, My soul is as a weary land for Thee. Selah.
content_old: 6 I have spread forth my hands unto Thee, My soul is as a weary land for Thee. Selah.

content: 7 Haste, answer me, O Jehovah, My spirit hath been consumed, Hide not Thou Thy face from me, Or I have been compared with those going down to the pit.
content_old: 7 Haste, answer me, O Jehovah, My spirit hath been consumed, Hide not Thou Thy face from me, Or I have been compared with those going down to the pit.

content: 8 Cause me to hear in the morning Thy kindness, For in Thee I have trusted, Cause me to know the way that I go, For unto Thee I have lifted up my soul.
content_old: 8 Cause me to hear in the morning Thy kindness, For in Thee I have trusted, Cause me to know the way that I go, For unto Thee I have lifted up my soul.

content: 9 Deliver me from mine enemies, O Jehovah, Near Thee I am covered.
content_old: 9 Deliver me from mine enemies, O Jehovah, Near Thee I am covered.

content: 10 Teach me to do Thy good pleasure, For Thou art my God—Thy Spirit is good, Lead me into a land of uprightness.
content_old: 10 Teach me to do Thy good pleasure, For Thou art my God—Thy Spirit is good, Lead me into a land of uprightness.

content: 11 For Thy name’s sake O Jehovah, Thou dost quicken me, In Thy righteousness, Thou bringest out from distress my soul,
content_old: 11 For Thy name’s sake O Jehovah, Thou dost quicken me, In Thy righteousness, Thou bringest out from distress my soul,

content: 1 By David. Blessed is Jehovah my rock, who is teaching My hands for war, my fingers for battle.
content_old: 1 By David. Blessed is Jehovah my rock, who is teaching My hands for war, my fingers for battle.

content: 2 My kind one, and my bulwark, My tower, and my deliverer, My shield, and in whom I have trusted, Who is subduing my people under me!
content_old: 2 My kind one, and my bulwark, My tower, and my deliverer, My shield, and in whom I have trusted, Who is subduing my people under me!

content: 3 Jehovah, what is man that Thou knowest him? Son of man, that Thou esteemest him?
content_old: 3 Jehovah, what is man that Thou knowest him? Son of man, that Thou esteemest him?

content: 4 Man to vanity hath been like, His days are as a shadow passing by.
content_old: 4 Man to vanity hath been like, His days are as a shadow passing by.

content: 5 Jehovah, incline Thy heavens and come down, Strike against mountains, and they smoke.
content_old: 5 Jehovah, incline Thy heavens and come down, Strike against mountains, and they smoke.

content: 6 Send forth lightning, and scatter them, Send forth Thine arrows, and trouble them,
content_old: 6 Send forth lightning, and scatter them, Send forth Thine arrows, and trouble them,

content: 7 Send forth Thy hand from on high, Free me, and deliver me from many waters, From the hand of sons of a stranger,
content_old: 7 Send forth Thy hand from on high, Free me, and deliver me from many waters, From the hand of sons of a stranger,

content: 8 Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
content_old: 8 Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

content: 9 O God, a new song I sing to Thee, On a psaltery of ten strings I sing praise to Thee.
content_old: 9 O God, a new song I sing to Thee, On a psaltery of ten strings I sing praise to Thee.

content: 10 Who is giving deliverance to kings, Who is freeing David His servant from the sword of evil.
content_old: 10 Who is giving deliverance to kings, Who is freeing David His servant from the sword of evil.

content: 11 Free me, and deliver me From the hand of sons of a stranger, Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand is a right hand of falsehood,
content_old: 11 Free me, and deliver me From the hand of sons of a stranger, Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand is a right hand of falsehood,

content: 12 Because our sons are as plants, Becoming great in their youth, Our daughters as hewn stones, Polished—the likeness of a palace,
content_old: 12 Because our sons are as plants, Becoming great in their youth, Our daughters as hewn stones, Polished—the likeness of a palace,

content: 13 Our garners are full, bringing out from kind to kind, Our flocks are bringing forth thousands, Ten thousands in our out-places,
content_old: 13 Our garners are full, bringing out from kind to kind, Our flocks are bringing forth thousands, Ten thousands in our out-places,

content: 14 Our oxen are carrying, there is no breach, And there is no outgoing, And there is no crying in our broad places.
content_old: 14 Our oxen are carrying, there is no breach, And there is no outgoing, And there is no crying in our broad places.

content: 1 Praise by David. I exalt Thee, my God, O king, And bless Thy name to the age and for ever.
content_old: 1 Praise by David. I exalt Thee, my God, O king, And bless Thy name to the age and for ever.

content: 2 Every day do I bless Thee, And praise Thy name to the age and for ever.
content_old: 2 Every day do I bless Thee, And praise Thy name to the age and for ever.

content: 3 Great is Jehovah, and praised greatly, And of His greatness there is no searching.
content_old: 3 Great is Jehovah, and praised greatly, And of His greatness there is no searching.

content: 4 Generation to generation praiseth Thy works, And Thy mighty acts they declare.
content_old: 4 Generation to generation praiseth Thy works, And Thy mighty acts they declare.

content: 5 The honour—the glory of Thy majesty, And the matters of Thy wonders I declare.
content_old: 5 The honour—the glory of Thy majesty, And the matters of Thy wonders I declare.

content: 6 And the strength of Thy fearful acts they tell, And Thy greatness I recount.
content_old: 6 And the strength of Thy fearful acts they tell, And Thy greatness I recount.

content: 7 The memorial of the abundance of Thy goodness they send forth. And Thy righteousness they sing.
content_old: 7 The memorial of the abundance of Thy goodness they send forth. And Thy righteousness they sing.

content: 8 Gracious and merciful is Jehovah, Slow to anger, and great in kindness.
content_old: 8 Gracious and merciful is Jehovah, Slow to anger, and great in kindness.

content: 9 Good is Jehovah to all, And His mercies are over all His works.
content_old: 9 Good is Jehovah to all, And His mercies are over all His works.

content: 10 Confess Thee O Jehovah, do all Thy works, And Thy saints do bless Thee.
content_old: 10 Confess Thee O Jehovah, do all Thy works, And Thy saints do bless Thee.

content: 11 The honour of Thy kingdom they tell, And of Thy might they speak,
content_old: 11 The honour of Thy kingdom they tell, And of Thy might they speak,

content: 12 To make known to sons of men His mighty acts, The honour of the majesty of His kingdom.
content_old: 12 To make known to sons of men His mighty acts, The honour of the majesty of His kingdom.

content: 13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages, And Thy dominion is in all generations.
content_old: 13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages, And Thy dominion is in all generations.

content: 14 Jehovah is supporting all who are falling, And raising up all who are bowed down.
content_old: 14 Jehovah is supporting all who are falling, And raising up all who are bowed down.

content: 15 The eyes of all unto Thee do look, And Thou art giving to them their food in its season,
content_old: 15 The eyes of all unto Thee do look, And Thou art giving to them their food in its season,

content: 16 Opening Thy hand, and satisfying The desire of every living thing.
content_old: 16 Opening Thy hand, and satisfying The desire of every living thing.

content: 17 Righteous is Jehovah in all His ways, And kind in all His works.
content_old: 17 Righteous is Jehovah in all His ways, And kind in all His works.

content: 18 Near is Jehovah to all those calling Him, To all who call Him in truth.
content_old: 18 Near is Jehovah to all those calling Him, To all who call Him in truth.

content: 19 The desire of those fearing Him He doth, And their cry He heareth, and saveth them.
content_old: 19 The desire of those fearing Him He doth, And their cry He heareth, and saveth them.

content: 20 Jehovah preserveth all those loving Him, And all the wicked He destroyeth.
content_old: 20 Jehovah preserveth all those loving Him, And all the wicked He destroyeth.

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise, O my soul, Jehovah.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise, O my soul, Jehovah.

content: 2 I praise Jehovah during my life, I sing praise to my God while I exist.
content_old: 2 I praise Jehovah during my life, I sing praise to my God while I exist.

content: 3 Trust not in princes—in a son of man, For he hath no deliverance.
content_old: 3 Trust not in princes—in a son of man, For he hath no deliverance.

content: 4 His spirit goeth forth, he returneth to his earth, In that day have his thoughts perished.
content_old: 4 His spirit goeth forth, he returneth to his earth, In that day have his thoughts perished.

content: 5 O the happiness of him Who hath the God of Jacob for his help, His hope is on Jehovah his God,
content_old: 5 O the happiness of him Who hath the God of Jacob for his help, His hope is on Jehovah his God,

content: 6 Making the heavens and earth, The sea and all that is in them, Who is keeping truth to the age,
content_old: 6 Making the heavens and earth, The sea and all that is in them, Who is keeping truth to the age,

content: 7 Doing judgment for the oppressed, Giving bread to the hungry.
content_old: 7 Doing judgment for the oppressed, Giving bread to the hungry.

content: 8 Jehovah is loosing the prisoners, Jehovah is opening (the eyes of) the blind, Jehovah is raising the bowed down, Jehovah is loving the righteous,
content_old: 8 Jehovah is loosing the prisoners, Jehovah is opening (the eyes of) the blind, Jehovah is raising the bowed down, Jehovah is loving the righteous,

content: 9 Jehovah is preserving the strangers, The fatherless and widow He causeth to stand, And the way of the wicked He turneth upside down.
content_old: 9 Jehovah is preserving the strangers, The fatherless and widow He causeth to stand, And the way of the wicked He turneth upside down.

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! For it is good to praise our God, For pleasant—comely is praise.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! For it is good to praise our God, For pleasant—comely is praise.

content: 2 Building Jerusalem is Jehovah, The driven away of Israel He gathereth.
content_old: 2 Building Jerusalem is Jehovah, The driven away of Israel He gathereth.

content: 3 Who is giving healing to the broken of heart, And is binding up their griefs.
content_old: 3 Who is giving healing to the broken of heart, And is binding up their griefs.

content: 4 Appointing the number of the stars, To all them He giveth names.
content_old: 4 Appointing the number of the stars, To all them He giveth names.

content: 5 Great is our Lord, and abundant in power, Of His understanding there is no narration.
content_old: 5 Great is our Lord, and abundant in power, Of His understanding there is no narration.

content: 6 Jehovah is causing the meek to stand, Making low the wicked unto the earth.
content_old: 6 Jehovah is causing the meek to stand, Making low the wicked unto the earth.

content: 7 Answer ye to Jehovah with thanksgiving, Sing ye to our God with a harp.
content_old: 7 Answer ye to Jehovah with thanksgiving, Sing ye to our God with a harp.

content: 8 Who is covering the heavens with clouds, Who is preparing for the earth rain, Who is causing grass to spring up on mountains,
content_old: 8 Who is covering the heavens with clouds, Who is preparing for the earth rain, Who is causing grass to spring up on mountains,

content: 9 Giving to the beast its food, To the young of the ravens that call.
content_old: 9 Giving to the beast its food, To the young of the ravens that call.

content: 10 Not in the might of the horse doth He delight, Not in the legs of a man is He pleased.
content_old: 10 Not in the might of the horse doth He delight, Not in the legs of a man is He pleased.

content: 11 Jehovah is pleased with those fearing Him, With those waiting for His kindness.
content_old: 11 Jehovah is pleased with those fearing Him, With those waiting for His kindness.

content: 12 Glorify, O Jerusalem, Jehovah, Praise thy God, O Zion.
content_old: 12 Glorify, O Jerusalem, Jehovah, Praise thy God, O Zion.

content: 13 For He did strengthen the bars of thy gates, He hath blessed thy sons in thy midst.
content_old: 13 For He did strengthen the bars of thy gates, He hath blessed thy sons in thy midst.

content: 14 Who is making thy border peace, With the fat of wheat He satisfieth Thee.
content_old: 14 Who is making thy border peace, With the fat of wheat He satisfieth Thee.

content: 15 Who is sending forth His saying on earth, Very speedily doth His word run.
content_old: 15 Who is sending forth His saying on earth, Very speedily doth His word run.

content: 16 Who is giving snow like wool, Hoar-frost as ashes He scattereth.
content_old: 16 Who is giving snow like wool, Hoar-frost as ashes He scattereth.

content: 17 Casting forth His ice like morsels, Before His cold who doth stand?
content_old: 17 Casting forth His ice like morsels, Before His cold who doth stand?

content: 18 He sendeth forth His word and melteth them, He causeth His wind to blow—the waters flow.
content_old: 18 He sendeth forth His word and melteth them, He causeth His wind to blow—the waters flow.

content: 19 Declaring His words to Jacob, His statutes and His judgments to Israel.
content_old: 19 Declaring His words to Jacob, His statutes and His judgments to Israel.

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens, Praise ye Him in high places.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens, Praise ye Him in high places.

content: 2 Praise ye Him, all His messengers, Praise ye Him, all His hosts.
content_old: 2 Praise ye Him, all His messengers, Praise ye Him, all His hosts.

content: 3 Praise ye Him, sun and moon, Praise ye Him, all stars of light.
content_old: 3 Praise ye Him, sun and moon, Praise ye Him, all stars of light.

content: 4 Praise ye Him, heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens.
content_old: 4 Praise ye Him, heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens.

content: 5 They do praise the name of Jehovah, For He commanded, and they were created.
content_old: 5 They do praise the name of Jehovah, For He commanded, and they were created.

content: 6 And He establisheth them for ever to the age, A statute He gave, and they pass not over.
content_old: 6 And He establisheth them for ever to the age, A statute He gave, and they pass not over.

content: 7 Praise ye Jehovah from the earth, Dragons and all deeps,
content_old: 7 Praise ye Jehovah from the earth, Dragons and all deeps,

content: 8 Fire and hail, snow and vapour, Whirlwind doing His word;
content_old: 8 Fire and hail, snow and vapour, Whirlwind doing His word;

content: 9 The mountains and all heights, Fruit tree, and all cedars,
content_old: 9 The mountains and all heights, Fruit tree, and all cedars,

content: 10 The wild beast, and all cattle, Creeping thing, and winged bird,
content_old: 10 The wild beast, and all cattle, Creeping thing, and winged bird,

content: 11 Kings of earth, and all peoples, Chiefs, and all judges of earth,
content_old: 11 Kings of earth, and all peoples, Chiefs, and all judges of earth,

content: 12 Young men, and also maidens, Aged men, with youths,
content_old: 12 Young men, and also maidens, Aged men, with youths,

content: 13 They praise the name of Jehovah, For His name alone hath been set on high, His honour is above earth and heavens.
content_old: 13 They praise the name of Jehovah, For His name alone hath been set on high, His honour is above earth and heavens.

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! Sing ye to Jehovah a new song, His praise in an assembly of saints.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! Sing ye to Jehovah a new song, His praise in an assembly of saints.

content: 2 Israel doth rejoice in his Maker, Sons of Zion do joy in their king.
content_old: 2 Israel doth rejoice in his Maker, Sons of Zion do joy in their king.

content: 3 They praise His name in a dance, With timbrel and harp sing praise to Him.
content_old: 3 They praise His name in a dance, With timbrel and harp sing praise to Him.

content: 4 For Jehovah is pleased with His people, He beautifieth the humble with salvation.
content_old: 4 For Jehovah is pleased with His people, He beautifieth the humble with salvation.

content: 5 Exult do saints in honour, They sing aloud on their beds.
content_old: 5 Exult do saints in honour, They sing aloud on their beds.

content: 6 The exaltation of God is in their throat, And a two-edged sword in their hand.
content_old: 6 The exaltation of God is in their throat, And a two-edged sword in their hand.

content: 7 To do vengeance among nations, Punishments among the peoples.
content_old: 7 To do vengeance among nations, Punishments among the peoples.

content: 8 To bind their kings with chains, And their honoured ones with fetters of iron,
content_old: 8 To bind their kings with chains, And their honoured ones with fetters of iron,

content: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise ye God in His holy place, Praise Him in the expanse of His strength.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Jah! Praise ye God in His holy place, Praise Him in the expanse of His strength.

content: 2 Praise Him in His mighty acts, Praise Him according to the abundance of His greatness.
content_old: 2 Praise Him in His mighty acts, Praise Him according to the abundance of His greatness.

content: 3 Praise Him with blowing of trumpet, Praise Him with psaltery and harp.
content_old: 3 Praise Him with blowing of trumpet, Praise Him with psaltery and harp.

content: 4 Praise Him with timbrel and dance, Praise Him with stringed instruments and organ.
content_old: 4 Praise Him with timbrel and dance, Praise Him with stringed instruments and organ.

content: 5 Praise Him with cymbals of sounding, Praise Him with cymbals of shouting.
content_old: 5 Praise Him with cymbals of sounding, Praise Him with cymbals of shouting.
